We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist/Analytics Engineer to join a growing team on a 12 month fixed term contract. You will be a member of a small team of people responsible for designing, developing, and maintain a set of software tools that augments and validates the insight gained from the deployment of the FuelActive pick up unit and associated sensors. The role would suit someone with a Computer Science background with knowledge of mathematical, statistical and data science techniques. We are looking for an individual to contribute to the data science approach required for the project. The area of Data Scientist/Analytics is a new competency for FuelActive, as such the successful candidate will be given a high level of freedom on the languages used and the technical solutions deployed. The Role - Context Having secured significant investment and project funding, FuelActive is looking to recruit a Data Scientist/Analytics Engineer to join our growing Engineering team at FuelActive working on our iFuelActive project. The iFuelActive project has already started to expand the capability of the FuelActive business from primarily mechanical engineering to sensor/data/systems/software engineering. The successful candidate will build on this expanding capability and begin the journey of introducing a Data Scientist/Analytics Engineering capability into the FuelActive business. The Data Scientist/Analytics Engineer will work individually or as part of a team to apply advanced analytics and develop solutions which bring demonstrable value to Fuel Active. The purpose of the iFuelActive project is to apply the principles of the Internet of Things (IoT) and to integrate sensors within the proven FuelActive pickup unit and to provide real time information to our customers about the condition of the fuel/tank environment. Initially the role would be for a 12 month period although it is hoped that with a successful completion of the project and with the ongoing development of other projects in the business that opportunities would arise beyond the initial 12 months. The Role You will be responsible for the ideation and development of Advanced Analytics/Machine Learning products in areas such as fuel quality monitoring and predictive maintenance. Using data science techniques to solve technical problems with a data driven approach on a combination of inhouse generated data and externally provided data sets Perform exploratory and targeted data manipulation/analysis and statistical analysis Perform data quality assessment, data cleansing and analytics Implementation of processes to allow the validation of individual data channels, ensuring their accuracy and to detect any anomalies Planning and achieving sprint tasks from which the technical solutions will be created. Work alongside software developers and software engineers to translate algorithms into prototype solutions supporting the data visualisation Contribute directly to the overall design strategy and product concept for the iFuelActive Desired Characteristics Skills and experience required include: Demonstrated skill in feature extraction and real-time analytics development and deployment Experience of solving classical Data Science problems with experience in a range of techniques such as Linear Regression, Random Forest, Classification etc Programming skills such as Python/Java etc SQL and visualisation tools experience Experience of IoT and Telemetry systems Signal processing techniques Agile development process and tools Some understanding of the initial data source is required so knowledge of simple mechanical systems and sensor technology would be a benefit. An enthusiastic, proactive approach to work, with a positive â€œcan doâ€ attitude, capable of delivering results within tight timescales To develop and maintain strong professional relationships with peers providing 3rd party data sets Proven ability to work on own initiative with a minimum of supervision Strong attention to detail Provides an excellent example of professional behaviour Education Education and development background must include: MSc. in a â€œSTEMâ€ subject (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) with a strong industrial focus, or Bachelors/Masters plus experience of analytics development for applications in a commercial/industrial setting or equivalent At least 2 years experience as a Data Scientist/Analytics Engineer Compensation Â· Competitive Seniority Level and Reporting Structure Middle Reports to the CTO Employment Type 12 month contract Combination of remote working and working in the Fuel Active Technology Centre at Taffâ€™s Well, near Cardiff, Wales, UK Job Functions Â· Technology/Product Development - Data Scientist/Analytics Engineer Show more Show less

Weâ€™re building an outstanding alternative to university and corporate training, to develop a diverse group of future leaders. Our unique apprenticeships serve as an alternative to the traditional college and university system. This role can be based out of our London or Haywards Heath office - with flexibility for remote working arrangements. Data Cleansing, Profiling and Enrichment in production. Examples of Data Visualisations produced, including tools and outputs. Work management through Agile/Scrum methodologies. Understanding of Serverless and Event Driven concepts. Advantage to have experience/certifications in the following areas: Statistical modelling experience. Data modelling, and governance in production systems. Financial services industry experience. Analytic tools such as: Python, R, QuickSight, Power BI, Tableau, SSRS. Company Industry: Computer Software, Banking, and Financial Services
Description: Credit Kudos is a venture-backed fintech startup and challenger credit bureau that uses financial behaviour to measure creditworthiness. Our technology transforms the way credit checking and credit scores work by generating a more accurate and holistic view of a borrower's creditworthiness. Weâ€™re working with lenders to help them make better, fairer credit decisions and with consumers to help them access fair, affordable credit. Credit Kudos is looking for a Data Scientist. Weâ€™re building a new kind of credit score powered by real financial behaviour. Weâ€™re looking for a motivated, enthusiastic data scientist who is interested in modelling financial behaviour to improve the financial resilience of consumers and help democratise access to mainstream financial services. Credit plays an integral role in society and without accurate credit scoring we predict a huge section of the population will be unfairly excluded. We're democratising access to credit and removing these false negatives. Youâ€™ll be breaking new ground at the very heart of the business, making decisions that will steer lending outcomes for hundreds of thousands of people. What You'll Be Doing Put simply, youâ€™ll be analysing financial transaction data to understand what factors contribute to credit-worthiness. Weâ€™re building fair models of risk that are backed up by facts, so youâ€™ll be utilising machine learning and predictive analytics to detect patterns in real financial behaviour that lead to defaults in loan repayments. Lending is as much about financial health as it is about propensity to repay, so youâ€™ll be deconstructing and explaining your models to help consumers increase their financial resilience. As experimentation evolves, previously unknown ideas could likely have business impact, so youâ€™ll be prototyping internal tooling for future experimentation. Data Science is an expansive field, so youâ€™ll have the freedom to explore scientific research in work and during dedicated personal development time. Collaborating with the research science team to learn and build upon your data science skillset. Requirements Grounding in statistics/CS theory and core Machine Learning principles. Can take a large dataset and answer key business questions in a repeatable, testable manner. Work in a scientific manner, establishing hypotheses, success criteria and conducting relevant experiments. Experience developing and testing data science models, experience in relevant technology stacks, e.g. R, Python (pandas, scikit-learn), SQL etc Some experience in building APIs or backend services useful but not required. Ideally 2-4 years experience working in a commercial setting in the data science field. Benefits A ton of support, but an opportunity to run your own schedule and role. The opportunity to develop your role and responsibilities as the company grows. Have a real impact on credit scoring changing the industry for the better. A Competitive salary with stock options. A Workplace pension. Flexible working arrangements with 2-3 days in office. MacBook Pro and equipment. Generous leave, a total of 36 days (inc Bank Holidays) A dog-friendly office. Cycle to work scheme. Access to our plush office space at WeWork with bike shed, barista, etc. See full list of benefits - plus a bit more about working for us - here Show more Show less

Description: Our client is a globally respected Engineering, Design and Project Management consultancy. Experience with developing and provisioning sustainable solutions within cloud-based ecosystems (e.g. Microsoft Azure, AWS). Description: Simarco Worldwide Logistics is a family owned, award-winning distribution company providing a range of collection and delivery services throughout mainland UK. Established in 1997, we operate a large, wholly owned fleet of vehicles providing nationwide and local distribution. Simarco is seeking a Data Analyst with a keen interest in data and finance to help drive operational and financial efficiencies throughout our group. This is a full-time, permanent role based in our Witham office. In this role you will be key in developing or enhancing the company's data reporting systems, taking a key role in driving forward a new data strategy and working closely with the management team to process data into BI tools, that will aid operational efficiency. Experience in developing and creating clear and concise data visuals for ease of presentation, a passion for problem solving and an ability to interrogate business data to provide insights for internal stakeholders is key to the role. Duties and Responsibilities Essential Identifying gaps in data quality received from third parties in our supply chain. Create training plans or Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to bridge data gaps. Develop and support reporting processes to monitor data quality improvements. Use data to find the potential, to tighten up processes, reduce errors and reduce external spending. Use data to highlight patterns that demonstrate inefficient processes or transport services. Identify areas to increase efficiency and the automation of manual processes. Set up and maintain automated data processes. Produce and track key performance indicators (KPIs). Prepare reports for internal and external audiences using data reporting tools. Create data dashboards, graphs and easy to understand visuals. Manipulate, analyse and interpret complex data sets relating to the business. Mine and analyse large datasets, detailing areas of concern and present them successfully to management using a reporting tool. Provide competitor benchmarking. Desirable Deliver the training to all areas of the business and ensure they are adopted correctly. Liaise with all parties in the supply chain to fully understand data content. Skills And Qualifications Excellent numerical and data analysis skills. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint and the use of at least one relational database, for example MS Access or Power BI. The capacity to develop and document procedures and workflows The ability to carry out data quality control and validation, so that you can interrogate and challenge business data to provide insights for internal stakeholders.. An understanding of data protection issues. Experience of statistical methodologies and data analysis techniques. The ability to produce clear and concise data visuals for ease of presentation. Passion for problem solving. Ability to deal confidently with colleagues and our preferred supply chain. Ability to work independently and use initiative. Ability to work as part of a team. Strong communication skills. Good interpersonal skills. Organisation skills and workload prioritising. Working Hours Monday to Friday, 37.5 hour per week between 9 a.m. - 5.30 p.m. (this includes a one hour meal break which is unpaid) Salary And Benefits Details Salary depending on experience On-site parking 30 days annual holiday, including Bank Holidays Contributory Pension Scheme Employee Assistance programme Cycle to work scheme No Agencies please Show more Show less

Description: Job Reference # 229250BR City London, United Kingdom Job Type Full Time Your role Are you passionate about data? Do you love solving puzzles? Do you like coming up with new business ideas collaborating with people to make them a reality? Weâ€™re looking for someone like that who will: help us execute on our Digital Platforms strategy to put data at the core of everything we do contribute to the design and development of our new data service as a part of a multidisciplinary hybrid business pod collaborate on the design and delivery of a data curriculum to help empower everyone in the Digital Platforms organisation embrace machine learning and virtualisation technologies to help create data platforms on demand be able to operate at a senior level driving the solutions we need for our business while still being able to dive in to the detail to know how to design the service Your team As a part of the Digital Platforms Transformation and Data team, you will be part of a small team focussed on disrupting the business from within. Company Industry: Research, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals
Description: Junior Data Engineer Achilles Therapeutics is a high growth clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on the development of T cell therapies targeting clonal neoantigens for the treatment of cancer. Originating from pioneering research at Cancer Research UK (CRUK), the Francis Crick Institute and University College London (UCL), we use DNA sequencing data from each patient, together with our proprietary PELEUSâ„¢ bioinformatics platform, to identify clonal neoantigens specific to that patient. From this, we develop personalised T cell therapies and currently have two programs in the clinic for the treatment of Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer and Metastatic Malignant Melanoma. As a company, we are fast-paced and trailblazing. We are breaking new ground with our science, creating products that have never been made. As no-one has done what we are doing before, there is no playbook to copy. This means we must innovate, adapt and collaborate across our organisation, working together to solve novel problems. This entrepreneurial spirit and approach run through our company and those who thrive here are able to cope with anything that is thrown at them, enjoy ambiguity and thrive on making things happen even when there is not a detailed brief. We work hard and deliver a lot. This is a unique opportunity to work with a leading team of scientists with an international reputation for excellence in immuno-oncology research and to become a key contributor to an exciting project destined to change the course of cancer patient management in the clinic. Role Summary The Translational team is responsible for the development and delivery of data and analyses that turn exploratory hypotheses into actionable insights from our clinical trials. To support the automation of our data and analysis pipeline, we are seeking a talented and proactive Junior Data Engineer to support our data management, reporting and analytical capabilities. The successful applicant will be expected to possess a strong knowledge and experience of coding and its best practices. Experience working with large and heterogenous datasets is a key requirement, as is the ability to work within a multidisciplinary team. Requirements This position requires Bachelorâ€™s / Masterâ€™s degree in computing science or equivalent experience Prior experience of working as a Data Engineer or in a DevOps role Experience working and running cloud computing infrastructure e.g. Azure or AWS Experience writing Python/R code in a version controlled environment Comfort working in a Linux command-line environment with shell scripting experience In addition to the above, the following skills/experiences are desirable Demonstrable experience with processing of biological datasets Experience working with the Atlassian toolchain (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence) Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment Successful candidates will also possess good communication skills, a desire to work in a dynamic fast paced multidisciplinary team environment and an ability to manage multiple, concurrent initiatives. Company Industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Staffing and Recruiting
Description: At A Glance Us: Default alive startup of 60+ people. Remote team, mainly based in the UK. YC alumni. Creating a web-based platform for behavioural research. 3x yearly growth, all driven by word-of-mouth. Weâ€™re on a mission to connect people around the world to make trustworthy data more accessible and facilitate world-changing research. You: A commercially-driven data analyst with a passion for experimentation, growth and understanding customer thinking. Location Remote within the UK (and Europe) The tools: SQL, Python, DBT, Metabase Â£40-60k Depending On Skills And Experience. The Role As a complex marketplace platform with a strong focus on data, we know we are sitting on a trove of information that can take our product, and world-class research, to the next level. We are looking for a mid-level Data Analyst who will help us utilise our data to give us the important insights we need to make crucial business decisions. The ideal candidate will be comfortable working with large data sets, and able to use statistics know-how to identify and interpret important patterns in our data. You should have strong experience with SQL and be comfortable with Python. You will have good knowledge of product-driven event and data analytics, and familiarity with using BI tools to communicate your findings. You will be embedded in the Growth Squad, working as part of a cross functional team of developers and designers alongside a product manager. The Growth Squad's goal is to understand and drive growth at Prolific: building awareness of our brand, encouraging customer acquisition, and leveraging referrals to grow the business. You'll also work with our small but excellent team of data analysts, scientists and engineers, where we hope you'll also be a mentor to your team members: boosting the standard of analytics across the team. What You'll Be Doing Analyse how user behaviour drives platform growth, and make recommendations on how to allocate resources to improve this growth. Build predictive models to estimate customer lifetime value from early data points, or identify users who might churn. Implement marketing attribution models so we can understand what website content drives conversion. Conduct AB tests to causally identify product changes which might supercharge growth. This will likely involve some or all of the following: Analyse key growth metrics, retention, stickiness, churn over time etc. and determine causal links between product changes and growth. You will work closely with management and use these data to influence key decisions and help our startup grow quickly. Use BI platforms, such as Metabase, to create visualisations, segment our user base, and develop dashboards to track key growth, data quality, and demographic metrics over time. Develop a clear understanding of our users and intersect this qualitative data with quantitative data and develop a plan of key questions to answer with data. Tell a story with data, writing reports that accurately describe what you've done and that summarise any insights youâ€™ve gained and your confidence in your findings. Minimum Requirements Experience writing high-quality analytic SQL, and be confident with Python. Understanding of statistical practices and common analytical techniques. Experience of product analytics, such as A/B tests, retention and churn metrics. Great verbal and written communication skills, as evidenced by presentations and written reports. Nice To Have Experience building production dashboards in a common BI platform (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc). Knowledge of advanced techniques such as machine learning, or multilevel modelling. Understanding of marketplace dynamics, behavioural research or or business intelligence. Familiarity with qualitative research techniques What we offer Pension (employer contribution 3% of base salary). Flexible working: Work equipment of your choice (paid for by us), and you can work flexibly from home or from our coworking space (also paid for by us). Childcare flexibility: Need to pick your child up from school? No problem. Comprehensive private health insurance that disregards medical history. 33 days holiday per year (25 days + ****bank holidays, which you can switch with your religious holiday). Â£1000 yearly budget for education, growth, and training. Personal growth opportunities and career progression (e.g., learn about the startup ecosystem, mentoring from executive team, learn about psychological science and research methods). Open, transparent, and inclusive culture. A company committed to carbon offsetting: we donate money in your name each month to plant trees and we offset travel as an organization each year. Generous maternity, paternity, and shared parental leave. If your experience doesn't tick all the boxes but you are passionate about joining us, you should definitely apply! We look for people who share our values and can add to our open, transparent, and inclusive culture. The Company At Prolific, we're changing how research on the internet is done. Our co-founders Katia and Phelim started by building a marketplace that connects researchers from both Academia and industry with instant, high-quality, global research participants. Now, as a growing team, our bigger vision is to build the most powerful and trusted platform for behavioral research. We were in Y Combinator's Summer 2019 batch, we've recently closed a $1.4M seed round, we've been growing 3x a year purely through word-of-mouth, we default alive, and we have very ambitious plans. The Interview Process Initial Interview - You'll have a 30 - 45 minute interview with two members of the team where you'll have the opportunity to ask about the company and the role, and we'll ask you questions about your experiences and goals. Assignment - There will be a 2 hour assignment that evaluates skills required for the role. You'll be compensated with a Â£50 voucher for completing the task because we know your time is valuable! Final Interview - The final stage is a 1.5 - 2 hour interview where we'll deep dive into your past experiences, goals, motivations, and skills. You'll speak with two to three members of the team and - as always - have an opportunity to ask questions about the role and company. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Health, Wellness and Fitness
Description: About Peppy Do you want to work for a trailblazing company whose aim is to disrupt and better the world of healthcare? Peppy's mission is to provide support in the moments that matter; when a couple is struggling to conceive, the journey through and post pregnancy, and dealing with menopause. How does it work? Peppy is distributed as an employee benefit and all of our services are delivered through an app, where we connect users with real life practitioners. We're already making a big impact. We've launched Peppy menopause to 700,000 members at Vitality. We've partnered with Santander, Aviva, SAP, Clifford Chance, BNP Paribas, Novartis and Wickes. We've delivered 3 hugely successful NHS trials. This is just the beginning. We have huge growth plans and new services to launch including cancer support, men's health, care for carers and much more. We are looking for awesome people that recognise what a game-changer Peppy is, so if you truly want to make an impact in your day's work, you're in the right place. Your Challenge We are looking for our first full stack analytics engineer to own our data. You'll have a fantastic opportunity to put your stamp on our data solution with the opportunity to start from almost zero. You'll work with the latest technologies to establish Peppy's data function. You'll work closely with our engineering team and spend a lot of time working with different business functions. Company Industry: Translation and Localization
Description: As a trusted global transformation partner, Welocalize accelerates the global business journey by enabling brands and companies to reach, engage, and grow international audiences. Welocalize delivers multilingual content transformation services in translation, localization, and adaptation for over 250 languages with a growing network of over 77,000 in-country linguistic resources. Driving innovation in language services, Welocalize delivers high-quality training data transformation solutions for NLP-enabled machine learning by blending technology and human intelligence to collect, annotate, and evaluate all content types. Our team works across locations in North America, Europe, and Asia serving our global clients in the markets that matter to them. www.welocalize.com To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. OVERVIEW The Data Analyst will contribute to Welocalizeâ€™s industry-leading data analytics team, playing a critical role in supporting some of the organizationâ€™s most important, highest-volume customer relationships. This role will be responsible for using a diverse set of skills to discover strategic insights; guide data-driven decision-making; meet rigorous client requirements around data/reporting, and proactively engaging with both internal and client-side stakeholder teams to facilitate and support data-driven actions. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND EXPECTATIONS Using a listen-first philosophy, quickly form "trusted advisor" relationships with employees, including senior executives; and with stakeholders at Welocalize's client companies. Lead discovery processes with stakeholders to thoroughly identify (and document) the business requirements and expected outcomes. Function as the data analytics lead on the program management team for one or more key client accounts; engage as a regular, active participant in customer calls to support account team(s) with a detailed awareness of and insight into the data pertaining to program performance as well as the impact of actions being taken by the program team. Manage/work a backlog of multiple analytics/reporting projects that support one or more business units. Document progress in the applicable system(s) and communicate to stakeholders about the status of projects in the backlog. Translate business requirements to technical requirements. Collaborate with engineering/technical teams to help shape and drive the development of data infrastructure. Use analysis techniques to explore existing data sources or design new data sources, and to produce reports/data products/analytical solutions. Could include data pertaining to customers, resources, business activity, third parties and/or markets. Proactively/creatively generate original insights to improve business outcomes. Deliver outstanding analytic services focused on solving the right problem in the right way, while delighting partners with swift, decisive, and clearly communicated action. Design data products and analytical solutions for ease of use and comprehension by both internal and external stakeholders; facilitate the deployment, support the utilization, and continuously evolve these data products to ensure business value is added. Develop models to quantify the financial impact of business initiatives and the effects of team recommendations. Contribute both strategic and tactical leadership to the overall business unit(s). Present data products and analytical results to business users, organization leadership and clients. Rely on past experience to provide added value and expertise to employees and team members. Maintain a self-starter mindset to proactively anticipate and address partner needs. QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Bachelorâ€™s degree, or equivalent work experience, preferably in Computer Science, Math, Statistics or IT/IS; post-graduate education or equivalent experience in an applicable field preferred. 1+ year experience producing professional data products, such as reports/dashboards; ad hoc analyses; and/or machine learning models. 3+ years experience preferred. Strong analytical and problem resolution skills, including working familiarity with statistics and statistical concepts. Excellent organizational skills and strong attention to detail. Demonstrated leadership competencies with the ability to collaborate with others and establish working relationships. Excellent written and oral skills necessary to communicate requirements, results and analysis of complex problems; ability to synthesize and articulate the results of complex analyses in plain language for use by a variety of business stakeholders. Preferred: data extraction/integration experience using SQL; ETL tools; and/or other data integration tools. Preferred: experience in data architecture, data modeling, and/or data management & stewardship. Preferred: any knowledge or professional experience in data science, machine learning or artificial intelligence (including data science programming skills, e.g., with Python or R). Foods Connected is a cloud based software platform that helps retailers and food companies across the world manage their supply chain, quality control and trading and planning management. Our mortgage experience spans Buy-to-Let, commercial property, semi-commercial, and residential home loans. In addition, our Treasury team manage both the funding of the portfolios through securitisation and warehouse financing and providing cash management services. We believe our work should make an impact by delivering quality customer service and that we should all be accountable for our actions. We listen to each other, are respectful of our differing experiences and celebrate success when we achieve our goals. Development Value: The role will provide the successful candidate with the opportunity for excellent career growth and fantastic benefits. In addition, we are committed to providing a wide range of learning and development opportunities to help our staff reach their full potential. Description: Audience and Data Manager At Budweiser Brewing Group, Challenge Accepted isn't just a phrase; it's an attitude! That's because we're the world's largest brewer, with iconic brands like Stella Artois, Corona, and Budweiser. We're a team of curious individuals who see every challenge as a new opportunity to do something incredible. We're inventive people who thrive and take ownership of our success. Because we're owners, we take results personally. We dream big, seek new challenges, and push the boundaries of what's possible. The Role ABI is looking for a passionate Data and Audience specialist to be part of our business and unleash the power of the data in provide meaningful insights on audience, improving efficiency and effectiveness for our brands. Responsibilities Design and drive use of audience data to impact media strategies for brands based on overall objectives in partnership with internal media agency (DraftLine, our internal agency) PIXELS & TAXONOMY â€“ Guide Tech team to ensure pixels are implemented correctly. Work with media, activation and strategy teams to ensure taxonomy correctly reflects ABI taxonomy, in addition to the correct audience taxonomy needed for reporting in automated dashboard tools. AUDIENCE SYNDICATION - push these audiences from the CDP or DSP Platforms to their respective destinations as directed by the audience request. The role needs to lead the team in terms of timing to make the audiences available and identify possible drops in Match rate. AUDIENCE CREATION - receive audience request from strategy and activation team, ideate best possible audience options that will drive performance (across both 1st party data and 3rd party data) develop audience in either CDP or working with the Data Science team for advanced audience targeting. Ensure data has populated. Investigate any ingestion issues if they arise. AUDIENCE ACTIVATION: ensure audiences are onboarded correctly across platforms (Facebook, Google Display, DSPs, etc) and monitor together with Measurement Analyst the performance of the audience versus cost. This position is going to have a key role to identify in-flight optimization opportunities. CAMPAIGN LEARNINGS: Lead the learning agenda from a data perspective. Analyze and communicate the performance and insights for the activated audiences, cataloging the learnings across brands and best practices Experience And Skills Required Practical experience in design, build and activate audiences across platforms is mandatory. Knowledge in 1P data capture (eg. website, apps, QR codes) and analytics from granular consumer level data (eg: Cookie, impression-level, UserID, etc). Experience in CDP/DMP segment building and activation is mandatory. Experience in work with Google Tag Manager (GTM) for setup and data collection. Great communication and collaboration skills Great Project Management skills, this role is responsible to coordinate the campaigns with brands, Measurement, Data Science and media teams to ensure the audiences are activated on timing. What You Can Expect From Us In this role, you'll have the potential to transform our business and your career. You'll get the support and mentor you need to succeed. We're a meritocracy, with plenty of room for growth and development, so you know your hard work will be rewarded. We encourage you to think big and go after your goals. You'll get to be creative, work with international teams so you can build a global network and have direct control over your career and where it takes you. Benefits And Perks Benefits for you and your family to help your physical and mental health Competitive parental leave and pension double contributions 25 days holidays per year Employee benefits to help your physical and mental health and overall wellbeing (travel insurance, gym memberships, discounted services, dental etc.) A beer allowance to enjoy our brands 2 volunteer days a year to support your local community 5 employee networks to support diversity and inclusion Global Bonus WPA Private Medical Care As the leading global brewer, we are committed to bringing people together for a better â€“ and more equal â€“ world. A more equal world starts when everyone can thrive. At Budweiser Brewing Group, we value the diversity of cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce. We strongly encourage women, people of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, people with disabilities, and members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. Company Industry: Financial Services
Description: Company: Schroders Role: Client Insights Unit - Data Scientist Location: London Team Description This is a data science role embedded within the Client Insights Unit (CIU) although the role forms part of the wider Data Insights Unit (DIU). The DIU uses data science skills and technologies to unlock the value in data for decision-making and is primarily focused on supporting Investment desks, however, in order to support and nurture a community of data scientists within Schroders, some DIU members are embedded in other functions within the business. The Client Insights Unit (CIU) is a business facing team embedded within the Distribution division, located primarily in London, but serving a diverse and global set of stakeholders at all levels right across Distribution and Marketing. The team is responsible for designing and developing a series scalable tools and widgets to generate and deliver insights into the hands of sales staff, relationship managers and marketing practitioners. This encompasses everything from running data science research projects, to developing proof of concepts, building scalable, automated solutions, and integrating these into the day to day lives of users. Overview of role This role will be focused on the recently formed CIU Data Science team. The team is essentially acting as the bridge between the business and the data. The Data Scientist will engage with internal customers, understand their needs and deliver insights to shape their actions. These will take the form of analysis reports and presentations, the creation of models, prototypes and dashboards using a variety of tools and involvement in the creation of other enabling analyses and tool sets including predictive models. Naturally, this requires a blend of skills including data analysis and statistics as well as communication and business experience. Your day-to-day priorities will be defined by the CIU Data Science Manager, providing a clear picture of where most business value can be created. Youâ€™ll be in close collaboration with the DIU, which can provide mentorship and support on technical areas of the role as well as connecting you to the wider data science community in Schroders. Responsibilities 1. Exploration of new and existing data sets 2. Application of data science techniques to solve stakeholders questions or create actionable insights for sales and marketing 3. Delivery of outcomes and recommendations supporting them using a variety of formats such as documents, dashboards, presentations, etc. 4. Contributing towards the creation of a set of tools, techniques and practices that maximise the impact and efficiency of the team inâ€¦ turning raw data into useful and analysable derived data sets, and developing re-usable analytical and visualisation methods 5. Work with the DIU, CIU Data Science Engineers, and IT to develop and enhance the technical tools including steering the development of the analytics data warehouse for enterprise data, and interconnections with various internal data systems. 6. Sharing data science knowledge to the wider DIU and Distribution Functions. Ideal Profile Â· An interest in investment or finance. Â· Has a natural flair for insightful analysis. Â· Passionate to provide insight and clear information to others so they can make better decisions. Â· Experience working in a data science function within a B2B environment. Â· Experience in CRM systems such as Salesforce. Â· Fascinated by the problem of how to make analysis useful and actionable. Â· Ability to perform and discuss a number of technical information /statistical techniques to a variety of audiences. Skills / Experience Desired Technical Skills Â· Strength in Maths, Statistics and the craft of creating forecasts that non-technical stakeholders can act upon. Â· Predictive analysis, machine learning/modelling experience (supervised and unsupervised techniques for regression/classification/exploration) Â· Excellent data cleaning and processing skills Â· Programming in Python and SQL Â· Effective communication of outcomes, including visualisation and presentation skills. Desired Business Skills Â· Creativity and problem solving Â· Commercial focus Â· Pragmatic, action-oriented Useful Â· Relevant degree subject (e.g. Statistics, OR, Data Science, any Science) Â· Experience with scalable data analysis Â· Asset Management / Investment practices Â· Specific experience with CRM (Salesforce), Sales Teams and Digital analytics Team Culture As a Data Scientist in Schroders, you will also be part of the Data Insights Unit, which is a friendly, lively and exciting team of over 25 data professionals, and welcomes applications from a diverse range of people at all levels of hiring. Schroders supports flexible working practices, including modern technology for remote working. As such we offer a friendly and welcoming home for people with various home/family arrangements. The DIU consciously adopts a strengths-based style of personal development. We strive to understand peopleâ€™s motivations and strengths and orient their roles to play to these. This applies to their immediate role and as part of their ongoing career development into future roles. Schroders offers exceptional benefits, including excellent pension and flexible benefits worth roughly 25% of base salary in total. In addition all team members benefit from Schrodersâ€™ bonus scheme. In this, bonus is shared out across the DIU team with far more weight on team performance than individual performance â€“ we all succeed as a team, and so we share in the rewards as a team. Schroders is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications regardless of sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age. Show more Show less

Company Name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
Company Industry: Health, Wellness and Fitness, Medical Practice, and Hospital & Health Care
Description: Salary: AfC Band 8a Job Type Fixed term contract 18 months due to finding Staff group: Information Directorate Overview We're looking for a passionate, values-driven Data Scientist to support Imperial College Health Partners in delivering complex change by bringing a breadth of economic, statistical, and analytical skills. You will also bring energy and empathy to bear in the development, execution, and management of the data analysis within projects. Main Listing Employer: Imperial College Health Partners Department: Information Directorate Location 30, Euston Square, London Salary: AfC Band 8a Imperial College Health Partners (ICHP) is seeking candidates with a passion for population health and data science to join our growing Information Directorate. Imperial College Health Partners (ICHP) is a partnership organisation bringing together NHS providers of healthcare services, clinical commissioning groups and leading universities across North West London. We have been designated by NHS England as the Academic Health Science Network (AHSN) for North West London, and we are one of 15 AHSNs across England which make up The AHSN Network. ICHP is the host of the Discover-NOW, the Health Data Research Hub for Real World Evidence, which aims to revolutionise the way health data is used responsibly for research into treating and preventing disease. The Hub brings together NHS organisations, globally recognised academic, industry, technology, research, and charity partners as well as patients and the public focussed on the use of real-world health data for research. Our organisation consists of colleagues with a range of talents and experiences; bringing together knowledge, skills, and abilities to the way we connect with our stakeholders. In this way, we can achieve our aim to innovate and collaborate for a healthier population and make a real measurable impact. At a time where collaboration and innovation are crucial to help meet some of healthcareâ€™s most pressing challenges, there has never been a better time to join us. We offer an exciting opportunity to join a high performing team and to work across a combination of real-world data access, tools, technologies, along with experts in the field; providing an unrivalled opportunity to transform the health and care for patients. Role The Data Scientist will support ICHPâ€™s delivery of complex change by bringing a breadth of economic, statistical, and analytical skills. You will also bring energy and empathy to bear in the development, execution, and management of the data analysis within projects. The role primarily focuses on the application of the advanced statistics methods and complex quantitative analysis required to help stakeholders characterise the issues they face, the options they have, or to evaluate the impact of changes made. This requires the postholder to understand why analysis is being undertaken, how the outputs are intended to be used, as well as helping to define how we should undertake a particular method of analysis. The role requires sound understanding and previous experience with statistical methods (such as distributions, statistical testing, regressions, survival methods, difference in differences, propensity score matching, interrupted time series etc) on healthcare data for medical research. The role also interfaces with other colleagues who play key roles in helping to design projects and products for stakeholders and clients â€“ including those with expertise in innovation & design, safety & quality improvement, transformation support, data infrastructure development, and data analysis (including extraction, processing, and visualisation). The successful candidate will actively participate in the development and culture of ICHP as an organisation, sharing responsibility for making ICHP a great place to work. Key Responsibilities Include Population health analytics to help understand the needs of patients within NWL and nationally and how current services can be re- shaped to meet these needs Create statistical models using patient level data from the real-world linked datasets e.g. Discover dataset Delivering on a range of data science projects to both public and private sector clients. Project usually require conducting and interpreting highly complex statistical analysis. Being a domain expert, understanding what information is available to address a specific problem, as well as being able to evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of each approach Designing and developing complex econometric models that are transparent and user-friendly Helping to develop specific analysis, methods, and/or tools that can be used for the purpose of population health improvement. Working with clients and stakeholders from operational, clinical, and commercial backgrounds to understand and define the question we are trying to answer. For informal enquiries: please email Dr Tomasz Szymanski at recruitment@imperialcollegehealthpartners.com For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Dr Tomasz Szymanski Job title: Economics Senior Manager Email address: recruitment@imperialcollegehealthpartners.com Show more Show less

Brexit Statement Following the UK's exit from the European Union, there are changes to Legal Right to Work legislation that applicants from the EU will need to be aware of. Before 30th June 2021, EU/EEA/Swiss citizens have a legal right to work in the UK and can provide a passport as evidence of this. No visa will be required. Description: Role: Data Scientist - HR Location: Kingston Salary: Competitive + great benefits Are you passionate about using data to drive evidence-based decision making? Can you work with sizeable datasets and manipulate them in a logical way to elicit insights with clarity? We are looking for a Data Scientist to work work in our People Analytics team, someone who thinks in a clear and organised manner to help us tackle challenging business problems with data and a mathematical approach. The right candidate would be able to work under time-pressure, generating accurate and complex analysis. The ability to explain complicated concepts to a lay-person would be a key trait and thinking creatively about problem-solving would be critical to the role. Overview The Unilever People Analytics team is a pioneering group of statisticians, data scientists and visualisation experts that utilise advanced statistical techniques to analyse our HR, financial and marketing data. The role encompasses discovering and rationalising historical patterns in large data sets, developing predictive models, creating automated data solutions and researching machine learning techniques that are proprietary to Unilever. What We Are Looking For We are seeking a candidate that can work with speed and accuracy, looking to apply their problem- solving, mathematical and programming skills to business questions through a people-lens. The successful candidate would be able to demonstrate a thirst for learning and a passion for using data to generate insights. Mentoring team members in the application of analytical techniques will be a core requirement. A mature attitude to developing relationships with multiple stakeholders, and tenacity to drive projects forward to tight deadlines and the ability to solve problems on your own will be the key to your success in this role. Experience in a similar capacity would be advantageous to your application although no prior HR experience is needed. Success will be defined through application of your analytical techniques to this new and exciting area. Technical Skills And Qualifications A demonstrable passion for machine learning / data science or statistics is crucial, preferably with a degree in a quantitative subject. A comprehensive understanding of most of the following would be expected: Generalised Linear Models, CART, Random Forests, Clustering, Principal Components Analysis and Network Theory. Experience of Neural Networks would be a plus, but not essential. Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language such as R/ MATLAB/ Python would be essential as well as good working knowledge of SQL Diversity at Unilever is about inclusion, embracing differences, creating possibilities and growing together for better business performance. Previous relevant experience is welcome, as are graduates with no prior experience. In return, Leversys offers: A genuine opportunity to have an impact and grow your career in capital markets FinTech. The ability to develop and apply a unique blend of knowledge and skills. The scope to work on exciting and highly dynamic projects and interact with clients. Personal development support. Sponsorship to enhance your skills and continue your education. Also, confident and able to communicate with high profile clients, if necessary Agility â€“ ability to adapt and modify solutions based on changing requirements Full ownership over your work and attention to detail Diversity and Flexibility Hogarth is committed to diversity and inclusion, through our ideas, our people, how we behave and conduct ourselves. ABOUT US Weâ€™re the UKâ€™s leading digital triage platform are seeking an ambitious, experienced B2B marketer to build and grow our marketing share in Primary care. Our mission is to transform the way that healthcare is delivered. We believe that our National Health Service should thrive. Our products are clinically led and have been designed to help GP practices, hospitals and the healthcare system, access safe and effective triage. We are proud to say our products are widely adopted; eConsult is used in well over 3,000 practices in the United Kingdom and growing fast. The market is increasingly competitive and we need to shift gear to maintain and grow our market share. We are also preparing for international expansion. We are an innovative, ambitious, ethical and entrepreneurial business. Our team is 90+ people strong and growing (and weâ€™ve more than doubled in the last 12 months). ROLE SUMMARY This is a new role that requires strong analytical experience and relentless curiosity to help us dive deeper into understanding our audience, our market and our performance. Underneath this, youâ€™re in charge of marketing data â€“ itâ€™s quality, the tracking and monitoring â€“ and lead any initiatives to gain market intelligence through research. This is a new area and needs to be built from the ground up, establishing accurate tracking and reporting to help the department tick. Insight Driven Decisioning (30%) Support the team with key intelligence to support the strategy and go-to-market approaches: Provide actionable customer and campaign insights to address key strategic questions Build marketing segmentation and targeting, leveraging data and analytics to develop robust segmentation modelling to lead our go-to-market strategy. Campaign set-up and data management (30%) Establish data collection process & ensure quality data input into all systems Campaign set up in Salesforce and Pardot Work with marketing team to establish measurement method for all marketing campaign to ensure performance can be tracked, including integration with internal systems Take responsibility for marketing automation and system integration in order to optimise marketing effectiveness and efficiency. Marketing Effectiveness (30%) Establish & maintain marketing dashboards and reporting suite to support visibility against KPIs as well as allow interrogation of campaign data Visualise and tell a story with data, using charts, graphs and other visual aids to inform decision making at various levels across the business Provide clear understanding of impact of marketing - whatâ€™s working, whatâ€™s not and why Regularly develop, review and present data reporting for marketing department and to internal stakeholders when required Support budget tracking and analysis Provide recommendations to improve activities. Relationships, Contribution and Integrity (10%) Collaborate with Marketing Managers and other business analysts Build our own â€˜best practiceâ€™ model for eConsult, documenting and sharing Feedback and seek feedback to improve personal performance and support others Input into the wider thinking to create a leading marketing function. SUCCESS IN ROLE Shared responsibility of marketing targets (revenue, leads, budget) Contribution to positive culture and team development YOUR EXPERIENCE Degree level or equivalent in marketing or relevant subject plus 2-3+ yearsâ€™ experience marketing analytics Experience in marketing analytics using external and internal customer data. Knowledge of using database queries (SQL) and advanced spreadsheet skills (Excel) Experience using web analytics tools (GA), statistical analysis tools, and CRM tools (SFDC essential & Pardot â€“ highly desirable) Experience of segmentation modelling desirable but not essential Bags of curiosity and aptitude for learning - drive to keep pushing for deeper insights â€“ to add value to the team WE OFFER 25 days annual leave entitlement plus bank holidays Remote working for 2-3 days per week during interim period following lockdown Life assurance Rewards for success; we are results driven and offer bonuses based on performance Contributory pension scheme A remarkable opportunity to join an ethically entrepreneurial business where you can make a real positive difference Show more Show less

Company Industry: Retail
Description: About us We're The Very Group, home to Very.co.uk, Littlewoods.com and a team of 4,000 super-talented people. We're the UK's largest integrated digital retailer and financial services provider, and we've been helping customers say yes when it matters most for over 100 years. In that time, we've consistently reinvented our business to adapt to economic conditions and industry changes - going from bricks, to clicks, to mobile. But despite our passion for reinvention, we've never wavered from our purpose; to make good things easily accessible to more people. It means giving our customers the brands they love, an outstanding shopping experience and flexible ways to spread the cost. We've continued to deliver for our customers throughout the Covid-19 outbreak - and we've done it by transforming the way we work. The role itself will be a mix of on-site vs remote, we've adapted well to remote ways of working and will continue to embrace those practices moving forward. We're fired up for the future and the next stage in our development. We'll give customers access to more great brands for themselves and their families, a seamless shopping experience and even more control of their finances through innovation in flexible ways to pay. The role In a nutshell, you'll be analysing, validating, specifying, verifying and managing the business needs of initiative stakeholders, which includes our customers and end users. The role is varied, so no 2 days will be the same (as cliche as that sounds), some of the work will be complex and non-routine and you'll be able to choose the tools and techniques that help you to deliver the right customer and business outcomes. You have the advantage of coming in to this in the early days, so you'll be able to define the project scope and do your investigation, analysis, review and clear articulation of processes and requirements. We're a big company, and you'll be speaking and liasing with a lot of your colleagues across the business, ranging from people in your own tribe, to other tribes and departments, and also stakeholders; so strong communication skills are a must. The team You'll be joining one of our cross-functional squads within our DNA (Data, iNsight, Action) Tribe. We are on quite an ambitious journey to modernise our Data domain, using new cutting edge technology. This Data domain feeds our Data Science, Analytics, Strategy and Engineering teams. What you need We know you're much more than just a skill-set. Obviously though to set yourself up for success, we'd need a couple of things... Agile experience is essential Data experience would be nice, although if you have other tech experience, then that would work too. Benefits Annual Bonus 30 days holiday + bank holidays (opportunity to buy / sell) Up to 6% matched pension Â£1000 additional benefits allowance to choose things like healthcare, life assurance and more Up to 25% off at Very Remote/office split Ongoing training and development Next Steps If you're interested to find out more please contact Jordan Barlow in the talent acquisition team or apply online. If you are an internal candidate looking to refer someone in please follow the referals process and guidelines Please note that the talent acquisition team are managing this vacancy directly, and if successful in securing this position, you may be required to undertake a credit, CIFAS and CRB check. Youâ€™ll have a â€˜can do attitudeâ€™ and the ability to work in a fast paced, Agile environment. Youâ€™ll have the ability to work with cross functional technical teams, quickly getting up to speed with understanding our products and services and the markets within which we operate. As an experienced Business Analyst we expect that you have experience with gathering and documenting requirements, building user stories, working with software teams and delivering on project deadlines. As an established member of the team youâ€™ll be happy to help those around you and to positively contribute to shaping the culture of our organisation. Supporting the product teams by defining requirements covering the functional, non functional, data and infrastructure requirements for all new changes and projects Benefits Who are we and what can you expect from us? Our company is authentic, we are in our growth phase, we aren't perfect nor do we have all of the answers but we operate in an open and collaborative way, where we challenge and encourage one another to learn and evolve together. Due to being part of a wider group we are lucky enough to have a brand new office that is equipped with great facilities like real time status boards, good coffee, drinks, snacks and super fast internet connectivity, we also have split working areas, chillout / creative spots and of course an area where we can come together to socialise. Company Industry: Marketing and Advertising and Internet
Description: About DQ&A DQ&A is a digital marketing consultancy with a focus on technology, data and people. Our specialists build solutions that embrace the power of technology, the truth of data and a spark of human creativity. We help advertisers, agencies and publishers get the most from digital for their business. As Googleâ€™s most experienced EMEA Sales Partner we have overseen hundreds of deployments across the Google Marketing Platform. We do this by addressing ad tech infrastructure, data management, integration, media management and provide clients with relevant and up-to-date digital marketing services and consultancy. Established in 2001, with offices in 15 countries, we are part of the Incubeta group. A global partnership of leading digital technology, media and creative specialists including DQ&A, Joystick, and NMPi. Together, we are experts in end-to-end digital advertising services and media solutions. The Role As an Analytics Consultant youâ€™ll be working on technical analytics implementation projects with household brands in fashion, media, and ecommerce. The team work on a project basis across marketing attribution and web analytics using a variety of tools (Google Analytics & GA 360 Suite, Google Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics, Big Query and Google Cloud Platform). Youâ€™ll be leading on tagging implementation, maintenance and troubleshooting; from working with the client to create bespoke measurement strategies to performing technical analytics audits and custom implementation, youâ€™ll be an expert in this area. You will be an expert in at least one Tag Management System, will have demonstrable experience using JavaScript for advanced tag management and a solid understanding of dataLayer implementation best practices. You will approach tasks logically and be capable of communicating pros & cons of potential solutions with relevant parties before implementing the most favourable approach. Youâ€™ll also get the opportunity to collaborate with other teams in the agency (Paid Search, Paid Social and Programmatic Display) on implementation projects across a variety of partners. You may also get the chance to attend relevant industry events to meet our clients and partners, and we can provide you with the opportunity to speak at these events if you would like. Work Culture & Benefits At DQ&A we manage by outcomes and place an emphasis on learning and innovation. We have two UK offices and are happy for the successful candidate to be based from either. Our London office is based in Old Street, on the 16th Floor of the Bower Building. The Opportunity Our projects are chosen for their potential to change people's lives. A colleague recently said â€œI joined for the combination of mad ambition and serious strategy.â€ Recent examples of projects our data analysts worked on include: Exclusions Data Analysis â€“ we recently analysed local authority social care and education data (bringing together 700 datasets) and did user research with decision makers to find new ways to help reduce exclusions. We showed that girls were actually being â€˜excludedâ€™ at a higher rate than boys and that their exclusions were hidden by official definitions. Our findings featured in The Guardian. Weâ€™re now working on ways to help all local authorities replicate that analysis and have started to develop a new intervention to address the needs of the high-risk students which the analysis identified. Edge of Care Commissioning Tool: Our team developed an analytical model to support childrenâ€™s social care commissioners identify children at risk of entering care and what support to provide. The model identified children most at risk of entering care as well as eligibility for specialist services. The tool helped 15+ local authorities build the case for investing in preventative services which kept 350 children with their parents instead of being removed into local authority care. Greater Manchester Data Platform â€“ our team are helping Greater Manchester to work out: what use cases exist for a common data platform across a range of public services; what technical, ethical, political, and change management barriers would need to be overcome to realise those; what a roadmap to creating it might entail. Currently in discovery, and we hope to work on the build as well. The work is extremely broad â€“ ranging across predictive risk modelling; classic business intelligence; developing data standards; data engineering; advice on the ethics of data collaborations; and training partnersâ€™ data scientists. This breadth is intentional. Rather than trying to develop our own leadership in a single area, we are trying to achieve social change and we take on this wide variety of challenges because these challenges are what lie between us and our goals. You will need to be someone who is excited by that breadth â€“ and by the frequent need for teams to blend technical with policy and service delivery expertise to identify the right solution. Our partnersâ€™ data, technology, and in-house capability often constrain what we can do. So, youâ€™ll need to be more energised by that potential for social impact than by getting to use cutting edge data science approaches. Youâ€™ll need to think of creative ways to work around those constraints and consider that a part of the fun. About You We expect that your skills and experience will make you comfortable in: Quantitative analysis, using at least one of Python, R or SQL â€“ working with messy datasets to help solve strategic and operational problems for the public sector, charities, and impact-focussed businesses. Communicating insights to non-data people â€“ whether through a conversation, a report, or data visualisation youâ€™ll need to be able to help busy decision makers to act on what youâ€™re finding Working as a Consultant â€“ with the ensuing requirement for excellent time management, balancing multi-projects at the same time, and teamwork. Also being comfortable with ambiguity as the team develops over time a better understanding of the problem, and what might solve it. Youâ€™ll also need to be interested in bringing ethics into your work â€“ thinking about how design decisions exacerbate or counter problems such as structural racism and algorithmic bias, or the tendency towards state surveillance of disadvantaged populations. Experience of data engineering challenges would be a bonus, as would experience of public policy, working in the not-for-profit sector, experience of strategy development, or experience of a consulting environment. Our Commitment to You Social Finance offers a range of training and development support, using both in-house expertise and external partners to develop and deliver our training programmes. Alongside the Project Managers you work with day to day, your Line Manager will support you in your career planning and personal development. All new staff have a buddy in place to help them learn about life at Social Finance. The fixed salary for this position is Â£40,000 per annum. We offer a generous holiday allowance plus bank holidays and corporate leave between Christmas and New Year when the office is closed. We also offer a contributory stakeholder pension scheme, plus an uplift in salary allowance to spend on other benefits, season ticket loans, bike to work schemes and Give as you Earn via salary sacrifice. Encouraging community and wellbeing is important to us. We have a health and wellbeing plan to encourage better working practices for individuals. Social Finance is a disability confident committed employer as well as a founding signature of the UK social investment sectorâ€™s Diversity Forum manifesto. About Social Finance We are an ambitious not for profit group organisation aiming to achieve lasting social change that enables people to lead fulfilling lives. We collaborate with governments, funders, community organisations and the wider social sector to create breakthrough solutions to challenging social problems in the UK and internationally. Founded in 2007, our team shares a passion for social impact and includes over 100 employees with a blend of experiences from the public, commercial and voluntary sectors. Our people bring a unique set of skills in digital, data, research, operations, policy, facilitation and financial analysis that is highly valued by our partners in social change. We are based in Vauxhall, London with sister organisations in the US, Israel, India and the Netherlands, as part of the Social Finance Global Network. We are regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority. Our Data and Digital Team In 2015 we started building a team focussed on bringing the power of data science and digital service design to the subset of public and social sector problems which have huge social impact, but which are not attractive to commercial players. Since then weâ€™ve worked with over 40 councils on data and digital projects, as well as NHS Trusts and a range of charities, government departments, and businesses who are looking to have a greater social impact. Our unusual history means that our teams blend an understanding of policy and service delivery with hard technical skills. Our not-for-profit status and strong links with major foundations mean that we can often attract grant funding for exploratory work, for high impact but high-risk projects, and for sector-wide initiatives such as establishment of data standards or pattern libraries. Our data and digital projects are trying to solve a range of big questions including: What is the appropriate role for data in decision making about people who are homeless, children at risk of abuse and neglect, or prison leavers? How can we design apps which empower and support vulnerable people themselves â€“ avoiding the risk of simply giving more power to the professionals who work with them? Unlike think tanks however, weâ€™re actively designing, building and implementing the services which change what is possible and so our engagement in the debate is as practitioners making novel decisions â€“ not as commentators. Diversity and Inclusion We need a diverse organisation to be effective. Our work requires us to bring together people with a broad range of skills and life experiences to ensure our impact across a range of social issues and systems. We are committed to having an inclusive culture and working environment in which everyone feels at home and is supported to achieve their potential. We know there is further to go and are implementing a Diversity and Inclusion strategy with a group of external experts to hold us to account. We actively encourage applications from under-represented and minoritised groups, including those with lived experience of the social issues we are working to address. We are an equal opportunities employer. We support a range of flexible working options and welcome UK based applications from outside of London/the South East so far as they can meet the in-person meeting requirements for the role. We can also accommodate secondments and part-time working. For full information please visit our website: https://www.socialfinance.org.uk/careers/vacancies Show more Show less

Description: Purpose of the job: This role sits within the Travel Experiences business of Collinson that manages the Priority Pass brand which provides access to over 1,500 airport lounges globally as well as an increasing range of other travel experiences such as in airport dining and rail lounges. Consumer demand for our Travel Experience solutions is growing significantly and increasing the opportunity to leverage value from the data that these consumers provide. The role of Insight Analyst for Travel Experiences is responsible for creating value from our data through the execution and communication of a variety of internal and client-focused analytics and data-led insight projects. The role-holder will engage with internal stakeholders across our Product/Proposition, Commercial, Marketing and Partnerships teams, as well as key clients, to proactively identify opportunities to add business value. These opportunities, along with a pipeline of analytics/insight requests, will be executed using a range of analytical approaches and tools/languages including Alteryx, Tableau, SQL and Python. These technologies will be deployed within an AWS big data environment that will enable us to scale into more advanced automated decisioning and contextual marketing capabilities in the future. In all cases, the objective of the Insight Analyst is to convert and synthesize a broad range of available data on our customers and their behaviors into action-driving insight and recommendations that bring the data to life. The successfully executed projects will lead to measurable commercial benefits for both the Collinson Travel Experiences business, as well as our clients and end consumers. Key Responsibilities: Operationally deliver against a pipeline of analytics projects to a high level of analytical integrity Ensure each project is aligned to a clear understanding of its strategic and commercial goals Influence senior stakeholders within the Travel Experiences leadership team across the product, proposition, commercial, marketing and partnerships teams to implement recommendations arising from insights Collaborate with clients and partners to share aggregate and anonymized data to create market leading and valued insight Contribute to a programme of regular insight communications to the Travel Experiences and broader Collinson business that elevates the value of data in driving value for the business Ensure maximum leverage of business data through the application of key technologies, e.g. Python, Alteryx, Tableau and SQL Use data to enable test and learn activities to inform the business how our customers interact with and use new tools, messaging and benefits Work with the BI Reporting team to productionise key insights into dashboards to increase their visibility and actionability Work with the Travel Experiences Data team to request new data sources to support new forms of insight Work with the Collinson Central BI & Analytics team to share best practice in analytical tools and techniques Knowledge, skills and experience required: Must have: You must have the right to work in the UK without sponsorship. You will have 2 - 3 years experience using SQL to extract data for analysis. You have experience of building high quality analytical solutions through hands on experience as a data analyst / data scientist / data strategist. You will have stakeholder management skills and an ability to identify the business question / need. You are ideally educated to degree standard in mathematics / computer science / economics or related discipline. Useful: Experience in the application of analytics as a part of digital and customer experience projects Experience of a range of analytical and statistical techniques including, but not limited to, segmentation techniques, regression techniques, decision-tree approaches and forecasting approaches. Knowledge of current trends in data science and analytics, including machine learning / AI / Big Data. An understanding of how to apply analytics in the travel space. Experience of contemporary analytics tools useful including Python / R, Alteryx, Tableau and Big Data technologies. Strong stakeholder management skills and an ability to identify the business question / need. An ability to convey complex solutions in business-friendly terms. Track record in delivering commercially-impactful analytical projects that enhance revenue. Strong verbal and written communicator and client-friendly. Experience in travel, loyalty or credit card businesses would be a distinct advantage. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Research, Biotechnology, and Pharmaceuticals
Description: Start Date: Negotiable Salary: Competitive compensation package including share options, subject to experience Closing Date: 2/07/2021 Do you want to use your technical skills to help improve the lives of others? About Healx Healx is a fast growing startup combining computational methods and drug discovery expertise to identify existing drugs that may treat rare diseases, enabling treatments to be found at a fraction of the time and cost of traditional drug discovery. There are over 7,000 rare diseases that affect an estimated 350 million people worldwide, most of which lack effective treatment. We have recently announced raising $56M Series B investment that will allow us to take more drug programs into clinical trials and grow our team. Our goal is having a patient impact at scale through technology. Data is at the heart of Healx' AI driven approach to drug discovery. You will collaborate with biologists, pharmacologists, bioinformaticians and AI engineers across the company to understand their data needs, model data in our systems and make the highest quality resources available. Description: Opportunity knocks We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our data & analytics team and contribute to the delivery of projects for our clients. Itâ€™s about being creative with data to answer business problems in a practical way, that our clients can understand and then work with us to help grow their business. This is a great opportunity for an inquisitive and commercially minded professional to harness and develop their analytical skills in an agile team as part of a global agency network. The Data & Analytics team at Iris is part of the newly formed Data Driven department, providing our clients with end-to-end capabilities across customer experience, data activation, pricing, performance management and tech strategy. This exposure to a multi-disciplined team provides an opportunity to learn from others so you become more rounded. What We're Looking For An individual with prior experience as a data analyst/digital analyst/CRM analyst/reporting analyst. Grounded skills in data manipulation & cleansing, customer analytics and/or digital analytics and measurement & reporting.
