Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Government Relations
function: Design, Information Technology, and Project Management
Description: We're supporting our clients as they adapt to a new world in the wake of COVID-19. We're now recruiting for roles which will help our clients to deliver vital services and to resume business wherever possible. Becoming a BI Analyst with Capita - CLCH Partnership Location: Parsons Green Health Centre, London Salary: Â£32,257 - Â£47,705 per annum (dependent on experience) The Business Intelligence Analyst will have had solid experience working within a Business Intelligence department and have worked with the NHS for a number of years in either a community or acute setting. The post holder will ideally have worked as an analyst in the support and provision of a Trusts internal or external BI or reporting requirements. They should have an understanding of NHS data sets, and have experience with NHS operational/regional/national reporting requirements. The post holder will ideally have also worked for either a NHS Community or Acute Trust working as an analyst either in an Information or Business Intelligence Department. What you'll be doing: To develop good working relationships throughout the Trust To ensure reports produced by the post holder are of the highest quality , ensuring that validation checks exist at all stages of production. To develop ad hoc reports as requested by senior BIPA staff, for Divisional Directors, Business Managers and other clinical or non-clinical users within agreed timescales. To ensure that all external statutory reports produced by the post holder are fully validated prior to sign-off within the organisation, and that reports are not submitted or uploaded externally without Trust sign off. To ensure that all processes for the production of routine information reports produced by the post holder are clearly documented with robust procedures. To be able on a day to day basis provide expert and informed advice , guidance and training concerning information topics to non-information specialists, including data definitions, performance targets and report criteria To maintain a good understanding of the origin and meaning of data available in patient related operational and management information systems within the Trust. To be aware of statutory and organisational changes on those systems (e.g. ISB, Information boundary changes, etc.), ensuring the Trust responds appropriately to all such changes. For the reports you produce, to learn and develop an understanding of the origin and meaning of data used . To understand patient flows and how data is feed into the operational and management information systems that are used for reports. To use analytical and statistical methods , including trend analysis, forecasting and extrapolation techniques, to develop meaningful reports to support the strategic, business and operational needs of the Divisions and the Trust. To present information in an appropriate medium for assist the Trust who may want to do further analysis work. To take a proactive role in designing information or reporting solutions such as spreadsheets and databases that will assist the Trust in using their own Good understanding of modern data warehouse designs including understanding data to manage their services. To be aware of the different needs and skills of staff and clinicians and adopt the best method to suit individuals. To contribute to the Trust's efforts to improve data quality. Under the direction of the Director of BIPA, taking an active part in identifying, reporting and assisting in the identification of the Trust data quality issues in order to achieve a high standard of quality, accuracy of information. What we're looking for: Experience working with the NHS working as a data analyst or BI function Experience working in a NHS Trust Acute or Community (ideally at least 5 years BI or Finance experience) Experience in SQL report writing Able to build reports and provide analysis SSIS, SSRS, SSMS (experience in one of more desirable) Strong experience & skill in excel Experience in Power BI (desirable) Experience in analysis of data Good relationship management from analyst perspective Good communication skills is essential Experience using SQL 2016 & above desirable Good numerical skills and understanding of statistics is essential Experience working with EMIS Web, RiO, SystmOne, Blithe Lilie, Datix (having one or more would be considered desirable) Ability to analyse, investigate and resolve financial queries and discrepancies About Capita | CLCH Capita is currently running a Business Intelligence service as part of an innovative Strategic Partnership with an NHS community provider organisation in London. The Partnership delivers a range of core support services on behalf of the Trust, including HR, Estates & Facilities, IM&T and Finance. The essential corporate services support delivered by Capita help to protect investment in frontline services and allow clinical teams to focus on providing the best possible care for patients. The NHS Trust has great ambition for their Business Intelligence service, they see it as an essential part of its future delivery and wishes to explore expanding the service once an effective data reporting service is established (currently underway). What's in it for you? A competitive basic salary 23 days' holiday (rising to 27 ) with the opportunity to buy extra leave The opportunity to take a paid day out of the office, volunteering for our charity partners or a cause of your choice Company matched pension, life assurance, a cycle2work scheme, 15 weeks' fully paid maternity, adoption and shared parental leave, paternity pay of two weeks...and plenty more Voluntary benefits designed to suit your lifestyle - from discounts on retail and socialising, to health & wellbeing, travel and technology Access to our Employee Network Groups, which represent every strand of diversity and allow colleagues to connect and learn from each other on an open, inclusive platform You'll get the chance to follow your chosen career path anywhere in Capita. You'll be joining a network of 63,000 experienced, innovative and dedicated individuals across multiple disciplines and sectors. There are countless opportunities to learn new skills and develop in your career, and we'll provide the support you need to do just that. Our purpose is to create a better outcome for you. What we hope you'll do next: Choose 'Apply now' to fill out our short application, so that we can find out more about you. If you have any questions you'd like to ask before applying, you can contact Sophie Bennett (Sophie.clarke3@capita.com) All interviews, assessments and background checks will continue to take place online, to completely remove the need for face-to-face contact. All Capita colleagues who can work from home should do so; and where it is not possible for colleagues to work remotely, we have taken important steps to protect those working from Capita's offices. Social distancing, enhanced hygiene and safety measures are already in place at all Capita locations that are open to protect our colleagues and manage the risk of COVID-19. The welfare of our people is of paramount importance to us, and we're doing everything we can to keep our colleagues and customers safe during this time. We're an equal opportunity employer, which means we'll consider all suitably qualified applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, ethnic origin, nationality, religion or beliefs, age, sexual orientation, disability status or any other protected characteristic. We recruit and develop our people based on merit and their passion for creating better outcomes, and we're committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Show more Show less

You will also work closely with the commercial team to optimise the company's sales processes and provide support to them in managing client accounts. The position will enable you to develop a range of skills including sales analysis, project management, client account management. Company Industry: Nonprofit Organization Management, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care
Description: HSIB conducts independent investigations of patient safety concerns in NHS-funded care across England. The safety recommendations we make aim to improve healthcare systems and processes in order to reduce risk and improve safety. HSIB is funded by the Department of Health & Social Care and hosted by NHS England and NHS Improvement. We hope that when parliamentary time allows, we will be established as an independent public body. The purpose of HSIB is to improve patient safety across healthcare by carrying out expert investigations to determine the causes of accidents and serious incidents, and to make safety recommendations intended to prevent recurrence. It is not to apportion blame or liability. HSIB also seeks to improve investigation practice across the wider healthcare system. The HSIB seeks to carry out investigations which are most likely to reveal the contributory factors of systemic risks to patient safety and maximise the potential for system-wide learning.. To inform this investigative activity, the Intelligence Unit (IU) gathers, integrates, analyses and prioritises healthcare safety intelligence from a wide variety of sources. The IU team work to identify, define and propose investigations, series of investigations, or safety studies by the HSIB into safety events or issues affecting the healthcare system. The IU team will also assist HSIB in evaluating and assessing the impact of its investigation reports and recommendations, to inform the choice of future investigations and provide recommendations for improving investigative processes and methods. The Medical Director and Head of the Intelligence Unit are seeking an insightful, intelligent and creative individual with a good knowledge and understanding of the healthcare system to assist in the day to day operations of the IU, undertaking activities to support the objectives of HSIB. The Intelligence Analyst will need excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills and will be comfortable working with data in a variety of forms, to analyse, understand and make effective use of it. The Intelligence Analyst will also have an important engagement role, internally and externally, liaising with the public to process external referrals of safety events, issues and concerns from a wide range of stakeholders in the healthcare system, developing these potential cases as necessary and supporting their presentation to HSIB senior leadership. Referrals will originate from information provided by a range of people and organisations across government, healthcare and lobbying organisations, as well as patients, families and members of the public. The successful applicant will be expected to be knowledgeable, empathetic and able to relate effectively to the variety of individuals who may seek the attention and assistance of the HSIB. The role is offered on a permanent basis at 37.5 hours per week. HSIB is situated at Cody Technology Park, a unique private campus 10 minutes from Farnborough town centre and 40 minutes by train from Waterloo. It is a superb spacious working location with ample parking, a subsidised restaurant, cafÃ©, nursery, gym and landscaped gardens to enjoy. HSIB adhere to the salary principles set out in the NHS Terms & Conditions of Services handbook. Please note, applicants coming from outside of the NHS will be appointed to the bottom of the advertised pay scale. The usual starting salary principles apply for applicants coming from the NHS. For further information please visit the NHS Employers website. Our staff are offered a range of benefits including generous annual leave entitlement, competitive salaries, work-life balance, flexible working, season ticket loans, NHS discounts, 24/7 employee assistance, free eye tests and learning and development opportunities. We are committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships. HSIB are unable to reimburse travel expenses for attending interviews. For further details / informal visits contact: Name: Kevin Stewart Job title: Medical Director Email address: Kevin.stewart@hsib.org.uk Show more Show less

Company Industry: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Leisure, Travel & Tourism
Description: Expedia Group needs YOU! Are you a data engineer who wants to work for a strong and creative online travel technology company? If you enjoy working in a flexible, Agile environment where your efforts to build data pipelines that have a direct impact on expanding our customer base and driving new business, thenâ€¦ Expedia is looking for YOU! The team at the Expedia Group are looking for data and software development enthusiasts who are highly motivated and disciplined, to join their awesome Engineering team. Youâ€™ll be working on some cool projects using our cutting-edge technologiesâ€¦ As a data engineer in this team, youâ€™ll work with other experienced engineers to design, build, enhance and maintain Big Data pipelines which deliver key data sets which support our Marketing as well as being used by partner managers, analysts and data scientists. We work closely with our product managers and business team members to make sure we deliver the right data, in the right way and using the right technology. What you'll do... You Will Be Responsible For Writing code â€“ lots of it. Much of our code is in Scala â€“ scheduled using Apache Airflow - but we also use Java, HiveQL Python, Spark and whatever other tools or languages are needed. We welcome programmers of all backgrounds as long as you are keen to work with data and deliver good-quality code! Making sure code deploys smoothly and correctly into our cloud environments (AWS). Getting a good understanding of our data sets and the business processes and teams that they support. This includes knowledge of tools and APIs from partners including Google, and Facebook. Working in an Agile team and looking for ways to continuously improve through asking for and providing feedback. Sharing your technical knowledge with the team, reviewing work and providing guidance where you have seniority or experience with a specific technology. Acting as a point of contact for technical issues for specific workstreams within a project. Implementing product features, working with Product Owners, Data Operations teams, as well as other data engineers. Doing QA and using good practice like of checking requirements, unit testing, and code reviews to ensure these are delivered correctly. Feeding into and helping implement our technical roadmap, which include managing technical debt, innovating with new technologies and approaches and helping to build up and broaden the technical skills or yourself and the rest of your team. Who You Are... We donâ€™t believe in skill matching against a list of buzzwords. We look for smart people with good general programming skills because we believe that exceptional developers can learn new technologies quickly and well. However, it wouldn't hurt if you have experience with some of the following (or a passion to learn them): Coding in Scala (ideally including use of Airflow), Python, Java or another object-oriented language Hadoop (or other â€œBig Dataâ€/ distributed systems), ideally including Hive and Amazon EMR Experience of using cloud services (e.g. Amazon Web Services), particularly with an â€œinfrastructure-as-codeâ€ approach (we use Terraform and Ansible) Data modelling and data warehousing Scalable relational database systems such as Redshift, Teradata Passionate about learning, be that about languages, tools, data sets or how they are used by the business As a team we love toâ€¦ Build high-quality data pipelines using cool technology. Work in an environment where elegant, clean, maintainable code is favored over messy hacks. Share our knowledge with each other and learn new things. Host and attend meetups and conferences Make use of (and, where relevant, contribute to) a range of open-source software Work with a diverse team across multiple sites around the world Take advantage of our amazing travel discounts and tick some destinations off our bucket lists! We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce, is the most awesome workforceâ€¦ We believe in being Different. We seek new ideas, different ways of thinking, diverse backgrounds and approaches, because averages can lie and sameness is dangerous. Expedia is committed to crafting an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age. Weâ€™ll take your career on a journey thatâ€™s flexible and right for you, whilst recognizing and rewarding your achievementsâ€¦ A conversation around flexible working and what is right for you is encouraged from day one/ your first conversations with Hotels.com. Competitive salaries and many growth opportunities within the wider Expedia Inc group. Option to attend conferences globally and enrich the technology skills you are passionate about. Cash and Stock rewards for high achievers. Extensive travel rewards and discounts for all employees! Why join usâ€¦ Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better â€“ that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so. Whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at Expedia Group we act as one team, working towards a common goal: to bring the world within reach. We relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. We act with humility and optimism, respecting ideas big and small. We value diversity and voices of all volumes. Description: PURPOSE 1. To manage the implementation of information systems projects and tasks associated with the supply chain planning function. 2. To advise senior management in IT and other functions about systems development and support 3. To analyse business system requirements and to configure and implement systems which meet those requirements. DIMENSIONS 1. Access to confidential information. 2. Management of project teams consisting of 3rd party, IT & business personnel. 5. Specific responsibility for working with the Supply Chain Planning function to analyse, advise, deliver and monitor relevant technology, processes, information systems and controls KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Management and participation within projects The Business Analyst (BA) will participate in and occasionally manage projects approved for the implementation or improvement of systems for either wholly or for elements of a larger project managed overall by the Business Systems Manager or Senior Business Analyst. During projects the BA will be responsible for reporting progress to the SBA, including raising issues likely to threaten the implementation plan and an analysis of current and planned costs. Finally, the BA must contribute to the transition of any support to the Service Desk and be able to liaise and support the functional area as required. This may occasionally be required outside normal office hours. Working with the Specified Functions The Forecasting & Planning business analyst is an important part of the liaison between the Forecasting & Planning function and IT, for the understanding and use of information systems. As such the BA must have a thorough and up to date understanding of the business aspects of these areas. Additionally the Forecasting & Planning Chain business analyst must have specific expertise in planning processes ranging from demand planning through to supply network planning. This should include a strong understanding of related core ERP processes and procedures. The Forecasting & Planning in business analyst needs to have a detailed understanding of functional and technical aspects of planning systems, primarily in SAP APO but also associated functionality and technology in the ERP and BW applications. He/she must be able to communicate with business and technical staff at all levels and be sufficiently skilled in the configuration & testing of relevant IT systems. Business Analyst Responsibilities Determine requirements for systems by examination of those existing, defining volumes and processes and interviewing users. Design and amend business processes, in conjunction with business users, to comply with the departmental standards. Configure systems according to agreed processes, and document clearly, in accordance with departmental standards. Prepare test data and conduct thorough testing of processes. Assist user departments with the training, data conversion and acceptance testing that is required for the introduction of new processes. Contribute to determination of systems development standards and techniques and ensure adherence to them. Adherence to the companyâ€™s governance and management procedures to ensure compliance with all relevant internal controls. Operate quality control tests both pre and post implementation of systems. Liaise with Solutions Architects and other Business Analysts to co-ordinate development and live systems support. Contribute to development of departmental policy by acquiring and contributing knowledge of industry trends and their application in business scenarios. Provide such assistance to the IT Service Desk Team as is needed to aid the smooth running of the department. SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Experience of at least one full SAP implementation cycles as a configurer/business analyst At least 3 years experience of development, configuration and implementation of SAP planning systems that must include SAP APO and SAP ERP planning modules. At least 2 years experience of working with SAP ERP modules (must include broad understanding of PP, MM, SD) Broad understanding of business processes associated with all aspects of an FMCG manufacturing operation. Broad understanding of business processes associated with all aspects of an FMCG traded operation. Proven experience of dealing with technical and business people within the context of IT systems implementation. Show more Show less

Minimum 2-5 yearsâ€™ fulltime professional work experience, energy industry knowledge a plus. Technically savvy. Proficiency with one or more programming languages (e.g. Python, Json, SQL, PostgresSQL). Minimum 2-5 yearsâ€™ experience using business intelligence / data visualization tools (e.g. Quick Sight, Power BI, Tableau,). Understand database structures/ scheme and data transformation. AWS experience environments such as S3, a plus Excel skills, proficient using PivotTables, vlookups and Power Query. Agile management experience a plus. Willing to learn, work hard and take instruction and provide feedback. Resourceful and possess a strong attention to detail. Works collaboratively with others. At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. Weâ€™re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping. S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com. Proficient English language written and verbal. Capable of interacting with partners at all levels and creating clear and concise process documentation. A positive, can-do individual keen to accept new challenges. Able to win trust and establish relationships. Company Industry: Security and Investigations
Description: Business analyst S-RM is looking for a business analyst to play a key role in the expansion of our digital services. This individual will be responsible for supporting the development of new and existing digital products and strategic digital transformation initiatives. ABOUT S-RM S-RM is a global risk and intelligence consultancy. Founded in 2005, we have 250+ practitioners spanning six international offices, serving clients across all regions and major sectors. We support our clients by providing intelligence that informs critical decision-making and strategies, from investments and partnerships through to disputes; by helping organisations build resilience to cyber, operational and security threats; and by responding to cyber-attacks, security incidents and organisational crises. Technology sits at the heart of our business and is central to our growth strategy. Our existing digital services include Portal, a secure report-management application, Monitor, an integrity and reputation monitoring service, GSI, a security risk platform and Swan, an intelligence collection platform. We are constantly adding new services and investing in digital transformation across all areas of the business. MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Reporting into the Head of Digital, the Business Analyst will contribute to the development of digital tools and services for internal and external users. They will work closely with practitioners in our Cyber Security and Corporate Intelligence teams, our design, marketing, IT, engineering and finance departments as well as external partners. Business analysis and agile product development Work with the business to document and recommend improvements to core processes Perform user research interviews and analyse user problems to inform improvements to customer experience and team efficiency Work closely with product/project managers within agile teams to maintain a product backlog and refine user stories to an appropriate level of detail to ensure maximum value Create and maintain system documentation and user guides Design test cases and perform testing to ensure product quality. Strategy and planning Contribute to the formulation of product objectives and roadmaps Independently plan and deliver small projects and tasks with minimal guidance User focus Gain a deep understanding of our users through data analytics, surveys, user interviews and workshops Participate in client meetings where required Support Provide ongoing support for existing services by conducting root cause analysis and troubleshooting issues with clients and internal users. Domain expertise Demonstrate a strong understanding of agile product delivery, lean methodologies and actively encourage their adoption across the business. LOCATION The role will be based in our London office. SKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE The qualifications and experience required to perform this role successfully are: Bachelorâ€™s degree from a reputable university, preferably in a numerate subject, or equivalent practical experience Demonstrable business analysis experience, with particular evidence of successful benefits delivery Proven ability to work with stakeholders and business sponsors at all levels Previous experience working with and interpreting complex data. Proficiency in SQL and Power Query would be a plus. Experience in documenting as-is and to-be business processes using appropriate tools and methods (e.g. Visio, BPMN) Strong grasp of agile product development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) and previous experience working in an agile environment The jobholder will need to have the following key personal skills and attributes to perform successfully in this role: Excellent organisational, analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to facilitate and manage requirements gathering workshops Excellent attention to detail Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously A proactive approach and a willingness to work outside the job specification when required Excellent interpersonal skills BENEFITS 5% matching pension contribution 25 holiday days per year + bank holidays, which increases with service to a maximum of 30 days Support of your mental wellbeing, including counselling sessions available to you and your family Flexible working arrangements available Availability of a variety of training courses including online learning Maternity â€“ 6 months of full pay followed by 3 months of half pay Paternity â€“ 6 weeks of full pay Very comprehensive private medical insurance as well as eye tests and glasses reimbursement Local gym discount Season ticket loan for your train commute Cycle to work scheme A formalised recognition programme ELIGIBILITY The successful candidate must have permission to work in the UK by the start of their employment. CONTACT To apply for this role, please email your CV and cover letter to recruitment@s-rminform.com S-RM nurtures a culture of equality, diversity and inclusion and we are dedicated to developing a workforce that displays a variety of talents, experiences and perspectives. ABOUT THE ROLE Data scientist: Aerospace and defence listed firms. You will extract, analyse, and interpret large amounts of data from a range of sources, using algorithmic, data mining, artificial intelligence, machine learning and statistical tools, to make it accessible to the wider Investment team and senior management. You will then present your results using clear and engaging language. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES As a data scientist, you will need to: work closely with Data engineers and senior equity research analysis to identify issues and use data to propose solutions for effective decision making build algorithms and design experiments to merge, manage, interrogate, and extract data to supply tailored reports to colleagues, IT Index and systems intelligence unit or the wider investment team use machine learning tools and statistical techniques to produce solutions to problems test data mining models to select the most appropriate ones for use on a project maintain clear and coherent communication, both verbal and written, to understand data needs and report results create clear reports that tell compelling stories about how partners or colleagues work with the business assess the effectiveness of data sources and data-gathering techniques and improve data collection methods horizon scan to stay up to date with the latest technology, techniques, and methods conduct research from which you will develop prototypes and proof of concepts look for opportunities to use insights/datasets/code/models across other functions in the organisation (for example in aerospace and defence listed firms and non-listed firms stay curious and enthusiastic about using algorithms to solve problems and enthuse others to see the benefit of your work. As a senior you will also require to: recruit, train and lead a team of data scientists have responsibility for the organisationâ€™s data science strategy establish new systems and processes and look for opportunities to improve the flow of data evaluate new and emerging technologies represent the company at external events and conferences build and develop relationships with partners. QUALIFICATIONS Youâ€™ll need a degree in a computer science, mathematical or science-based subject. The following degree subjects may be particularly useful: computer science data science/computer and data science engineering mathematics mathematics and operational research Physics Statistics You will be expected to know some programming languages such as R, Python, C or Java and have strong database design and coding skills. SKILLS Youâ€™ll need to have: excellent analytical and problem-solving skills experience in database interrogation and analysis tools, such as Hadoop, SQL and SAS exceptional communication and presentation skills to explain your work to people who do not understand the mechanics behind data analysis effective listening skills to understand the requirements of the firm drive and the resilience to try new ideas if the first one does not work â€“ youâ€™ll be expected to work with minimal supervision, so itâ€™s important that youâ€™re able to motivate yourself planning, time management and organisational skills the ability to deliver under pressure and to tight deadlines great attention to detail teamworking skills and a collaborative approach to sharing ideas and finding solutions. ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENT A Bachelorâ€™s degree from an accredited university in an Engineering discipline, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or Information Systems Management. A minimum of 3 yearsâ€™ experience manipulating and applying advanced data and statistical analysis methods to manufacturing data. Employees must be legally authorized to work in the UK. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 3+ years working experience in the financial industry and/or analytics experience after graduation. A degree in Engineering AND a degree or certification in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, or Information Systems Management. In depth knowledge of statistical software packages and advanced analytics techniques. Proven success manipulating and applying advanced data and statistical analysis methods to manufacturing data. Knowledge and experience working in various coding languages, including Python, R, and SQL. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Excellent analytical skills. Ability to work in a self-directed or team environment. Strong organizational skills. Other Personal Characteristics A collegial work style, sense of humor, and a thick skin Strong work ethic and ability to be successful in a high intensity environment Combines strength of convictions with low ego needs Able to remain calm and objective in the face of periods of excessive optimism or extreme pessimism in the capital markets Unassailable ethics and integrity Show more Show less

Company Industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services
Description: Our MissionðŸš€ Bud's mission is simple. We're here to create the worldâ€™s most compelling financial data products. The products we're building are used by some of the world's most prestigious institutions to help millions of their customers take control of their finances. Your MissionðŸ‘¨â€ðŸš€ðŸ‘©â€ðŸš€ Our Data Engineers shape, evaluate and transform data for consistency and utility. They take static datasets and live datastreams and work to ensure fast, secure access to them where and when needed in our products, our models and by our teams. As a Data Engineer at Bud youâ€™ll be instrumental in maintaining and improving the data infrastructure that facilitates new products and feature innovation, and ultimately changes the world of traditional financial services. Our aim is to become the leader in how data can be used intelligently to open up exciting new opportunities and insights in an industry going through significant disruption. We want to empower our users to get the most value and insight from their data. What impact will you make Work with our team of data scientists & analysts as well as multiple data-consuming teams and stakeholders across the Engineering department Facilitate the creation of new products and features driven by data Work as part of our data science team to shape the data that allows us to iterate and improve our models over time Work with our data analysts to ensure Bud collects the right data to fulfil our objectives Find technical, process or people solutions to help us ingest, transform and move data more efficiently Work with other colleagues to secure datasets and data sources from 3rd parties in order to increase our pool of available data Contribute to our long-term data strategy A Bit About You High level of competence working with relational, columnar and NoSQL data stores Knowledge of OLTP, OLAP, ETL, streaming, batching and lambda architecture Comfortable working with real-time data at scale Knowledge of database optimisation and improving query performance Strong programming skills, particularly in Python with Pandas Able to communicate clearly and concisely about data structures, databases and technologies Strong SQL skills, particularly with Postgres and MySQL A passion for data and the value that can be derived from it Taking it to the next level These arenâ€™t requirements, but are definitely a plus for any candidate! Familiar with Python libraries asyncio, Pydantic, FastAPI/Starlette Experience with RabbitMQ Working knowledge of data security principles, with an appetite to learn more Strong views on data ethics, able to articulate what ethical behaviour looks like and where boundaries should be drawn Worked in UK banking or fintech before Experience working in a company where their platform is based in the Cloud (Google Cloud Platform/AWS) Engineering at bud The software engineering team is tasked with solving highly technical problems to enable solutions that tangibly benefit the lives of millions of people. From how to scale our solutions to tens of millions of users in the most effective manner of integrating hundreds of third-party businesses. Data is key to our business and we need passionate developers to help capture it, store it, transform it, research and most importantly secure it. What is it like to work for Bud? We could play buzzword bingo but one of our core values is 'Authentic' and the best way to demonstrate this is by sharing our employee engagement dashboard. This provides a weekly engagement and NPS score giving you a true reflection of life at Bud. All data collected is realtime & anonymised so we have no control over what you see. The dashboard is interactive so check it out here and have a look at what the numbers mean, https //bit.ly/2MhjAZT A Bit More About Us Weâ€™re a diverse group of people. With backgrounds ranging from data science to music production, more than 80% of our team come from outside the world of finance â€“ providing us with a unique perspective as we help consumers feel more in control of their lives. For us, an interest in people comes first; finance follows. More About What We're Doing The apps and infrastructure weâ€™re building are designed to place the power of personal data back into the hands of normal people. Picture this a world where your bank knew you were paying too much for your gas bill and could switch you to a more suitable provider, or understood your savings targets and could automatically find you a better deal. Thatâ€™s what weâ€™re working towards. We believe that diversity will make us better. Budâ€™s mission is to make the money part of peopleâ€™s lives simple. To get there, we need a workforce that is diverse as the people we create our products for. Which means we need people who have different backgrounds and experiences, who are diverse in age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity, and ways of thinking. We truly believe that these differences will make us grow as a company and a team. We strive to create a workplace and culture where our people are empowered, supported, given equal opportunities and can bring their authentic selves to work. To read our job applicant privacy policy, please click here. Benefits Compensation ðŸ’° We offer competitive salaries in line with industry benchmarks, set using extensive market data. We review salaries on an annual basis to make sure we continue to reward people well for their contributions at Bud. We have benchmarked this role Â£55,000-Â£69,000 Options ðŸ“ˆ Anyone joining Bud is granted stock options and the opportunity to invest in what we are building and developing, and to get to share in our future successes. Wellbeing Allowance ðŸ‹ï¸â€â™€ï¸ðŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸ We understand how important it is to look after your physical and mental health, and also that this looks different for everyone. To support this, Bud has a Â£50 monthly flexible wellbeing allowance which can be used towards your own wellness, whether thatâ€™s a gym membership, meal-box subscription, massages or something else! Learning & Development ðŸ“š As part of our commitment to developing our people, all employees at Bud have an annual Â£500 pot available to use towards their learning and development - think books, courses & events - the choice is yours. We also have quarterly R&D days, giving you the opportunity to take a break for 2 days from live projects and work on something thatâ€™s inspired you, either independently or as part of a collaborative team. Flexible Working â³ As a trusted member of Bud, youâ€™ll have the freedom and flexibility to manage your time and routine in a way that suits you, and your team, allowing you to deliver your best work. This role can be based in our London office, or fully remote/distributed in the UK. Time Off ðŸ–ï¸ Weâ€™re a team that likes to work hard, so we need to make sure we balance this with time to rest and relax. We offer 25 days holiday, plus the usual bank holidays, plus additional time off over the holiday season. Equipment ðŸ’» We want to make sure everyone is set up to work effectively and comfortably - so youâ€™ll get to choose your own kit, including any additional equipment you might need to work from home. Social ðŸ’ƒðŸ•º Weâ€™re big on keeping Bud a social place to work, with big quarterly events (we throw an epic summer party), regular team socials & monthly company breakfasts. This year weâ€™ve stepped up our virtual social scene with quiz nights, virtual cocktail making, book clubs, and online workouts. Company Industry: Financial Services and Insurance
Description: From day one, our mission has been to create an independent business with a unique culture - one that is controlled by the people who work for it. Finding the most talented and entrepreneurial people has always been key to our success. People come to Howden Group Holdings for lots of different reasons, but they stay for the same one: our culture. That's what sets us apart, and why we nurture and retain the best talent in the market. Whatever your priorities - work/life balance, career progression, sustainability, volunteering - you'll find like-minded people driving change at Howden Group. Who we are Howden Employee Benefits & Wellbeing (HEBW) is an award winning consultancy helping its clients build benefit strategies that reflect, support and even inspire a healthy business culture. Insights & Analytics are a uniquely multidisciplinary team working in partnership with HEBW consultants both in the UK and across Howden's global offices to deliver best advice to clients. Our aim is to use data insights to deliver better outcomes in respect of employee benefits and wellbeing solutions. This is achieved through the insights and increased understanding that data analytics can provide. Our team offers businesses real-time digital and data solutions to transform how they design, manage and administer their employee health, protection and wellbeing benefits - improving their data accuracy, efficiencies and reducing costs. Collaboration and creativity are at the heart of all we do. We bring data to life through engaging charts, interactive dashboards, and accessible reports, allowing our clients to make informed decisions through the intelligent insight we can provide. We blend data from multiple sources and use a variety of techniques in order to deliver a market-leading service. Our wellbeing model is data led, using analytics to help employers understand the underlying health risks within their workforce, and the impact of their current wellbeing initiatives. By bringing data analytics together with wellbeing expertise we can help design and manage effective, enduring wellbeing strategies for the benefit of our clients and their employees. Job Summary The primary role of Data Analyst is to support our analytics and consulting proposition through comprehensive requirements analysis; detailed and accurate preparation of varying data; identification, analysis and interpretation of patterns in complex datasets and creation of compelling, creative and informative visualisation that supports decision-making for our clients and stakeholders. Working alongside our analytics, consulting and reporting specialists within the team, the Data Analyst plays a critical role in our evolving eco-system. The ideal candidate will have a statistical, mathematical or data science-related background, a driven individual looking for the next step in their career, wanting to build on their foundational experience in data analytics to become a true practitioner. They will be confident in working with a variety of data sources as well as being able to adapt for technical and non-technical audiences. As a growing, dynamic, and fast-paced company this role will suit someone who is looking to make an impact, and develop and shape a data analytics proposition. This is a great opportunity to build a diverse set of skills in an environment at the cutting-edge of our industry, with exposure to different business areas, senior management, and clients. Data Analysts are required to possess a range of finely-tuned data skills (data querying, data manipulation, data verification and visualisation), excellent attention to detail as well as strong written and verbal communication skills. We are committed to nurturing talent; to this end success in this role could lead to a transition into a range of other technical data or consulting-focussed roles. Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities Support the evolution of HEBW's analytics proposition by means of Building, developing, and maintaining a suite of eye-catching self-service dashboards for use by clients, internal stakeholders globally Supporting the wellbeing programme and whitepaper research with analytical expertise and memorable visualisation Creating charts, infographics, reporting and presentation materials to enable effective communication of analytics and insight, to employers and internal stakeholders Comprehensive requirements analysis - ensuring solutions meet business needs, quality assurance strategies and periodic improvement/audit plans Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and translating ideas into visualisations throughout the development of a product Fully document processes, models, calculation specifications, and tools in a detailed and readily auditable way Build efficient and reliable rules to validate, format, and transform data Developing, maintaining and enhancing adviser consultancy reports, benchmarking reports and insurer competitive analysis Driving insight from our Elysium data Enable accurate, efficient and reliable data analytics solutions and insights through Establishing a service-level, prioritising requests and escalating conflicts where appropriate Ensuring that requirements are sufficiently catalogued and documented Liaising with requestors to ensure that requested works meet expectations and that timescales and deliverables are communicated in a clear and timely manner Including robust checks and error handling in all work Identifying any coding or calculation issues for which solutions need to be developed Operate within the required data quality, document management and compliance frameworks in order to develop, maintain and enhance HEBW activities by means of Maintaining up-to-date information within appropriate document formats relating to report format, content, location, distribution and information classification Preparing and maintaining documentation relating to the delivery and support of HEBW data analytics solutions Ensuring that deliverables comply with ISO27001, GDPR and other similar regulations and guidelines as required by the business Present the results of analysis to technical and non-technical audiences both internally and externally Be expert on analytics tools across HEBW including Power BI and Excel Required Competencies & Experience Educated to degree level or above in a field including mathematical or statistical content or equivalent professional experience Previous success in a data-driven role with demonstrable ability in using Excel and/or business intelligence to at least an intermediate level Proficiency in a standard data visualisation tool (e.g. Power BI, Tableau) with demonstrable knowledge of data visualisation and design best practice SQL Solid foundational understanding of: Relational databases Data quality dimensions Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong time management skills and a proven ability to plan work on multiple projects with differing timescales Able to articulate complex ideas, debate them and agree them as part of a team Desired Competencies & Experience Experience of the following would be highly advantageous: R Power Query (M) Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) Working with overseas stakeholders Key interfaces Employee Benefits Risk and Healthcare Consultants Employee Benefits Operations Teams Development teams Attributes Analytically minded with ability to think critically and adapt one's own approach Passionate for delivering work at a high standard, with a demonstrable attention to detail Honest and supportive relationship building to develop trust with stakeholders Dedicated and dependable with a proven track record of taking ownership of work A strong desire to progress and proactive approach to learning Highly resourceful Show Company Industry: Marketing and Advertising, Design, and Retail
Description: Description Job Title Data Engineer Department/Group: Analytics Line Manager: Lead Data Engineer Location London (Old Street) Contract Type: Full Time, Permanent Travel Required: No Who We Are At MADE.COM we believe that everyone should have access to great design. So, weâ€™ve taken a unique approach to making and selling furniture - no middlemen, no agents or importers and no high street stores. Instead we work directly with designers and manufacturers so we can offer high-end furniture at attractive prices. Itâ€™s not an easy task â€“ it takes a creative and dedicated team to make it happen where everyone has an important part to play. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work thatâ€™s as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. Itâ€™s a place where all ideas are listened to, where brainstorming means job titles get left at the door and where a self-starter can really make their mark. What Youâ€™ll Be Doing MADE.COM is a company that runs on the quality and availability of its data. Supporting various teams in the business (finance, marketing, logistics to name a few), the Analytics team provides access to operation and digital analytics data that underpins everything we do. Data is ingested from various sources (such as external APIs, flat files, transactional databases, event databases) and is enriched by the Analytics Team before being stored in a Data Warehouse. The team proposes schema, builds new data sets and generally sanitises and filters the data that will ultimately serve our Business Intelligence platforms where it can be accessed to create reports and gather insight. Our data warehouse is also used internally to build predictive models that drive the performance of the business, making our team a critical point of MADE.COM development. The volume of internal data analysis and insight requests across our business is higher and more varied than itâ€™s ever been. As such we are keen to appoint an experienced Data Engineer to maintain our high standards of data provision. Our data platform relies on GCP and AWS clouds, where we constantly improve existing processes and toolkits. BigQuery and Airflow are the main engines behind our pipelines that are written in SQL, Python and R. Finally, but importantly, we're an agile team that does things that works to deliver business value through prioritisation and technical excellence., We're passionate about developing, testing, code reviews, coding standards and learning from each other to guarantee a high level of data availability and quality. Requirements What youâ€™ll need Strong experience with SQL, having used it for procedures like joining tables, grouping, aggregating, filtering, cleaning data, merging columns etc. Good understanding of ETL processes: this means being able to articulate the purpose, function and advantages of maintaining a Data Warehouse, and experience with designing the schema of a data warehouse, extracting data from various sources, loading and sanitizing data for reporting and predictive modelling. Excellent grasp of Python or R scripting, having used your skills to perform complex transformations with commercial data solving real life problems. Experience working with source control. Good communicator and confident in your dealings with internal stakeholders, who may have varying levels of technical ability. You should be able to quickly and efficiently measure the validity of requests and understand the effect of the work on the product roadmap - all the while managing expectations and keeping teams updated as to your progress. Capable of working autonomously and taking responsibility for those tasks which you have ownership. To stand out Knowledge in cloud and engineering platform solutions such as AWS. Experience in retail, marketing, ecommerce, or digital advertising. Continuous integration and test automation experience. Google Analytics Premium and Google BigQuery. Benefits What we offer Great opportunities to make the role your own and get involved with exciting projects in a fast-paced, creative and fun office environment. Weâ€™re proud of our diverse, supportive company and culture. Our very own in-house Culture Club plans a variety of activities from our annual parties, Friday drinks, social events and more. Temptingly good employee discounts on MADE.COM (30% for you and 15% for your family & friends). 25 days holiday per year (on top of bank holidays), plus an extra day of holiday for every year served up to a ceiling of 30 days. We know that flexibility is important. Our Everyday Flex policy enables you to determine your start and finish times, and weâ€™re open to discussing other flexible working arrangements too. Free, unlimited access to over 13,000 eLearning courses to support your development. We believe itâ€™s important to give back, so we give you one paid day off each year to get involved in any community or charity volunteering activity of your choice. Excellent employee benefits including private healthcare (with discounted gym membership), pension, life insurance, eyecare vouchers, cycle to work scheme and season ticket loan to name but a few. Up your street? apply for the opportunity to join our growing team in our brand new offices in the heart of Shoreditch! MADE is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment, where all of our employees have equal access to opportunities and everyoneâ€™s voices are heard. We respect and value all differences (seen and unseen) and encourage applications from all backgrounds, which will be considered regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, pregnancy and maternity, disability or age. Company Industry: Financial Services, Banking, and Investment Banking
Description: Position Overview Analytics Consultants act as trusted advisors to our clients across the region and have responsibility for managing the associated client relationships. Consultants look to develop deep linkages with our clients and help clients make best usage of our products in the context of their investment or risk process and their business goals. The individual will be responsible for supporting a suite of our Analytics Products. This will involve sharing best practices, explaining risk models applied to multi asset class portfolios and partnering with the sales team to provide expertise in client engagements and pre-sales activities. Successful candidates will have a thorough knowledge of market risk measurement and management, pricing and valuation of asset types (including equity, fixed income, commodities, and derivatives), highly quantitative skills and an ability to guide institutional clients to better use our products for assessing risks and making investment decisions. The successful candidate must be adaptable, able to lead efforts to solve clients' problems. Scope of Responsibility Manage relationships within our analytics client base; implement strategic plans to ensure client retention. Proactively engage with clients and provide Best Practices guidance on risk measurement and management Identify opportunities to increase client usage of our products and identify new users. Work closely with the sales team on potential sales opportunities. Assist in campaigns on new product placement. Proactively engage with clients to keep them informed of our product roadmap with a view on how our development efforts will help them achieve their business goals; proactively solicit client feedback regarding future product development. Work with internal functional teams to ensure that all clients requests / inquiries are managed appropriately. Respond to detailed client enquiries about methodologies and analytics, hold advanced client trainings / workshops; present in seminars. Maintain and communicate accurate records regarding client interaction activities. Frequent on-site client visits that may involve overseas travel. Specific Knowledge/Skills Very strong analytical skills in regard of simulation techniques for risk management, factor modelling, portfolio management and performance attribution, main financial instruments, IR and Equity plain vanilla instruments pricing, market risk factor sensitivities and statistical measures, knowledge of the main. European regulatory frameworks for asset managers and banks; communication and time management skills are mandatory. Strong understanding of global financial markets, including modeling, and pricing of different asset types in the fixed income, equities, commodities, and credit markets and their derivatives; experience with Barra or RiskMetrics models and software a plus. English fluent and Nordic language highly preferable. Desired Experience Experience in a risk management models and measures - VaR, Stress Test, Regulation, Simulations. You'll be involved in everything from writing requirements, defining new strategies, planning capacity, discussing field definition, drawing out flows to answering questions from other teams and customers. Sometimes you'll work on projects as a group and other times by yourself. We give you the freedom to decide how you want to define and deliver your role. This role is ideal for an enthusiastic and ambitious individual who is at the start of their career. What We're Looking For A recent university graduate with no more than 2-5 years industry experience Approx 1+ years experience in Business or Product analysis Full range of product lifecycle experience Experience working for a growing startup or technology focused company Thrives in a fast-paced environment A desire to join a product-led FinTech Entrepreneurial and a self-starter with a keen interest in business analysis Excellent people skills and an exceptional communicator An amazing problem-solver who is excited about finding new solutions to complex problems Technical focus and API experience Good stakeholder management and ability to build relationships in remote cross-functional teams Benefits 30 days annual leave plus Bank Holidays Remote friendly environment Flexible working arrangements Udemy and educational reimbursements Full details are available on our careers page About Us We are an award-winning cloud-native payment technology provider for financially regulated institutions. Launched in 2016, we've doubled in size year on year as we continue to redefine what a truly instant payment experience means. We celebrate diversity, promote entrepreneurialism and are committed to giving everyone a say in shaping our business. Here you will grow as a person and accomplish incredible things. A career at Form3 is empowering, inspiring and fun. Join us and help shape the future of payments. EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES At Form3 we embrace equal opportunity and are committed to building a diverse team of exceptional individuals. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status and it is our strong belief that the more inclusive we are as a business, the better our work will be. Show more Show less

SalesAgility is looking for a talented Business Analyst to join our Consultancy Team. This role is pivotal to the success of our customer projects and the successful candidate will be responsible for the discovery, analysis and scope management for a portfolio of international projects. At SalesAgility we want our team to grow with us and we will work with the successful candidate to outline a career roadmap including their progression to senior roles and in future leading their own team. What youâ€™ll be doingâ€¦ Facilitating requirements and discovery workshops to understand our customer's goals, processes, future needs and current challenges. Document functional requirements as User Stories and Acceptance criteria supported by flow diagrams and other graphical representations. Present Requirements Specification Document to Client, owning the requirements refinement process until scope agreement. Be the voice of the customer within the Scrum Development Team acting as the Product Owner by proxy. Manage the Scope Backlog working with the Scrum Master to resolve assumptions and dependencies ensuring the scope of work is clear for the Development Team. Facilitate Customer Sprint demonstrations, showcasing the work completed by the development team. Owning the Change Request process for any client feedback requests. Be seen as a product and solution consultant internally supporting the Sales Team in pre-sale activities such as product demos, customer presentation and tender bids. Training end-users on the software and producing bespoke training documentation. Attend and participate in Scrum Ceremonies; Daily Standup, Retrospectives, Reviews and Planning. What youâ€™ll need to be successful... Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or Business Information systems related degree or experience as a Business Analyst. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact professionally and build good relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders. Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Thrive in a collaborative and team-oriented environment taking accountability for the work you deliver. Strong leadership capability and active listening skills with the ability to pull customers towards certain solutions. Flexibility to travel internationally (in normal times) when required About SalesAgility SalesAgility writes and maintains the worldâ€™s leading open source Customer Relationship Management (CRM) application â€“ the award-winning SuiteCRM. We are an open source CRM software consultancy with headquarters in Stirling, Scotland and a client base across the globe. Itâ€™s an exciting time to join SalesAgility. We are in a period of growth and are on the cusp of launching SuiteCRM 8.0, our largest release since the company began. With a vision to become the worldâ€™s most adopted CRM, we are focused on providing our customers with freedom, flexibility, and the best possible user experience whilst promoting a culture of open collaboration, continuous learning, and always doing the right thing. Our office in the heart of Stirling weâ€™re close to shops, cafÃ©s, restaurants, train and bus stations, and are well connected to the motorway network. In addition to the employee share scheme, we offer competitive salaries, flexible working options, a company pension scheme, regular catered social events to build team collaboration and most importantly a supportive team culture. Company Industry: Financial Services, Investment Management, and Marketing and Advertising
Description: Who we are: Nutmeg is Europeâ€™s leading Digital Wealth Manager, but we donâ€™t want to stop there. Weâ€™re continuing to build our platform to help us achieve our mission of being the most trusted Digital Wealth Manager in the world. Since being founded in 2011 we've: Grown to 150+ employees Raised over Â£100M in funding Launched 4 amazing products including JISA and Lifetime ISA Won multiple awards including Best Online Stocks & Shares ISA Provider for the fifth year in a row! 2020 was a record year for us, as we hit the 100,000 investor milestone and now manage over Â£2.3 billion AUM. *We offer flexible working* Job in a nutshell: The Marketing Data Analyst is a key role within the Nutmeg Marketing team. This person will be comfortable pulling together large marketing data sets from a variety of different sources and present them in a clear and actionable way. We need someone that can look past top line CPAs to really understand what is driving performance at the most granular level and provide insights that will drive our customer growth plan. A big part of this role is working with the Head of Acquisition to develop data driven attribution, as well as working with our data science team to continually build tools that give us greater marketing insights around our key metrics, marketing performance and a greater understanding of our audience. What are we looking for? Marketing owner for all marketing data and analytics tools including Google Analytics, Campaign Manager, Amplitude, Hotjar, Looker and Funnel, as well as mobile marketing tools. Work closely with the Head of Acquisition to deliver advanced marketing attribution. This will include working with the data science team on developing and running complex data driven attribution models, as well as creating bespoke tools that give us further insights across the marketing channel mix. A passionate, curious and ambitious marketing analyst who has worked with marketing data in a fast paced and target-driven organisation. Someone that can produce and maintain all digital marketing reporting reports for the Marketing team. Able to use data to accurately forecast marketing performance and spend. Strong analytical and data skills, to help us bring greater insight around our audience segmentation strategies. Provide weekly competitor analysis and search insight reporting. Responsible for promotional reconciliation process. Experience of working with an integrated marketing stack. An expert in using onsite and marketing analytics tools with the ability to make the complex, simple - through brilliant data visualisations tools (like Google Data Studio and Tableau). . Your skills: Someone who is passionate about data and how it can drive marketing growth to achieve business goals. A real focus on driving efficiencies across all KPIs. Proven experience in similar roles, ideally from an ecommerce, FMCG, digital retail or travel background. Strong understanding of digital marketing channels Experience with using BI tools such as Looker. Strong bias towards action, as well as a strong can-do attitude drive to achieve amazing results and overcome obstacles quickly. Excellent communicator, both verbal and written and a confident presenter. You might also have: Knowledge of investment products and a passion for the savings and investment industry. Understanding of conversion rate optimisation and A/B testing methodology. A creative mindset. Benefits: A supportive team culture 25 daysâ€™ holiday Birthday day off 2 daysâ€™ paid community leave Daily delivery of fresh fruit and artisanal coffee Cycle storage and showers onsite Generous pension plan Private healthcare from day 1 Season ticket loans Competitive salary Access to coaching platform & regular knowledge sharing Part of a diverse and inclusive Nutmeg team Show more Show less

Company Industry: Cosmetics and Consumer Goods
Description: Digital Insights Analyst needed for One of Europeâ€™s hottest and most used beauty pureplays. As a Digital Analyst you will be responsible for providing key insights and analysis to support the business in making important and timely strategic decisions and supporting the wider Analytics team. By leveraging the substantial array of data available from multiple systems and sources, the role will have responsibility for providing regular reporting and concise analysis to help drive improvements to our decision-making and business performance. Duties and Responsibilities: The candidate will be expected to display a high degree of competency around descriptive and diagnostic analysis as well as having the ability to use this information to support future decision making. Develop and maintain compelling data visualizations and dashboards to help improve strategic decision making. Provide insights with regular weekly and monthly trade reporting by leveraging various data sources. Ensure a high quality of customer reporting, analysis and KPI tracking to support both the marketing team and commercial team to better understand our customers and improve performance. Provide insights into channel attribution and marketing campaign performance. Help to drive improvements in conversion by providing key reports and analysis of funnel behaviour. Ability to leverage web analytics and data tools to help optimise the customer journey. Utilisation of various analytical tools including GA360, Big Query, Data Studio, Contentsquare, SimilarWeb, and QlikView. Skills / Qualifications: Comfortable and competent working with large datasets. Microsoft Office stack proficiency, particularly in Excel and PowerPoint. Experience in an analytical role, ideally within an eCommerce business, is desirable (e.g. internships / work experience). Reporting experience is desirable â€“ helping define KPIs and proactively offering insights to improve reports and analyses. Understanding of E-Commerce KPI metrics, marketing channels and attribution is beneficial. Knowledge of web analytics tools, such as Google Analytics, Data Studio, Google Tag Manager, Google Ads and Search Console. Hands-on exposure to SQL (ideally BigQuery), business intelligence systems (e.g. QlikView, Tableau, Power BI) and/or basic HTML is desirable. Key Behaviours: Quick learner who is curious and inquisitive, with a proactive mindset. Strong collaboration skills and a team player. Meticulous attention to detail, with an overall passion for continuous improvement. Innovative and creative, with a logical and methodical approach to problem solving. Credible and articulate, with excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet
Description: THE ROLE Found are looking for a talented technical solutions specialist, specifically in the Google Analytics area. Working in a Google Analytics certified partner agency, you will live and breathe measurement, data collection and analytics solutions. As our Data Analyst, you will work closely with our Paid Media, SEO specialists and client leads to dive into the detail of campaigns, define how we measure performance and implement this across accounts. You will provide valuable insights that help drive successful digital marketing campaigns with our specialist teams and help clients understand their customers and visualise data in a meaningful way. What You Will Do Define and implement measurement Perform site and implementation audits Create implementation requirement documents for clients, onsite Coding solutions or GTM solutions Maintain and deploy tags with GTM at best practice levels Analyse clientâ€™s collected data, bug checking and providing insights Integrate with other platforms Visualise the data via different platforms (Data Studio preferred) About You You have an analytical and strategic mind You have a good grasp of web technologies You are proficient in javascript You are able to work with Google APIs You can debug using the web browser tools You have selenium experience or willingness to explore You have experience with R or willingness to explore. Requirements You have proven experience working with Google Analytics tracking Benefits Flexible Working Personalised Career Development Employee Wellbeing Initiatives including Employee Assistance Programme Pension Bupa Healthcare And more! Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Government Administration
Description: We are currently inviting applications for a full-time permanent post in the role of Data Modeller positioned in Business Insight within the wider enableNY structure. North Yorkshireâ€™s Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner is seeking to recruit a Data Modeller. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to join the Commissionerâ€™s Commissioning and Partnerships function to provide analytical support to measure the success of commissioned services. With a newly elected Police and Crime Commissioner, this is particularly important time to join the team. The Commissioner is currently in the process of implementing new Criminal Justice Diversionary services to reduce our First Time Entrant and Reoffending rates; data collection and analysis for these services will be the primary focus of the role. This will include scrutinising systems, collating data, preparing output, outcome and trend analysis and working with partners and service providers to ensure information accuracy. Business Insight is the team which helps drive service improvement, supports HMICFRS activity, leads on understanding current and future demands, and is developing an exciting approach to data analytics. A relatively new team, our work is constantly evolving to meet the needs of a changing operating environment as we seek innovative approaches to improving service delivery. As part of the Business Insight data team, the post-holder will: Operate within enableNY providing services to North Yorkshire Fire and Rescue Service, North Yorkshire Police and the Office of the Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner Respond to Freedom of Information requests Provide data to a range of external customers in order to meet statutory or other agreed reporting requirements (e.g. Home Office, HMICFRS, partners) Provide data to a range of internal customers in order to inform service improvement, inspection, research and/or analysis products. Assist in the production of reports to support organisational performance monitoring In order to fill this post we are seeking a highly motivated and dedicated individual with the following: Experience of writing queries using SQL and advanced use of Excel Experience of acquiring, cleaning and presenting data sets Excellent verbal and written communication skills An ability to work either independently or in a team and to deadlines There is an expectation that the successful post holder will engage in self-learning, embrace the skills development as set out in the Career Progression Plan (as far as allowed by the timescales) and show a commitment to continuously develop what Business Insight can offer. Show more Show less
