Company Industry: Internet
Description: Echobox has access to very large granular private data sets and is currently only using a small part of this in end user products. You will work closely with our CTO to help push the boundaries of what the Echobox Artificial Intelligence is capable of achieving with this data. Key Responsibilities You will contribute to the development of prototypes that can be turned into end user products by the core development team. You will assist in the customisation of the product for new customers and trial data analyses where required. You will stay up to date with the latest advances in ML and AI. About Echobox We are a fast-growing, research-driven company building an artificial intelligence that helps online publishers overcome the challenges they face every day. Using novel machine learning techniques, we are revolutionising the publishing industry and have a track record of building things that others have ruled out as impossible. Leading names from around the world rely on our product every day, including The Times, Le Monde, The Guardian, Vogue and many more. Our team is our best asset. We work with extremely smart and talented individuals, who all enjoy a high degree of responsibility and independence in structuring their work. To get a better insight into the kind of work we do, check out our open-source project on Github, our data showcases and our YouTube content on Microservices. Do you think you have what it takes to be part of Echobox? We'd love to hear from you. Requirements Minimum Academic Qualifications 2.1 degree in a STEM subject from a top tier university. Required Skills And Experience Fluent written and spoken English A very strong understanding of classical statistics A basic knowledge of different ML and AI methodologies and the desire to become an expert Strong background in a programming language suitable for analyses (e.g. R, Python, Java, C#, C++) A familiarity with Java (SE7+) and a desire to become an expert An ability and desire to learn new skills quickly Genuine passion for making the impossible possible Preferred Skills Strong knowledge or experience in one area of ML and AI. Experience developing software as part of a team, e.g. DVCS, open source software projects. Working knowledge of big data architectures, i.e. NoSQL, Hadoop etc. Benefits Our employees enjoy free breakfast every day, coffee, drinks and snacks all day, everyday. Every Wednesday, we order food for our weekly team lunches where everyone gets together for an hour of fun. We have monthly team events (dinner, bowling, karting, poker nights, board-games etc.) for our team to get to know each other outside of work. Professionally, we host in-house conferences and an annual summer camp for all our global employees who are flown to and hosted in London. We ensure that all our employees also get pension contributions, the latest tech, generous annual leave and an amazing office with a balcony overlooking Notting Hill. Show more Show less

Job Title: Data Analyst â€“ Finance and Operations
Description: About us We are a venture backed (www.ycombinator.com) fintech company with an E-money license from the FCA and are in the very early stages of disrupting the way businesses exchange currencies and make cross-border payments. Youâ€‹ Are driven and ambitious, you are constantly challenging the status quo and are comfortable with ambiguity while solving problems with numbers. You must be excited by the prospect of taking on new responsibilities, have a great aptitude for learning, and enjoy contributing innovative ideas to our existing processes. Summary: As a Finance & Operations Data Analyst, your immediate responsibility will be to help us build sustainable processes that will optimise our efficiency in the Finance & Ops team. You will be driving continuous improvement and standardization of processes, including the implementation of best practices and automation initiatives, all the while collaborating with our tech team. Another significant responsibility will be to deliver timely financial reporting to our Senior management, as well as providing a commentary on this data. This is a brilliant opportunity to make the role your own and have truly noticeable impact our company. Responsibilities? Daily tasks: implementing and presenting daily reconciliations for the balance sheet accounts, while investigating and resolving issues. You will be working with a variety of data sources while identifying incomplete or inaccurate data, as well as their root causes. Daily analysis: generate weekly Profit and Loss figures and analysis including rationale for the movement. Process enhancement: initially you will work with the existing systems that we operate. You will also be looking at improving and automating tasks and building reconciliation processes and models. Knowledge of a coding language a bonus. Becoming a key member of the finance team: be prepared to investigate ad-hoc queries and transactions that come into the finance and operations department. Comfortably deal with large amounts of data from diverse databases, while maintaining and managing the proprietary admin platform. Complete customer analysis, segmentation and financial modelling What We Are Looking For: From employee 1 to employee 20, you will be slotting into a team that shares a number of traits: Â·You are bold enough to want to change the world, but wise enough to know it starts with little steps Â·You love to build, can get stuff and detest bureaucracy and red tape Â·You are constantly challenging the status quo and coming up with solutions to problems Â·You have lived in, are from, or are just plain passionate about emerging markets Â·You are passionate about start-ups, have had experience or crave experience in a high-growth start-up Â·You like taking ownership of tasks, are a self-starter and independent thinker. Skills and Experience required: Â·You have graduated with a 2.1(or equivalent) degree from a top school Â·Highly numerate and excellent attention to detail Â·Advanced Microsoft Office skills. Programming knowledge/ ability to code is a bonus Â·Able to manage and prioritize multiple tasks to completion and on time in pressured situations Â·Knowledge and understanding of the payments industry and electronic money institutions is a bonus Â·Excellent people and relationship building skills, across all seniority levels Â·Analytical, logical and data-driven approach to problem solving Show more Show less

Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Banking, and Financial Services
Description: Job Description: Job Title: Quantitative Business Analyst LOB: Global Credit Technology Corporate Title: Vice President Location: London Here in our London office we are looking to recruit for a Quantitative Analyst. This role is to support/lead Front Office trading Initiatives and regulatory projects, and you will have the opportunity to manage within the front office technology initiatives on trade capture, risk and P&L, regulatory reporting on credit products. Responsibilities include: Risk Engine computes Risk, PL Explain, ledges and complex scenarios for bond, credit derivatives, interest rate derivatives, loans and mortgage derivatives. The numbers produced by this system are used by traders, risk managers and MO personnel on a daily basis Working with traders and portfolio strategist to ensure the daily risk is delivered accurately and on time Providing business analysis support to traders, risk managers, trading support personnel and Finance - this includes explaining and justifying Risk, P/L Explain and GL numbers Assisting business teams in system User Acceptance testing planning and execution Team with FO Quant, Risk Quant, model validation and analytics developers to support new credit derivative products and model valuation. Ensure that the numbers produced by the RE are correct as the RE is enhanced and improved Participating in various retirement, business enablement and regulator initiatives with business and horizontal Technology teams Acting as primary sign-off point, coordinate deployment and go live plans with Tech & business partners The Team: The candidate will join a global team of business/product specialist with focusing on credit trading area. The team have been providing critical support functions to trading desks for the past 16 years. Core Skills: Master's degree or PhD required (preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics or related field). Extensive knowledge of fixed income finance, option pricing and modelling Previous experience in producing PV and sensitivities on Excel with Quant library Proven programming skills (Python, C++, SQL, or equivalent object-oriented programming) Experience in high pressure working environment within a financial institute Ability to successfully lead and deliver complex/critical projects in challenging environments Experience in Agile/Scrum Management and Agile Tools Ability to multitask across several project and assignment Experience operating in a decision-making role Experience facing off to the business Good leadership and communication skills and collaborate effectively across diverse/global team Bank of America Every day, across the globe, our employees bring a commitment to our purpose and to driving responsible growth by living our values: deliver together, act responsibly, realize the power of our people and trust the team. A key aspect of driving responsible growth is doing so in a sustainable manner, a critical pillar of which is being a great place to work for our teammates. In line with these values, in EMEA we have 9 Employee Networks, a wide range of Sports & Social clubs, and other development and networking opportunities so that you can enjoy a range of experiences and connect with colleagues across the bank. We also offer exclusive discounts to some of the most iconic cultural experiences for you to enjoy in your spare time outside of work. Learn more about our benefits here. Good conduct and sound judgment is crucial to our long term success. Itâ€™s important that all employees in the organisation understand the expected standards of conduct and how we manage conduct risk. Individual accountability and an ownership mind-set are the cornerstones of our Code of Conduct and are at the heart of managing risk well. We are an equal opportunities employer, and ensure that no applicant is subject to less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, gender identity, marital status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origins, age, sexual orientation, socio-economic background, responsibilities for dependants, physical or mental disability. The Bank selects candidates for interview based on their skills, qualifications and experience. We strive to ensure that our recruitment processes are accessible for all candidates and encourage any candidates to tell us about any adjustment requirements. As part of our standard hiring process to manage risk, please note background screening checks will be conducted on all hires before commencing employment. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Retail
Description: We are reinventing our business for the modern retail world. Our Strategy area for the Partnership will ensure that all of our customer data and insights are used to define where weâ€™ll play, how weâ€™ll win and what we prioritise to ensure that the strategic direction of our business is clear. We are looking for a Data Scientist who can work across teams, is self motivated and strives for continuous improvement. What's the role about? The core of this role is to help the Partnership make insight-driven, better informed, customer-centric decisions. In order to do this, you will need to work closely with teams across the Partnership, getting close to their world; hearing their problems and spotting the opportunities to make improvements. You will use your analytical mindset and knowledge of the customer to improve the speed and quality of decision making. The Data Science team is spread across a number of business domains that extends, for example, from typical business trading problems, to optimising supply chains and creating bespoke recommendations for our websites. We are looking for future Partners that are passionate about solving business problems that extend far and wide across really tangible consumer facing touchpoints that drive real impact in day to day situations. What will you be doing? Our expectation is that you will be a self starter that is able to work effectively together with a range of stakeholders to improve over and above the existing baseline for their requirements. We expect you to be able to trade off model complexity against relative rewards to drive improvement in your designated domain. Creativity is encouraged, if you feel we could do something differently and can prove this then we are sure that you will delight your stakeholders. We highly value continuous improvement and as such we actively promote designating part of a partnerâ€™s working week to upskilling in best practices and the latest methods or research. What is the process? We start by requiring applicants to provide a CV and to answer a number of practical job related questions. Pending screening, you will be invited to a 30 minute conversation to flesh out some of your stated CV experience. Pending success, you will receive a take home task that is seeking to evaluate first hand how you would tackle a typical business problem using your knowledge of the Data Science toolkit. The second round interview would then require a presentation on your findings from the dataset, motivational fit for the company and also your aspirations for the role. We follow this with a range of situational and technical based questions. We encourage any questions or curiosity throughout the process - Weâ€™re here to help make the process as enjoyable as possible for you. What you will have - A BSc in a Data Science related field such as Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science - An enthusiasm and natural ability to tackle an array of varied problems - A demonstrable applied use of Statistical and/or Data Science based techniques not limited to Supervised/Unsupervised Learning, Time Series Forecasting or Bayesian Statistics - Understanding of how to evaluate model performance and able to set up adequate tests during model deployment to confirm this - Experience of using Python (preferred) or R alongside relevant packages and libraries across a number of real world case studies - An ability to use SQL for data mining and preprocessing - Excellent communication skills, with proven ability to work across functional teams to translate complex business issues into potential solutions - Familiarity with combining structured and unstructured data sources to suit the problem task at hand - An open and sociable personality that thrives in a team based environment What else you could bring - Experience in retail and/or grocery - Experience with Agile methodologies - Significant work experience as a Data Scientist - Demonstrable evidence of being a self starter and proactivity in personal development - Literacy in Git version control - Experience with command line terminals (Bash / Linux OS) - Experience with Cloud based technologies (GCP - Preferred, AWS, Azure) - An ability to write clear and coherent pipelines that could be easily peer reviewed by a fellow colleague As a business we encourage flexible working. We have a number of different ways to work flexibly, so at your interview feel free to talk about what flexibility means to you. There are no guarantees, however, examples of how our Partners already work flexibly include part-time, job share, home working and compressed hours Show more Show less

Company Industry: Computer & Network Security
Description: At Shoji, we're making private data useful and keeping useful data private. Weâ€™re building the data sharing infrastructure of tomorrow to help businesses safely unlock the value of their most sensitive digital assets. The Shoji platform lets multiple teams or organisations solve problems, generate insights and even perform machine learning on private datasets, without ever moving or exposing the raw data. Weâ€™re motivated by what we enable for others. By unlocking access to data previously beyond reach, thereâ€™s no limit to the use-cases made possible. Whether itâ€™s banks being able to improve access to credit, doctors being able to make better diagnosis predictions or governments being able to more effectively allocate resources, we passionately believe that by protecting privacy, we can power the innovations that are most important to society. Who we are, our values and what we look for Founded in March 2021 by a team of statistical machine learning PhD students from Imperial College, weâ€™ve already received over Â£1.5m of backing from Entrepreneur First and a leading VC. Weâ€™re obsessed with technological progress, but only when it respects privacy. This dependency defines the way that we work. We value ambition, curiosity and proactivity, without compromising on transparency, integrity and humanity. Weâ€™re looking for people who constantly strive for improvement, in their own work and othersâ€™; people who prioritise product, with a bias for action; people with a hunger for solving hard and important problems, fast; people who are always looking to learn, not to be taught. Why being a software engineer at Shoji is different Thereâ€™s an abundance of opportunity here. Whether you want to be more customer facing, or have ownership of the products you build, or even contribute outside of your main role, weâ€™ll encourage and enable you. We work in small, highly-capable teams (sometimes breaking Bezosâ€™ two-pizza rule, but only because we are gluttons for good pizza!) Meritocracy is one of our founding principles. You will always get full credit for your contributions. So, if youâ€™re currently stuck in a role where youâ€™re going unnoticed or your boss is taking all the credit, come and join us for a better life. We encourage regular, omni-directional feedback so we can all improve and ensure everyone is fine and dandy. We can promise you a huge amount of autonomy, but also support from other brilliant minds. Minimum viable bureaucracy no unnecessary meetings taking your time away from building. What You Should Know Before You Consider Applying We steer clear of rigid requirements because we want to hire the best people for the role, regardless of their background, and thatâ€™s impossible to define on paper. It doesnâ€™t matter if youâ€™re fresh out of university, or if youâ€™ve honed your technical skills without pursuing further education. We love our people T-shaped. As long as youâ€™re a fast learner and brilliant engineer, we generally donâ€™t care about experience with specific technologies. You donâ€™t have to be a privacy enthusiast right now, but weâ€™ll bet you that soon after you join, youâ€™ll become one! What Youâ€™ll Be Doing As one of the early software engineers, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to play a key role in the success of Shoji. Your responsibilities will evolve with the business, but here are just some of the things weâ€™ll need you for Implementing cutting-edge research in the privacy-preserving ML space. Building an entire ecosystem of federated ML tools and services by extending existing OSS. This will evolve into our own ML and analytics platform in the future. Working closely with the CTO to develop new and extend existing ML procedures. This is an opportunity to get more involved from a research perspective if you want to, but youâ€™ll be able to choose the balance between research and engineering that best suits you. Optimising algorithms to make sure our ML components are fast AF. Longer term, youâ€™ll be expected to mentor and coach the more junior members of the team as we grow. Strong signs that you should apply You have strong exposure to a wide range of ML techniques to the extent where you could confidently discuss, reason about and write pseudocode for the main topics in any core ML textbook (e.g. ESL, or Bishop's PRML). You believe that ethics need to play a bigger role in the use of data for ML. You should be able to comfortably wrangle data to your will, whether it exists in a SQL database, a CSV, or some hierarchical format like JSON. You cringe when people talk about â€œbig dataâ€, and want to work with a team that understands ML isnâ€™t magic. You think â€œfederated learningâ€ has become another buzzword. You write tests that ensure that the maths makes sense. You relish the challenge of building scalable models in restrictive environments. You love being hands on and throwing yourself into code. If your current/last role was senior then you should have learned to delegate, but you should wish you could get back to being more involved again. The ideal person has A demonstrable, strong engineering background with good software development practices. Open-source contributions would be a big plus here, especially for projects in the data science/ML space. Solid experience with using DL frameworks and architectures for a variety of tasks. Experience implementing ML models in professional software production environments, including integrating with data processing pipelines. A good understanding of how to assess and improve both time and space computational complexity at the algorithm level, independent of programming language. Lots of exposure to the python data science stack would be very useful (despite our generally technology agnostic attitude, you would likely struggle in the role without this). Benefits ðŸ’° Â£50â€“80k salary based on experience. ðŸ“ˆ Competitive employee stock options so you can share in the company's success. ðŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸ Flexible work arrangements both hours and location. â›µ 28 days holiday and weâ€™ll give you Â£1k in holiday vouchers to take that time off. ðŸ”§ Â£2k equipment budget so you can work with the tools you love. ðŸ¥ Private health insurance. ðŸ£ Paid maternity and paternity leave. â˜• Free coffee/drinks in the office. ðŸ¥— Who said thereâ€™s no such thing as a free lunch? Team lunches are free on Friday. ðŸ• Pizza oven in the office. How The Application Process Works At Shoji, we're looking for people with drive, grit and initiative. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description â€“ it may even set you apart. It should take us 2 weeks to go through the hiring process and reach a decision. Simple first step send us your CV and an optional cover letter. Bonus points for providing your GitHub profile, or alternatively, including summaries and your involvement capacity in a few recent technical projects. [under 5 mins] Meet and greet call letâ€™s get to know each other. This is an opportunity for us to learn a bit about you, and for you to learn about Shoji. [30 min call] Technical interview no brain teasers or rare-CS-algo-that-youâ€™ll-never-use questions here. These questions will be practical and relevant to the role. This is an opportunity for us all to learn what itâ€™s like to work together. [1 hour remote interview] Take-home task at our discretion. Weâ€™ll reimburse you for your time, which should be no more than 2â€“3 hours. This is an opportunity for us to get a better understanding of how you work and what your work looks like with less pressure than the technical interview. [2â€“3 hours in your own time] Discussion interview weâ€™ll go over the technical interview (and take-home task if necessary) and also discuss all the non-technical parts weâ€™re interested in hearing about, including past projects. [30 mins â€“ 1 hour call] Final Interview youâ€™re almost there! Having already demonstrated outstanding technical competency, this interview will be more behavioural. Duration will be correlated with your level of experience, in separate sessions if appropriate. [1â€“3 hours worth of calls] Final decision we make you an offer if weâ€™re convinced youâ€™re the right person. At Shoji, weâ€™re ridiculously passionate about what we do, and are firm believers in our success being dependent on our people. We're fully committed to creating a diverse team of exceptional people. We embrace differences and hire purely based on merit, giving equal consideration to all applications, regardless of gender, background, race or any other characteristic that has absolutely nothing to do with competency. Description: Assistant Data Analyst Â£24,515 to Â£28,686 per annum Contract Type: Permanent Hours: Full-Time Location: 16 Summer Lane, Birmingham B19 3SD Closes: 05 July 2021 About The Job As Assistant Data Analyst you will join the Technical Team at Midlands Connect and have an important part to play in the continued development and enhancement of the Midlands Connect Strategy. You will use your technical skills to develop data analysis that will support the evidence base behind the refresh of the Midlands Connect Strategy. Following publication of the Strategy, you will work closely with delivery bodies (incl. Highways England, Network Rail, and Local Authorities) to develop evidence to deliver the priorities set in the Strategy. The analysis undertaken to support the strategy will filter down into the individual corridors and business cases within the strategy. What will you be doing? Develop a detailed understanding of the social and economic environment of the Midlands and the role transport plays enabling it, including direct research to improve understanding in this field Deliver work in a timely and efficient manner to the levels of quality and accuracy required, in order to provide an effective technical support service to internal and external customers Analyse data using a range of tools and techniques to contribute to the team's production of intelligence and management information Carry out research, gather data and perform analysis and calculations to support the development of intelligence and management information, or engineering solutions, by the team Act as a lead delivery resource on project workstreams related to the area of specialism to ensure that the project is delivered to time, cost, and quality standards Monitor systems, processes, and practices within area of specialism, plan and carry out regular reviews to identify opportunities for improvement considering changing needs, feedback, and/or current best practice thinking Carry out all work in line with standards and procedures and identify actual compliance issues in order to ensure that work delivered complies with all necessary requirements Attend external forums where necessary, in order to keep up to date with best practice and ensure personal awareness of relevant issues Collaborate with colleagues across Midlands Connect to ensure the technical services provided to the organisation are efficient, effective and support wider business objectives Be pro-active in your approach to learning new data analytical techniques to support business needs About You You will be numerate with demonstrable experience with analytics and data management to support decision-making. You will be competent in a range of tools to analyse, manage and share data with a willingness to learn new tools and data analytical techniques to serve business needs as and when required. You will be proactive in your approach to learn new technology and apply new ways of thinking to your work. The type of skills sought for the position are: GIS skills to analyse and present spatial data Experience with Excel Strong technical report writing skills Strong data analytical and visualisation skills An ability to present complex analysis and concepts to a non-technical audience Experience with creating, managing, and querying databases In addition to strong data analytical skills you will be organised and flexible to manage your own workload and assist other team members as and when required. You will be a team player and work collaboratively to achieve collective goals. About The Team Here at Midlands Connect, we explore, develop and recommend major transport projects which provide the biggest possible economic and social benefits for the Midlands and the rest of the UK. These initiatives will create more capacity for passengers and freight on the Midlands' roads and railways. As the Sub-national Transport Body for the Midlands and transport partner of the Midlands Engine, our partnership is vast: councils, LEPs, Chambers of Commerce, airports, HS2 Ltd, Network Rail, Highways England, and our sponsor the Department for Transport. About Us Our role in the West Midlands has never been more important and in these extraordinary times we've shown we can step forward, speak up for our region and bring people together. Everything we do is focused on making life better for people in the West Midlands - that's our reason for being here and it drives every move we make. We lead and support others to deliver our shared future vision for the region - a happier, healthier, better-connected place to live and work. We fully believe that we are only as great as the people who work for us and are committed to providing a positive, healthy and inclusive working environment where our people feel valued and respected. We are a "Leaders in Diversity" accredited organisation, are in the Inclusive Top 50 Employers List, and are one of The Times Top 50 Employers for Women. We're ambitious, forward-thinking, and determined to find better ways of working, always leading the way in what we do. We trust and support each other to get the job done and encourage creativity, originality, and curiosity from those who work with us. We're committed to creating an accessible and diverse workplace, one that nurtures an inclusive environment where our people can be themselves. Working with Risk and Controls teams and people across the business you will help find the best way to identify, assess, measure, manage and report on our risks and controls more effectively through the use of data. As part of our Enterprise Risk Team, not only will you take charge of Enterprise Risk Reporting data and deliver monthly reports for risk committees, but you will also have the ability to assess the data and its controls, working to identify potential problems and fix them where they arise. We are looking for someone who can manage our data and come up with innovative ideas on how we can make better use of it and implement those improvements. Youâ€™ll Spend Your Time Supporting the management of Monzoâ€™s risk data and developing improvements. Reviewing and assessing changes to operational processes that impact on our risk data Partnering with teams to help develop an understanding of our risk data and new ways of managing and using it Preparing monthly risk reporting for the Enterprise Risk and Board Risk Committees Supporting our risk leadership team on key projects that have an impact across the business Help embed good practice in relation to our risk data that is easy for everyone to understand through the development of documentation, delivery of training to other Monzonauts and and acting as a point of contact for any risk data questions they may have Promoting and helping embed a strong risk culture, making risk data meaningful and relevant to everyone at Monzo. You should apply if: You have 1-2 years experience in a data position and have an appetite to learn (years experience is a rough guide, please still apply if you are outside of this) You have worked in banking, financial services or risk consultancy You have a keen interest and proven experience in technology and data (risk knowledge is not required but would be a bonus) You have experience supporting the use and management of data Youâ€™re resilient and comfortable working in a fast paced environment where the day to day job differs You are hands-on, a strong influencer, stakeholder manager, great at execution, and focussed on the detail Youâ€™re curious and collaborative - youâ€™re great at asking incisive questions to pick things up and act on them quickly outcomes Logistics This role will be based in our London office (remote until office re-opens) with flexibility to work remotely as needed. We offer a competitive salary plus other benefits . We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team. Diversity and inclusion is a priority for us â€“ if we want to solve problems for people around the world, our team has to represent our customers. So we need to attract the best talent and create an environment that supports and includes them. You can read more about diversity and inclusion on our blog . If you prefer to work part-time, we'll make this happen whenever we can - whether this is to help you meet other commitments or strike a great work-life balance. The application process consists of a 30 mins phone call with a recruiter, an initial call with someone from the team, followed 2-3 on-video interviews at our office in London or remotely via hangouts. Description: Our client is a dynamic and fast-growing business engaged in catalogue and online retailing from its base in Swindon. Having grown its online and offline business from Â£34 million to Â£48.5 million in 2020, the company is maintaining a high rate of growth in 2021 and is now looking to appoint a Data & Insight Analyst to work alongside the marketing team to further enhance and understand our customers and campaign performance. This is a unique opportunity to join a successful, ambitious and innovative organisation committed to data based decision making, which you will shape and influence. Working within the technical department and reporting to the Head of Data and Business Analysis, you will be responsible for the provision of detailed, actionable reporting and insight for the group. This will primarily be focussed on marketing and customer insights - however you will also work with other functions across the business. We are an extremely data driven business and are always trying new things. You will be naturally curious, keen to explore datasets under your own initiative and to really get to know our brands and customers. This is an incredibly rewarding role in which you will often undertake work on behalf of board members to assist in data driven decision making. You will be clear, concise, and passionate in your approach to answering questions and using data to tell a story. Key Responsibilities Develop a deep understanding of the companyâ€™s customer base to support effective marketing and product merchandising strategies. Provide post-campaign analysis and insights to the marketing team and wider business. Using SQL, write queries to extract datasets that answer specific questions from key stakeholders. Be a key user and stakeholder of an in-house, bespoke database that provides a single customer view and is the engine of our marketing efforts - you will also work with developers on improvements. Work to optimise the marketing mix and improve customer targeting. Support the companyâ€™s wider efforts to maintain data quality and data hygiene. Support the budgeting process using a mix of historical data and modelling of future customer behaviour based on marketing plans. An understanding of direct marketing would be a distinct advantage (but not a necessity) - for instance, the concepts of single customer view, segmentation, and lifetime value analysis. Excellent SQL querying skills are essential as well as experience of working with Microsoft SQL Server. Experience of using a business intelligence tool, preferably PowerBI and associated Microsoft technologies. Comfortable in engaging in discussion with and presenting to board level colleagues. Commercially minded with experience of working with different departmental functions in a high volume transaction, B2C business. Good Excel skills - able to use the tool to help present data in a meaningful and actionable format. keywords; benchmarking against competitors and ensuring we out rank for key terms Work with the wider digital and marketing team to optimise Google Ads to serve company goals, following best practices reshape how data is used across the business, improving reporting and insights Manage the implementation of our Google Analytics, defining the tagging strategy and standards, ensuring a consistent problem areas and opportunities to be easily identified and addressed Build and maintain weekly, monthly & quarterly SEO reports tracking content performance, traffic analytics and search trends Assist with the creation and management of real time dashboards to report on KPIs and SEO performance, providing real-time insights to the business Assist our UX functions to implement automated customer surveys on our websites and analyse the insights Analyse our technical SEO and work closely with our developers to ensure the platform is optimised and any changes to design and UX retain or improve organic ranking Understand and monitor the latest changes and trends the SEO landscape, making recommendations to ensure the Japan Centre Group addresses any important shifts Generate detailed guidelines or a â€˜playbookâ€™ that can be used by our digital and marketing teams in order to update update and maintain SEO data, ensuring that we can rank as highly as possible in google and against our competitors Work with the wider Digital and Ecommerce team on group projects such as new website builds, assisting with SEO considerations Provide weekly and monthly reports outlining key KPIs with recommendations on updates/changes that are required. Experience: A degree level marketing or technical qualification is desirable / or extensive experience in digital marketing / SEO management / Data analysis role Relevant marketing experience in the hospitality & retail sector, would be highly desirable Appreciation for Japanese & Asian culture, products and cuisine, is desirable either through work, study or through personal social connections An appreciation and some knowledge of the Japanese language would be desirable and must have Native English or equivalent Minimum of 5-10 years in a similar role would be desirable, agency experience is welcomed Skills & Attributes Excellent numerical and IT skills including (MS Office â€“ Word, Excel and Outlook, Google Sheets, Documents and Slides) Expert user of Google Analytics, Google Search Console and other SEO tools such as SEMrush, ScreamingFrog Expert user with crawling tools: eg; Botify, Screaming Frog SEO Spider. Expert understanding of SEO principles and best practice from both a technical and content perspective Extensive experience of using SEO analytics tools to shape strategy and ongoing activities to drive traffic Excellent knowledge of search engine optimisation practices The ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast paced environment, while maintaining a positive attitude Ability to work independently and as part of a wider team to implement SEO campaigns, insights reports, proposals etc Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of stakeholders and suppliers Excellent organisational and time management skills Team player, with ability to work at all levels High attention to detail Interested in all things digital and new trends Collaborative and able to build great working relationships within our internal team and external partners Ability to communicate ideas clearly, effectively, persuasively to an individual or a group Show more Show less

Company Industry: Information Technology and Services
Description: AnyVision is a world leading team of scientists and engineers that creates AI for the Real World. With deployments and clients spanning the globe, we are recognized as leaders in the fields of Face Recognition, Object Recognition, Object Detection, and Visual Target Tracking. AnyVision is dedicated to providing a diverse and flexible work environment so that we can recruit and retain the best talent. The research optimization team is building cutting edge AI platform to deliver the most efficient inference to wide spectrum of devices at scale in production. Our vision is to offer end-end fully automated solution to developers and researchers, with which they will be able to optimize and deploy AI capabilities to any hardware. The role will offer broad opportunities to be exposed to various AI systems and hardware, and you will enjoy working on with cutting-edge optimization research and development that can be implemented and deployed to our AI products. You are: You are a highly motivated individual with a rigorous, meticulous, and scientific approach to life. You have completed a degree in a scientific discipline, with some emphasis on programming. You should be comfortable working within a team when it suites the project at hand, but also be capable of working on your own if needs be. You are creative and passionate about large-scale research problems with very professional engineering experience to deliver your work to the field. You will: l Work on a platform for ML model optimization and deployment. l Design, build and manage processes to deploy production models and monitor their quality and performance. l Focus on making deployment manageable and scalable from edge device to cloud. l Develop automation strategies for deployment of ML models. l Research on machine-learning-based optimizations for better performance and efficiency. l Explore and develop hardware-aware optimization algorithms in our platform. l Improve the team and yourself through brainstorm, design review, code review, etc. Requirements: Must have skills: l Experience implementing or optimizing linear algebra operators. l Strong Python and C++ skills (highly template programming). l Experienced on deep learning frameworks e.g., Caffe, PyTorch l Knowledge or an awareness of GPGPU programming models like CUDA, OpenCL, SYCL l Familiar with computer architecture, low-level optimisation, via compilers or manual. l Experienced in ML model optimization techniques (compression, quantization, etc). l Familiar with software development lifecycle. Beneficial Skills l Developing experience on inference engines e.g. OpenVino, TensorRT. l Familiar with deep learning compiler stacks such as TVM, TC, nGraph. l Working knowledge of compilers and compiling techniques (Clang/LLVM) l Android/IOS development experience. Company Industry: Internet, Retail, and Consumer Services
Description: *Data Analyst - Nottinghamshire* About your role* **We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join us here at Buzz Bingo.** Joining us means joining our family. We know lots of companies say that, but we really believe it's true. Our teams in Club Support Centre and our clubs across the country are smart, energised, and passionate about what they do. We know each person here can make a big difference, so we'll support your professional goals, give you what you need to thrive, and help you accomplish the right results - whatever your role. We're dedicated to building Bingo's Buzziest Community every single day and making our players feel as much a part of our family as we do. Main duties & responsibilities* Working in our Commercial Finance team, you'll extract, transform and report on our customer data, enabling our Risk and Compliance department to make key decisions as well as supporting our Customer Insights Manager on ad hoc customer analysis and insight. Data extraction and transformation, aggregating data from multiple sources to provide an assessment. Analysis of data to evaluate potential risks and concerns with an understanding of any impact on the business. Creating and maintaining both periodic and ad-hoc reports using SQL and PowerBI with large datasets from a variety of sources. Liaising with colleagues throughout the business to determine how we can help their decision making with data and reporting. Developing processes for the gathering, storage and presentation of data. Completing user acceptance testing of all new risk and compliance data sources and data changes, checking large sets of data for anomalies or inaccuracies. Supporting the wider team with a variety of reports and analysis. Skills, Knowledge and Behaviour* The successful applicant will have experience gained within a similar role within a data or analysis team. You'll have a strong knowledge of relevant statistical and IT packages (e.g. SAS/SPSS/R/Python) and have experience of analysing datasets to identify trends with the ability to present findings in clear to understand formats. A passion for data and how it can be used to support our business is essential and you'll enjoy working on new ideas and leading the way in implementing them. Excellent communication skills are essential and you'll build relationships across all levels of the business. In addition we are looking for; Experience using relational databases (SQL Server) Demonstrable Excel data analysis skills Knowledge of Data Visualization tools (Power BI / Tableau / Qlik / R Shiny) Experience of analysing datasets to identify trends and presenting the findings in clear to understand formats Experience of improving on existing working practices Experience of delivering consistently good work in a fast-paced environment You're able to present information clearly at a level appropriate to the audience You have an inquisitive mind, focused on addressing and solving data and analysis problems You can adopt a common sense/logical approach to mathematical reasoning You exhibit strong attention to detail, time management and prioritization skills You have a desire to improve quality and efficiency of existing outputs. Summary* It's an exciting time to join us here at Buzz Bingo, as well as a competitive salary up to 35,000 (doe) we offer a great range of benefits and genuine opportunities for career progression. This is a full time, permanent role offering a mix of remote and office based working, our support centre is based in Nottingham so the successful applicant will need to live within a commutable distance. If you have the skills and experience we are looking for and are ready for a fresh challenge within a great team then apply today for immediate consideration. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Online Media, Newspapers, and Media Production
Description: About us: The Independent is a politically agnostic, online news publisher with over 114 million unique global visitors a month. Established in 1986 as a national broadsheet newspaper The Independent transitioned to fully digital only publisher in 2016, in pursuit of sustainability, and to keep its values alive. Through www.independent.co.uk, www.indy100.com websites, its subscription and contribution services, as well as its syndication and advertising businesses, the Independent continue the work of many decades. The operations team: The operations team consists of three main parts: Campaign Management, Programmatic Operations and Ad Technology. This Programmatic Data Analyst will be working with the programmatic team having a focus on programmatic reporting outputs and the interpretation thereof. About you: You will possess advance data skills and thrive in an environment with large volumes of data and be able to present the reports in a timely fashion You have the ability to decode a complex data set into an easy and digestible manner, reporting it to various key stakeholders You thrive in a fast pace, high demanding environment You are a problem solver and wonâ€™t stop until you have figured out the answer Accuracy, attention to detail and time keeping are key to this role Job purpose: The Programmatic Data Analyst is responsible for implementing, maintaining, and enhancing complex online advertising data through the use of relevant tools to produce various insights helping to optimise advertising monetisation setups. This position will provide support mainly to the programmatic team to monitor and improve revenues, find issues and help resolve them. Key responsibilities and accountabilities: Rapidly develop proficient working knowledge of all platforms used within the AdOps programmatic team Compilation of regular management information reports from data sources You will also be responsible for ad hoc reporting on a day to day basis Identify any issues and report it to the stakeholders Develop ETLs to accumulate and report efficiently Use data analysis to facilitate revenue growth Find new ways to look into data that can produce valuable insights Ensure that required reporting is done in an accurate and timely manner to ensure complete and accurate revenue recognition Handle all data securely and responsibly, observing the Data Protection Act and Company Code of Conduct SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Proven experience in programmatic advertising (publisher preferable) Robust analytical abilities and quantitative skills including experience of providing reporting and optimization analysis Demonstrable command of SQL with experience of projects carried out academically or for leisure is essential Demonstrable experience of handling dataset with Python, using libraries like Numpy, Pandas, and Mathplotlib is advantageous Experience with Cloud-based services, such as GCP or AWS is desirable Exposure to ML tools such as Google Cloud AI Platform or Tensorflow would be an advantage Be highly inquisitive Great communication skills and strong collaborative skills Ability to work to deadlines, to prioritize work load and deliver accurate information on time to a high standard â€“ and be comfortable under pressure and amenable to out of hours issue resolution Ability to multi-task and work efficiently in a high-paced environment Show more Show less

Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet
Description: NOW is bold, ambitious, dynamic â€“ and proud to host the world's best entertainment. We're the only place to get Sky Cinema and Sky Sports without a contract. We're brilliant TV made by brilliant people. We're big on real diversity, inclusion and collaboration. And we need talent to keep pushing boundaries and grow our brand. Big-thinkers. Changemakers. Showstoppers. Join in. As a member of the Data Journeys team you will use Data Science techniques to optimise journeys with improved targeting within NOW TV to maximise customer experience! What You'll Do Developing relationships with stakeholders to reach a deep understanding of their business areas and inform best approach Understanding the commercial opportunities that exist to improve the way we make decisions with better insights Be a key driver in delivering the team's optimisation roadmap for data journeys utilising data science techniques Support development of a common predictive framework to optimise customer journeys with the use of data and best available tools and environments Develop, refine and scale data management and analytics procedures, systems, workflows & best practices What You'll Bring Data Science experience: Strong understanding of data science methods using open source or commercial tools Big Data experience: Experience in dealing with very granular data, using key Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hive/Cassandra/Impala/HBase and others) and comfortable with Linux/UNIX environments. Company Industry: Hospital & Health Care
Description: Organisation: Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust (GSTT) Increase your chances of reaching the interview stage by reading the complete job description and applying promptly. Roles: Information (Data) Analyst Salary: Â£29,888 Location London Bridge, London Contract Length: Two Year Fixed Term Contract Start Date: ASAP, following assessment centre The Organisation Guy's and St Thomas' is among the UK's busiest and most successful NHS foundation trusts. We provide a full range of hospital and community services for people in south London and as well as specialist care for patients from further afield including cancer, renal, orthopaedic, respiratory and cardiovascular services. Guy's is home to the largest dental school in Europe and a Â£160 million Cancer Centre opened in 2016. As part of our commitment to provide care closer to home, in 2017 we also opened a cancer centre and a kidney treatment centre at Queen Mary's Hospital in Sidcup. St Thomas' has one of the largest critical care units in the UK and one of the busiest emergency departments in London. It is also home to Evelina London Children's Hospital. In February 2021 the Royal Brompton and Harefield joined Guy's and St Thomas' NHS Foundation Trust, bringing together world-leading expertise in the care and research of heart and lung disease. Our merger provides a once in a generation opportunity to build a lasting, world-renowned heart and lung centre, providing the highest quality care for patients and conducting world-leading research. We have a reputation for clinical excellence and high quality teaching and research. We are part of King's Health Partners, one of eight accredited UK academic health sciences centres. In partnership with King's College London we have dedicated clinical research facilities and a National Institute for Health Research (NIHR) Biomedical Research Centre. The Role The main purpose of this post is to support the delivery of information and reporting to and on behalf of the Trust. The post will act as department lead on several internal reports and national submissions, where they will manage and coordinate the overall process from design to extraction to submission and ensure all requirements are met. In doing so the post holder will become expert in NHS and Trust datasets and will be required to liaise with service managers, operational leads and clinicians. The role will offer the candidate the opportunity to familiarise themselves with a range of health systems and datasets to support clinical staff and inform operational processes. They will gain experience with a variation of reporting tools and methods and will be exposed to data quality issues and resulting data assurance techniques. The candidate will also work closely with new HER programme to ensure the reporting and data development meets departmental needs. The role will involve a variety of tasks which could include: Running existing and developing new reports Manipulating and collating complex datasets in order to produce the Trust's performance reports and mandatory submissions, ensuring they are presented, distributed and submitted to a strict timetable Drafting communications and liaising with relevant service leads Ensuring process documentation is kept up to date Developing in-depth knowledge in a variety of health technology areas and datasets Ensuring a high quality of data for use in departmental reporting The Candidate The Ideal Candidate Will Be Educated To Degree Level, Preferably In a Scientific Discipline, And Will Have Knowledge And Experience In One Or More Of The Following Areas Data analysis and statistics Health care information management and/ or reporting Scientific research Healthcare service delivery (clinical or non-clinical). Project management Implementation of technological innovations Experience in dealing with clients They will also have excellent interpersonal skills and will be comfortable working with large, complex datasets and data management tools such as Microsoft Excel. Skills And Experience The ideal candidate will possess one or more of the following skills; Advanced ability using Microsoft Excel and (VBA macros/ advanced formulas) Attention to detail and ability to recognise insensible data Time management and the ability to work efficiently to strict deadlines Experience with Power BI to visualise data Proficient at technical report writing and possess a high level of written English If you are interested in the opportunity then please apply by uploading your CV and write a cover letter of no more than 1000 words, detailing what skills and experience you can bring to the role. Closing date: 23:59 Tuesday 13th July 2021 Virtual Assessment centre: Thursday 12th August Show more Show less

Description: ABOUT THE ROLE Do you have real interest and enthusiasm for Data Science and the application of Data and Insights in a commercial environment? Description: Data Scientist The Data team at Smarkets is responsible for continuously developing the tools and the mindset for a unified and consistent data approach across the company. The teamâ€™s responsibilities mostly span across three different areas: Data Engineering: development and maintenance of ETL pipelines, APIs and data-related infrastructure  Data Science: data exploration, machine learning modelling and implementation of models in code Reporting: create reports for different teams and promote data visualisation and infographics In a typical week, the Data team would: Add a new task to the Marketing ETL pipeline that fetches daily promotions activity from the promotions microservice and makes it available in our Redshift data warehouse Add a new endpoint to a Flask API, add unit tests, and deploy the new version of the API into our production Kubernetes cluster Train and evaluate a Deep Learning-based Recommender System using Keras, and provide it as a service through a Flask API Your primary responsibility would be working on Data Science-related tasks: data exploration, training and validating ML models, implementing ML models in code, reporting and infographics. However, we also expect that you can pick up any data engineering-related tasks if business priorities so dictate. Our present core current tech stack consists of Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, Python, Postgres, Kafka and Redshift. About you You have 4+ years of experience as a hands-on data scientist or a data engineer You are fluent in many tools of the Python data science stack, e.g. Pandas, Numpy, Sklearn, Keras, PySpark You have experience training and evaluating machine learning models, as well as deploying these into production You have good software engineering skills, namely on the development of Python-based REST APIs and services, integration with databases (e.g. Postgres) and data warehouses (e.g. Redshift, BigQuery) You enjoy writing elegant, well-tested and maintainable code You are a team player that enjoys contributing to the success of the team and the company in a proactive, happy and friendly environment You have a bachelorâ€™s in Computer Science, Maths or equivalent field, or possess relevant experience Our Culture Smarkets brings a professional approach to the sports betting world which has allowed us to create one of the most sophisticated products in the industry. Our mission at Smarkets is to fix the betting industry with good products and good prices. We embrace collaboration and our culture of trust, innovation, and scientific rigour has enabled us to grow to where we are today. Our people have a large impact on the product - be it changing the direction of our technical stack or pushing new features - you'll be key in driving Smarkets forward. Our culture is built on the principles of self-management and rewards people on merit and excellence, avoiding the bureaucracy of pyramid management. Ultimately we are a group of like-minded individuals who enjoy learning, playing, and eating the excellent meals provided by the chefs! Smarkets is an equal opportunities employer and takes active steps to prevent bias and discrimination in our interview process. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or gender identity Show more Show less

Job Title: Analyst, Data Management and Quantitative Analysis
Description: The OPTISM Business Insight and Transformation team provide data analytics, ETL and Baseline solutions for Operations Payments, Treasury Services, Issuer Service and Markets (OPTISM). You will be responsible for completing regulatory data requests, creating SQL and ETL workflows to extract and transform data and using various visualisation tools to create fully automated data solutions. You will be a key point of contact for internal data requests from across OPTISM, Risk, Compliance, Treasury and more, as well as having working knowledge of teams current suite of reporting. You will be able to combine your data analytics skills with business analysis, business acumen, risk awareness, and be comfortable working within Agile principles and adhering to our Software Development Life Cycle. Key Attributes Data and business analysis: Researching, gathering business requirements, assessing new requests against existing reporting capabilities, for both regulatory and internal MI request, and developing new data solutions. Using SQL and ETL tools to extract and transform data. Leveraging business knowledge to produce powerful and fast paced analysis. Strong communication skills - including ability to engage key stakeholders, manage expectations, and maintain strong communication lines amongst global team. Being risk aware - understanding risks and following an SDLC to mitigate risk. Skills & Experience Experience with analysing large datasets. SQL and ETL knowledge preferred. Operations Payments, Treasury Services, Issuer Service or Markets business knowledge advantageous. Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Advanced degree in quantitative analysis preferred. 0-3 years experience preferred. Experience in quantitative finance and technology preferred. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Our ambition is to build the best global team â€“ one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve â€“ and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums. Primary Location: United Kingdom-Greater Manchester-Manchester Job: Operations Internal Jobcode: 70128 Organization: Global Pymnts & Treas Serv Ops-HR06382 Requisition Number: 2110438 Show more Show less

Company Industry: Computer Software, Banking, and Financial Services
Description: PURPOSE OF ROLE Reporting to the Head of Monetisation, the Data Analyst will provide insights into customer behaviour, engagement, and monetisation opportunities. KEY RESPONSIBLITIES Provide the data to inform monetisation strategy and assess the contribution of individual activities to this strategy Build a framework to allow robust and consistent assessment of monetisation activities, especially campaign and experimental activity Analyse customer behaviour on-site, in-app, and via other online and offline channels to inform engagement and monetisation activities Use surveys and focus groups to generate qualitative and quantitative data from customers Present analysis and insight to the Senior Commercial management team Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Ad hoc analysis as required Maintain the first line of Risk/Compliance defence by ensuring individual adherence to business processes and procedures that are designed to meet the regulatory standards set out in the relevant FSA rules and guidance. Maintain the first line of Risk/Compliance defence by ensuring individual adherence to business processes and procedures that are designed to meet the regulatory standards set out in the relevant FCA rules and guidance. Make informed risk decisions and effectively and credibly debate and challenge management recommendations within your role in line with the approved Risk Management Framework. Maintain the first line of defence by reviewing/supporting the risks and controls assigned to the department. Promote change through Root Cause Analyse from Risk events completed. Knowledge of the regulatory environment and associated risks that require managing. Logging/reviewing and creating actions around Risk Events â€“Understanding Risk via training and documentation available. Requirements SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED PowerBI, Google analytics, SQL, excel Able to package insight into crisp and clear fashion Able to explain and defend analysis under close scrutiny 4+ years experience Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Desire to learn with a can-do attitude Knowledge of the regulatory environment and associated risks that require managing Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Show more Show less

Company Industry: Construction
Description: Merit is an award-winning design, engineering and construction company. Services to our clients range from new build construction, high-end office fit out, GMP cleanrooms, process services, laboratories and warehousing. Key to our success is listening to our clientâ€™s requirements and understanding every detail of the design and construction process. From concept through to commissioning, validation and handover, we use expert resources including in house estimating and design teams to consistently deliver high quality facilities. We also self-perform critical work packages including cleanroom installation and M&E services installation. The business also operates a fabrication facility, based in Cramlington, Northumberland, which supports all the business streams providing prefabricated plant and pipework. Further company information is detailed on the Merit website www.merit.co.uk Role Purpose: Provide the leadership, energy and enthusiasm to deliver your objectives and strategic goals, including:- To lead the analysis and reporting of financial and commercial performance across multiple construction projects utilising MMC and offsite manufacturing. Provide FP&A leadership to the project teams to drive project profitability, resource allocation, budget management, and provide relevant insight, analysis and commentary. Identify opportunities to improve the financial and commercial performance of the business through analysis and benchmarking of current and projected future performance. Ownership of CVR reporting, analysis and action plans to drive profitability and enable data driven commercial decision making. Drive process improvement to deliver productivity and business efficiency. Analyse labour productivity across the factory and sites, working with management to identify opportunity areas for focus and dissemination of best practice. Develop reporting through existing tools and implementation of new reporting technology and improved automation. Design, implementation and system maintenance of performance management tools. Develop a high-quality analytical capability with deep understanding of performance (P&L and cash) across all projects including key drivers of performance. Pioneer future FP&A reporting solutions, ABC modelling, or others as identified, to enable the development of rich, on-time data analysis. Articulate results, influence business decisions, and collaborate on metrics, goals, and business reviews. Identify and research variances to forecast, plan, and compare and contrast across projects, proactively proposing opportunities for improvement. Partner with leaders to develop business intelligence that will enhance financial and commercial reporting and drive change. Carry out profitability reviews with stakeholders through leading a collaborative workshop process. Skills and Experience Required: Very strong Excel skills (vlookups, pivot tables etc) and interrogation of financial systems skills. Very strong numerical, analytical problem-solving skills. Experience of building and using activity-based cost and analysis models. Experience of evaluating cost efficiency initiatives and data mining. Track record of improving cost efficiency through detailed costs analysis versus design outcomes. Ability to process data from disparate sources and generate meaningful management information, produce financial reports in a clear and concise manner. Ability to think logically and can demonstrate a track record of researching and investigating issues. Ability to create pragmatic, innovative solutions to complex business problems. Displays well developed inter-personal skills, sufficient to engage confidently and effectively with a wide range of stakeholders. Confidence to work with senior managers and challenge assumptions where appropriate. Strong communicator with proven experience of building constructive relationships with budget-holders and senior management. Able to work under pressure and deliver against set objectives. Prioritising and planning workloads effectively to deal with conflicting priorities and meeting deadlines. Self-motivated, determined and a â€˜can doâ€™ attitude. You must be a driven and motivated individual who is eager to learn. Experience of construction projects, MMC and offsite manufacturing desirable. Proven Capability in the following areas:- Proactive leadership with a focus on bringing innovative solutions and overcoming obstacles. An ability to work either independently or part of a team, adopting the most effective approach to ensure all team tasks are completed to the best of each individualâ€™s ability. A tenacious self-starter always looking for a better way to deliver and pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Positive communication skills in dealing with stakeholders so that customer satisfaction and awareness is maintained, and problems are satisfactorily resolved in a timely and effective manner. Excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills. Leadership: Recognises opportunities. Forms a vision of what can be achieved. Challenges self and others to deliver exceptional results. Results Driven: Sorts through complex data; gathers relevant viewpoints. Identifies important issues, thinking through alternatives. Integrates intuition and data, makes well-reasoned conclusions and develops robust plan of action. Recognises developing problems and handles them well. Sets up robust monitoring and anticipates/responds to change with pace and practicality Focus on Excellence: Willing to go the extra mile to exceed expectations. Continually searches for ways to add value and take performance to the next level. Sets high standards and expects the same from self and others Teamwork & Collaboration: Puts aside personal agendas to work for the benefit of the customers and suppliers and other stakeholders. Proactively builds knowledge through sharing knowledge, ideas and expertise with others. Works collaboratively across internal and external functions/people. Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers. Actively collects customer information and uses it to improve services and solutions. Manages the experience of customers to ensure long-term relationships are built and maintained. Operational Excellence: Plans and organises work to safely achieve maximum efficiency and output. Recognises the most important issues; makes effective plans; gets resources in place to achieve key objectives. Delivers strong results consistently Honesty & Integrity Demonstrates honesty, integrity, high personal standards and sound business ethics. Builds trust with others through personal authenticity and follows through on commitments. Adaptability: Learns quickly. Adapts positively to changing business and customer demands - is energised by change. Able to adapt and flex own style and approach to suit the circumstance. Demonstrates resilience and capability to handle multiple priorities, pressure and pace. Innovation: Finds new improvement opportunities; generates ways to get better results. Searches out and re-applies proven ideas and methods to new situations. Reviews performance to learn from the past and improve the future. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet
Description: Description At Eurostar weâ€™re busy making Europeâ€™s most loved travel experience better than ever. Join us and youâ€™ll be part of a dynamic, connected, cosmopolitan team that feels at home in four countries and shares the same goal â€“ to create an experience for our passengers thatâ€™s always truly exceptionnel. Do you want to be part of this journey? As our digital Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing reporting infrastructure and providing actionable reporting on Eurostarâ€™s web properties (website, app). You will be working closely with stakeholders across the insights and implementation teams to understand their needs and build dynamic, robust data pipelines. Requirements We are looking for someone to... Champion our goal of democratising data and insight Efficiently automate APIs and data sources to retrieve and validate data so it can be used across various teams Be a subject matter expert for Google BigQuery, advanced data architecture, and understand how we use and share data Develop reporting infrastructure in BigQuery using SQL, Python, and Airflow (creating datamarts and maintaining ETL jobs). Maintain data infrastructure in Google Cloud (Compute Engine, BigQuery, Pushing JSON into reporting APIs, Cloud Composer / Airflow) Work with internal stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and data structure. Be responsible for maintaining efficient flow of data from disparate sources into structured data to be used by insights team Lead our digital data governance and ensure continued compliance to adhere to current regulations You'll need... To demonstrate expertise in handling web analytics data, BigQuery, Python, SQL, and Airflow Experience maintaining databases, data marts and ETL jobs Experience joining data from multiple different sources into a single reliable location Knowledge of scripting and scheduling command line jobs in UNIX (BASH / Cron jobs) Practical knowledge of data visualisation tools (Tableau, PowerBI or another query data visualisation tool) Experience supporting time sensitive data pipelines Experience working within an ecommerce environment Ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources. You will have the customer at the heart of your decision, connecting commercial goals with service needs The Right to Work in the UK Benefits Travel benefits for work and play A great pension Exclusive discounts and perks If you feel like your skills and experience are relevant for the role, please don't hesitate to apply! Eurostar is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services
Description: Who are we? Hi! ðŸ‘‹ We are Ravelin! We're a fraud detection company using advanced machine learning and network analysis technology to solve big problems. Our goal is to make online transactions safer and help our clients feel confident serving their customers. And we have fun in the meantime! We are a friendly bunch and pride ourselves in having a strong culture and adhering to our values of empathy, ambition, unity and integrity. We really value work/life balance and we embrace a flat hierarchy structure company-wide. Join us and youâ€™ll learn fast about cutting-edge tech and work with some of the brightest and nicest people around - check out our Glassdoor reviews. If this sounds like your cup of tea, we would love to hear from you! For more information check out our blog to see if you would like to help us prevent crime and protect the world's biggest online businesses. The Role We are currently looking for a data scientist to join a fantastic team of client-facing data scientists and client support analysts. You will be working with data scientists and crime analysts to discover patterns and trends concerning fraud in our clients' data. In this key role, you'll be applying exploratory analysis to form realistic and useful narratives from data, asking â€œwhyâ€ as well as â€œwhatâ€ and â€œhow". You will interact directly and indirectly with clients to help them understand what is happening with their fraud, and help us to target our efforts ever more precisely. Responsibilities Monitor and optimise client performance Identify fraud patterns, trends and emerging threats Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses Discuss specific fraud problems with clients, in order to deeply understand how they manifest and to propose effective and elegant solutions Produce regular analytical reports for clients that provide actionable insights into their fraud patterns Present findings of analysis to clients (including on-site visits) Identify ideas for new ML features, and work closely with Detection team to improve model performance Surface and dark web intelligence gathering - are up to date on the latest fraud trends and use this to counteract new fraud techniques Requirements Experience or training as a data analyst, intelligence analyst or data scientist Strong critical thinking skills, intuitively curious and able to diagnose data issues Strong communication and presentation skills Diligence, attention to detail, ability to prioritise and follow through on tasks Knowledge of SQL - ability to run complex queries to answer your own questions Knowledge or understanding of Jupyter Notebooks, pandas, R or similar The desire to thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment Some knowledge, understanding or experience of data science topics (machine learning knowledge a bonus) Desirable: some knowledge, understanding or experience of network analysis Benefits Competitive salary & equity package A minimum of 25 days annual leave + bank holidays Flexible working hours Individual learning and development allowance of Â£1,000/year Remote volunteer opportunities and monthly company charity donations Fortnightly team lunches with different people from across the company (currently via video chat!) Virtual quarterly company socials Cycle-to-Work and childcare schemes Virtual yoga twice per week as well as weekly board game and movie nights Show more Show less
