Company Industry: Financial Services
Description: About Allica Bank Allica Bank exists to empower small and medium sized businesses to succeed. Through our unique combination of modern tools, local relationships and tailored expertise we deliver expert banking for business Britain. You will be joining Allica as we continue building a business dedicated to serving the needs of small and medium-sized companies at what is a crucial time for the sector. Purpose of Role As a Business Support Analyst you will be responsible for providing support across the Business for our Internal and External customers. You will be supporting applications for all customer facing systems used across the business, contribute towards business planning; manage and analyse data requests and assist in systems development and integration. You will be responsible for resolving/escalating issues and providing suggestions/solutions to improve user and customer experience and subsequent procedural changes. You will be responsible for maintaining data integrity and product support across our core banking systems. Principal Accountabilities Primary application support for the customer facing core banking systems, providing input and leadership on triage with 3rd parties to resolve software/application defects. Receive, resolve and escalate production incidents via Helpdesk ticket function from internal and external customers within agreed SLAâ€™s. Work closely with Product Owners to improve process/procedures to provide better experience for users and customers and serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the Design, Continuous Improvement and Product management teams through which requirements flow. Perform core Banking systems data analysis and cleansing to ensure regulatory reporting requirements are met. Implement new procedures where required and provide ongoing updates across existing processes and procedures. Manage and deliver any administrative configuration change across core Banking systems adhering to four eye check principles, including maintaining configuration across Test environments. Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language. Collaborate with Product Owners to establish the vision and analyse trade-offs between usability and performance needs. Be the liaison between the business technology teams and support teams. Feature Team Activity Helpdesk function â€“ manage ticket/issue priorities, provide regular updates on open tickets to relevant stakeholders Writing high quality Procedures and Procedure updates Writing high quality documentation for issues and CORE banking system configurations Maintain data integrity across CORE banking systems Liaise with 3rd party suppliers, set up calls including relevant stakeholders to resolve issues/implement new business requirements Stakeholder relationship management, with the ability to communicate and present to a range of audiences and reaching consensus between different needs Business process improvement using process & data knowledge Personal Attributes & Experience Able to prioritise Helpdesk tickets against business requirements Clear and accurate communication skills both written and verbal to articulate issues/solutions and subsequent improvements. Knowledge of core Banking systems and their function/place within the system structures. The ability to work under pressure on multiple tasks using tools available such as JIRA, Confluence. Ability to both understand the nature of issues/business requirements and have the critical/detailed eye to ensure it meets the customer needs. Have an Agile mindset and able to handle changing business needs & priorities The ability to remain calm under pressure, motivate others and suggest change Strong analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach Desire to resolve issues and provide an excellent service to customer (internal and external) Financial/Account/Business & Retail current account knowledge and understanding will be a huge benefit. You have strong data visualisation skills You're comfortable with writing and maintaining code. Our preference is that your language of choice for data-wrangling is Python. Description: SuperAwesome SuperAwesome powers the kidsâ€™ digital media ecosystem. Our technology is used by hundreds of brands and content-owners to safely engage with over half a billion kids every month. For SuperAwesome â€˜law is opportunity,â€™ as we develop innovative technology-based solutions to enable compliance with global data protection laws and child safety best practices. The Role Weâ€™re looking for people whoâ€™ve collaborated on designing and building successful products that users love. Specifically, weâ€™re looking for an awesome Business Analyst to help us build out our Kids Web Services platform and deliver on our mission to make the internet safer for kids. Youâ€™ll be the Business Analyst working across two cross-functional teams, each of 4-9 software engineers, product managers and designers. You are excellent at prioritisation, highly analytical, and research-centric in your thinking. Youâ€™ll ideally have some previous experience researching both B2B products and consumer â€˜utilityâ€™-style B2C products (e.g. checkout, identity/login, search). The Business Analyst works to solve the problems described by the Product Manager, based on expert knowledge of and research into our customersâ€™ business objectives, an understanding of the competitive environment, of technical solutions and constraints, and the requirements of kidsâ€™ digital privacy regulation around the world. The Product Kids Web Services (KWS) is a kidtech platform for developers who are creating engaging and innovative kid-led experiences. It provides out-of-the-box solutions to compliantly handle kids personal data, and for developers to give parents visibility and control over that data. KWS allows our developer customers to outsource the complexity of kidsâ€™ data privacy, so they can get on with the job of making the most awesome game, content experience or toy. For kids and parents, we provide transparency and control over how their data is used and collected. For our business, KWS connects us deeply with companiesâ€™ products and allows us to drive a huge impact with the developer community. Since our acquisition by Epic Games, Kids Web Services is set for massive growth and we want you to help us improve and scale our product. The better developers, kids and parents understand how parental verification, consent and controls work and why they are needed, the more effective our product is for our customers. The developer documentation, the quality of the APIs and the developer portal are all important, but ultimately the quality of the kid and parent-facing UX is what drives the success of KWS against our mission of making the internet safer for kids. What youâ€™ll be doing Maintain SuperAwesomeâ€™s database of consent and verification standards by keeping abreast of any children-specific data protection provisions in data privacy laws around the world. Liaise with external legal counsel, information resources and kids privacy/safety experts to maintain our internal knowledge base on international kids-specific regulations. Analyse and document kids digital experiences, including games and websites, and digital platforms (app store, game consoles, etc), to understand and map their log-in and consent flows in relation to kids across different territories. Research, develop & maintain a register of vendors of age detection, age verification, and identity verification vendors around the world, mapping their capabilities against the needs of our Kids Web Services solution. Own and execute a plan to contact relevant vendors of verification solutions, assess their offerings and prepare to test them for potential use with KWS. Lead negotiations with selected vendors to run tests for effectiveness and scalability, and project-manage the integration of chosen offerings with KWS. Work closely with the KWS product manager, chief privacy officer and CTO to ideate and design potential new parent verification solutions for use in US (compliant with COPPA), EU (compliant with GDPR-K), and the rest of world (compliant and appropriate to the SuperAwesome standard). Where relevant, project-manage the drafting and submission of applications to regulatory authorities (such as the FTC) for approved new verification methods. What is it like to work here? Weâ€™re 180 people split across timezones and markets, so we have a real focus on optimising for remote communication and collaboration. Our product management and development teams are based out of our London HQ in Charing Cross. Youâ€™ll find people from all walks of life here as well as a real focus on health and wellbeing. Our (current) work-from-home culture is lively and inclusive, with a genuine focus on building human connection and empathy during these strange times. The product team is roughly 40 strong, split across engineers, product designers and product managers. We live and work by a set of strong principles and passionately believe in our mission to make the internet safer for kids. Requirements You are analytical. You are able to simplify complex problems, systems, or processes into component parts, exploring and evaluating them systematically. You are curious. You illuminate and challenge assumptions. You are not happy unless you know how everything fits together and how it all works. You are creative. You have an irrepressible urge to create and make things. You are filled with ideas and know that there are always more behind those. You welcome problems as opportunities for innovation. You are persuasive. You are able to present sound and well-reasoned arguments to convince others, drawing from a range of communication strategies to build consensus and drive action. You are collaborative. You have an open and constructive attitude to team-working. You welcome and actively seek other opinions. You offer timely and effective feedback. You are resilient. You are able to maintain your effectiveness in the face of pressure. You have a growth mindset and embrace failure as a critical part of success. About Your Skills You have at least 3 years experience working as an Analyst within a B2B product and or consumer â€˜utilityâ€™-style B2C product. Experience with identity management, digital signature, consent management, identity verification, privacy compliance solutions or other markets constrained by regulation are a plus. Weâ€™d love to see examples in your previous work of methodical, thoughtful research and the changes you have helped drive. Benefits We have a range of awesome perks and benefits Fully paid healthcare - provided through Vitality Monthly pizza Friday Wednesday catered breakfast Quarterly team lunches Friday drinks Office snack bar Pension scheme Holidays - 25+ bank holidays Expanded Maternity and Paternity leave Flexible hours Quarterly socials / yearly company event Product team hack days and charity events Health and wellbeing calendar We offer an incredible range of perks and benefits. Company Industry: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet
Description: SuperAwesome SuperAwesome powers the kidsâ€™ digital media ecosystem. Our technology is used by hundreds of brands and content-owners to safely engage with over half a billion kids every month. For SuperAwesome â€˜law is opportunity,â€™ as we develop innovative technology-based solutions to enable compliance with global data protection laws and child safety best practices. The Role Weâ€™re looking for people whoâ€™ve collaborated on designing and building successful products that users love. Specifically, weâ€™re looking for an awesome Business Analyst to help us build out our Kids Web Services platform and deliver on our mission to make the internet safer for kids. Youâ€™ll be the Business Analyst working across two cross-functional teams, each of 4-9 software engineers, product managers and designers. You are excellent at prioritisation, highly analytical, and research-centric in your thinking. Youâ€™ll ideally have some previous experience researching both B2B products and consumer â€˜utilityâ€™-style B2C products (e.g. checkout, identity/login, search). The Business Analyst works to solve the problems described by the Product Manager, based on expert knowledge of and research into our customersâ€™ business objectives, an understanding of the competitive environment, of technical solutions and constraints, and the requirements of kidsâ€™ digital privacy regulation around the world. The Product Kids Web Services (KWS) is a kidtech platform for developers who are creating engaging and innovative kid-led experiences. It provides out-of-the-box solutions to compliantly handle kids personal data, and for developers to give parents visibility and control over that data. KWS allows our developer customers to outsource the complexity of kidsâ€™ data privacy, so they can get on with the job of making the most awesome game, content experience or toy. For kids and parents, we provide transparency and control over how their data is used and collected. For our business, KWS connects us deeply with companiesâ€™ products and allows us to drive a huge impact with the developer community. Since our acquisition by Epic Games, Kids Web Services is set for massive growth and we want you to help us improve and scale our product. The better developers, kids and parents understand how parental verification, consent and controls work and why they are needed, the more effective our product is for our customers. The developer documentation, the quality of the APIs and the developer portal are all important, but ultimately the quality of the kid and parent-facing UX is what drives the success of KWS against our mission of making the internet safer for kids. What youâ€™ll be doing Maintain SuperAwesomeâ€™s database of consent and verification standards by keeping abreast of any children-specific data protection provisions in data privacy laws around the world. Liaise with external legal counsel, information resources and kids privacy/safety experts to maintain our internal knowledge base on international kids-specific regulations. Analyse and document kids digital experiences, including games and websites, and digital platforms (app store, game consoles, etc), to understand and map their log-in and consent flows in relation to kids across different territories. Research, develop & maintain a register of vendors of age detection, age verification, and identity verification vendors around the world, mapping their capabilities against the needs of our Kids Web Services solution. Own and execute a plan to contact relevant vendors of verification solutions, assess their offerings and prepare to test them for potential use with KWS. Lead negotiations with selected vendors to run tests for effectiveness and scalability, and project-manage the integration of chosen offerings with KWS. Work closely with the KWS product manager, chief privacy officer and CTO to ideate and design potential new parent verification solutions for use in US (compliant with COPPA), EU (compliant with GDPR-K), and the rest of world (compliant and appropriate to the SuperAwesome standard). Where relevant, project-manage the drafting and submission of applications to regulatory authorities (such as the FTC) for approved new verification methods. What is it like to work here? Weâ€™re 180 people split across timezones and markets, so we have a real focus on optimising for remote communication and collaboration. Our product management and development teams are based out of our London HQ in Charing Cross. Youâ€™ll find people from all walks of life here as well as a real focus on health and wellbeing. Our (current) work-from-home culture is lively and inclusive, with a genuine focus on building human connection and empathy during these strange times. The product team is roughly 40 strong, split across engineers, product designers and product managers. We live and work by a set of strong principles and passionately believe in our mission to make the internet safer for kids. Requirements You are analytical. You are able to simplify complex problems, systems, or processes into component parts, exploring and evaluating them systematically. You are curious. You illuminate and challenge assumptions. You are not happy unless you know how everything fits together and how it all works. You are creative. You have an irrepressible urge to create and make things. You are filled with ideas and know that there are always more behind those. You welcome problems as opportunities for innovation. You are persuasive. You are able to present sound and well-reasoned arguments to convince others, drawing from a range of communication strategies to build consensus and drive action. You are collaborative. You have an open and constructive attitude to team-working. You welcome and actively seek other opinions. You offer timely and effective feedback. You are resilient. You are able to maintain your effectiveness in the face of pressure. You have a growth mindset and embrace failure as a critical part of success. About Your Skills You have at least 3 years experience working as an Analyst within a B2B product and or consumer â€˜utilityâ€™-style B2C product. Experience with identity management, digital signature, consent management, identity verification, privacy compliance solutions or other markets constrained by regulation are a plus. Weâ€™d love to see examples in your previous work of methodical, thoughtful research and the changes you have helped drive. Benefits We have a range of awesome perks and benefits Fully paid healthcare - provided through Vitality Monthly pizza Friday Wednesday catered breakfast Quarterly team lunches Friday drinks Office snack bar Pension scheme Holidays - 25+ bank holidays Expanded Maternity and Paternity leave Flexible hours Quarterly socials / yearly company event Product team hack days and charity events Health and wellbeing calendar We offer an incredible range of perks and benefits. During the pandemic, we are working hard to provide an amazing array of virtual benefits to our team stationed at home, from team lunches delivered to your door, to virtual socials. As soon as it is safe to do so, we will return to offering the full range that we normally offer. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Government Administration, and Financial Services
Description: This is an exciting time to work for the Home Office as we develop some of the most challenging and transformative technology projects the department has ever seen. Youâ€™ll have a chance to shape the future and support our goal to provide exceptional services for everyone. Our Work Is Guided By These Fundamental Principles Put user needs first. Delivery and outcomes over process. Make the most of openness: open standards, open source, open data and open markets. Itâ€™s important that we build a diverse workforce that reflects the society we serve and provide an inclusive environment for all. We value everyone's skills and provide a creative and supportive environment to help you do your best work and develop your career. These Roles Are Based Within Two Of Our Portfolios PPPT is structured into several large-scale delivery portfolios, each portfolio delivering significant national scale capabilities to our customer base. The National Data Systems Portfolio encompasses 18 critical national systems that are vital to U.K. Policing and the wider Law Enforcement Community across areas such as ANPR, child sexual exploitation, firearms and offender management. These include a mixture of legacy systems and new critical infrastructure currently being delivered. This role will support the Child Abuse Image Database (CAID) programme. CAID has embarked on an ambitious transformation programme to help the police and law enforcement partners continue to safeguard children and pursue offenders in the face of technology changes and the unfortunate continuing growing volumes of cases. CAID provides UK Law Enforcement (UKLE) with a capability to significantly improve investigations involving indecent images of children (IIoC). The CAID system contains the UK national IIoC library and related data (image metadata, categorisation, hash values and case-related information). The Law Enforcement Infrastructure Portfolio is responsible for the components that allow law enforcement communities to use National Systems to perform their duties by connecting their computers, systems and end users through secure networks to a mixture of on-premise data centres, third party sites and Cloud. Several current systems and networks are dated and reaching end-of-life. They require upgrades as a minimum or ideally complete digital transformation. One role will sit with the Law Enforcement Products & Services (LEPS) Programme: We have many live products & services hosted from an in-house data centre and supported, maintained and operated by a variety of teams based in or around that location. We also have a number of developments and improvements that are, or will, modernise the current products and services functionally and technically and in terms of the environments and processes supporting them. LEPS is defining and implementing a five year roadmap to transform our products and services ensuring projects deliver the sustainable changes needed; we have a skilled workforce able to support them using common, standardised, modernised tools; and we operate those products and services from modernised sustainable environments. The LEPS role will support discovery work (requirements, current status, solution options and design) for miscellaneous projects (including a criminal records digitisation and service redesign project). In each case the BA will work with stakeholders across the business to align discovery work with existing work already on-going. Responsibilities This role description is standard for all Home Office DDaT Senior Business Analyst roles, however there may be some additional role requirements for this particular role, and these are described later. A Senior Business Analyst will lead small to medium sized projects and will also be part of a team of analysts on larger, more complex projects, leading on specific epics/high level requirements. You will make sure outcomes are aligned with the service vision and business strategy by connecting the current and future business models and delivering towards achieving the business architecture strategy. You will also be involved in supporting and informing product iteration, evolution and optimisation. You will build and manage effective stakeholder relationships internally and externally. You will challenge constructively and act as a critical voice to stakeholders and delivery colleagues in order to achieve solutions that are fit for purpose. You will work independently and/or as part of a team and will have a good understanding of your own work area. You will help to advance the Business Analysis community through sharing of best practice and mentoring others. What youâ€™ll do day-to-day Your Main Day To Day Responsibilities Will Be Investigating operational and business needs and problems and assisting in the recommendation of service improvement and business solutions. Understanding and defining the problem to be solved and ensuring strategic decision-making supports business outcomes as well as user needs. Eliciting, analysing and validating business requirements and user needs, as well as business strategy problems, in the most appropriate and effective manner and format. Collaborating with other professions within scope of the delivery to embed the Business Analysis role and value in the context of a project and multidisciplinary team. Planning and leading large areas of Business Analysis delivery, owning the challenge and driving through to conclusions. Creating acceptance criteria (often utilising the concept of Behavioural Driven Development) to allow your new service to be properly tested. Modelling processes/procedures using established techniques with understanding of their purpose and importance. Production of periodic performance measures to inform stakeholders and drive discussion around the required service. You will also be expected to carry out the following day to day activities: Contributing towards the development of Business Analysis practice and standards, sharing knowledge with other Business Analysts. Supporting business process testing, through development of scenario-based acceptance criteria and BDD (behaviour driven development) to support automated testing. Occasionally this may also mean executing detailed test scripts and promoting the role benefits of testing and how it works. Potential civil service line management responsibilities for lower grade Business Analysts. Essential Criteria Youâ€™ll have a demonstrable passion for Business Analysis, with the following skills or strong experience in: Promoting and building strong relationships with a broad range of people (technical and non-technical), and applying proven communication, and analytical skills to ensure the teamâ€™s plans and objectives are achieved. Constructively challenging, negotiating and persuading different stakeholders in order to achieve a consensus in opinion. Promoting working as a team, contributing ideas and opinions in a flat non-hierarchical structure and advocating to external people on the teamâ€™s behalf. Being adaptable in shifting and uncertain environments. Communicating in a variety of methods, applying the appropriate methods to each scenario/audience. Required Please see below for the relevant skills required for your role The skills listed above are reflective of the Home Office DDaT Profession Skills and Competency Model (based on the industry standard SFIA framework). Strategy and Architecture Advice and Guidance Consultancy (CNSL) â€“ Level 3 Change and Transformation Business Change Management Business Analysis (BUAN) â€“ Level 4 Business Modelling (BSMO) â€“ Level 3 Requirements Definition and Management (REQM) â€“ Level 4 Development and Implementation User Experience Experience Analysis (UNAN) â€“ Level 4 Relationships and Engagement Stakeholder Management Relationship Management (RLMT) â€“ Level 4 Desirable Criteria Ideally you will also have the following skills or some experience in: Working in the delivery of technology-based projects. Responsibility for developing your own skills by being an active member of the team and department. Promote the importance of evidence-based design or analysis. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Computer Software
Description: Mercer Marsh Benefits (MMB) is the $1bn+ joint venture between Mercer and Marsh, which encompasses their respective international employee health and benefits businesses. MMB represents approximately 10% of Marsh and Mercerâ€™s combined global revenues and is a strategic area of growth for Marsh McLennan (MMC), the worldâ€™s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, headquartered in New York with annual revenue in excess of $17Bn. MMB is looking for a Business Analyst to support its Darwin business unit which offers software as a services-based employee benefits administration solutions. We truly believe that using our Darwin platform and products can impact and improve peopleâ€™s lives. In fact, more than 2 million people are already using our platform. Thatâ€™s a lot of people enjoying their flexible benefits! Join us on our journey and take the next step in your career with the Business Operations team! The Team The Business Operations team will work alongside FP&A and Controllership â€“ becoming an integral part of the business structure, and having wide-reaching relationships across Sales and the business as a whole. As a new team, this is an exciting opportunity for applicants; the team will be responsible for recording and assessing all new and existing business contacts, and will support the wider finance function with billing, revenue recognition and reporting. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone that thrives within a fast-paced, rapidly-changing environment. The applicant will grow quickly to understand how the business operates and their ability to adapt and provide creative solutions to improve processes will be integral to the success of the team. The Role & Your Mission The Business Analyst will be a bright individual with an analytical mind and interested in a career within Business Operations and Finance. Their role will be key in assisting in contracts analysis and supporting the wider FP&A and Controllership teams. The role will carry out a variety of activities from reviewing client contracts to headcount reporting, and will also cover functions such as, but not limited to: Ensuring the accuracy of a contracts database, revenue tracker and bookings schedule Liaise with commercial team to agree contract values Developing knowledge of systems and processes to ensure all data is captured accurately Creating strong relationships across the business to ensure accuracy of financial data Assisting Finance team with any queries they may have in respect of client contracts Checking existing contracts for key data for revenue reporting Track headcount movement and assist with headcount forecast Your Experience & Values Attention to detail and a methodical working pattern Able to work independently and problem solve Strong organisational skills Ability to communicate with people at all levels; verbal and written Good interpersonal skills with ability to work under pressure Have the strength of character and versatility to challenge if required Competent in Excel and Word Ability to work well within a team A commitment to quality and a thorough approach to the work Flexible attitude Ideally will have studied a form of business degree e.g. Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Studies etc. Experience of contract management systems and controls (Desirable but not essential) Our PINK Benefits & Culture An opportunity to work in a fast-growing, innovative company with lots of room for progression A fall-friendly environment that encourages learning and initiative A yearly budget and the opportunity to build your own flexible benefits package Fast-paced, agile work environment and the opportunity to work with our impressive clients So if you like the look of what you see, and think you could be the perfect fit for us, then take the leap and apply today! Go on, what are you waiting for? Show more Show less

econscia is a young startup, founded 2020. Weâ€™re on a mission to help companies tackle their carbon footprints, with powerful analytical tools. Our product, econscia cloud, is a solution for corporates to model their carbon emissions, using their own internal data. Weâ€™re looking for a passionate developer starting out in their career, to join our mission to make impact on climate change. Our company We are currently a team of three, and funded through angel investment. Weâ€™ve worked together previously in B2B SaaS, and are looking to continue building our engineering team as we go to market. We are hybrid working, and we hot desk at Second Home in Spitalfields a few times weekly, and remote otherwise. You must be eligible to work in London, UK. Our product econscia is a product for corporates to model and report carbon emissions. Sustainability teams spend months each year gathering and making sense of data from every part of their leaving little time to act on the problem. Itâ€™s inefficient and slow - and helps neither companies nor the environment. Youâ€™ll work alongside us as we develop a powerful solution to automate this process, reducing time spent reporting from months to weeks, empowering sustainability teams to take positive action on climate change. What youâ€™ll do You will be joining econsciaâ€™s small team at an exciting time. You will be a core member of the engineering team and have significant contribution building out the econscia Cloud platform. You will work with and be mentored by our experienced CTO, who has successfully built 3 technology startups from 0 employees to exit. You will be working on different challenges day to day. This could be getting deep into research from which youâ€™ll develop prototypes and POCs, working on key features alongside the team, or contributing to a clean, enterprise-grade SaaS application with security by design. We hope you can work with us to own key aspects of econsciaâ€™s analytics engine, but could also roll up your sleeves and dive into research, onboard customers, or dabble in unfamiliar technologies quickly - when the job needs to get done. Over time, the opportunity is yours to shape this role as we grow. Who you are You will be a software engineer early in your career, and youâ€™re strong in at least one of the following: Python for production environments, ideally Django NLP models in production using semistructured/unstructured data pSQL Optional bonuses: It would be an added bonus if you have experience with any of these, to complement our current skills: JavaScript, React.js or similar AWS inc. serverless components, ElasticBeanStalk Data engineering or pipelines, ETL/ELT Front-end architecture/development with HTML5, object oriented CSS e.g. Less, Sass UX understanding/design How we work We think a lot about ways of working, and always look to better ourselves through different tools and techniques. Weâ€™re always excited to learn new practices and culture from other people and teams. Deep work finding ways to achieve strong focus and pace in mind Feedback specific and actionable feedback on a regular cadence from all team members Continuous improvement challenging our own workflows, automating as much as possible Decide fast timeboxing decisions, deciding fast, learning as quickly as we can, and accepting failure Flexible team members choose how, where and when they contribute econscia Values Whilst we are still a small company, values are important to us - especially as we look to grow. Growth We work to achieve more tomorrow than we can today - in our tools, work, mindset and outcomes. We raise the bar and remove comfort. We try to see opportunities, not limitations, and aim for better as individuals and teams. Health A healthy body is a healthy mind. We arenâ€™t religious, but we try to promote the right habits, and make time for balance and wellbeing amongst work. Egoless We avoid bullshit and aim to satisfy the needs of customers, and not our own. Honesty We try to be honest, and then we move on. The path to quality and improvement lies in honesty to yourself and others around you. Velocity Speed wins when all else is equal, but pace is about consistency and well-calibrated direction. Decisions are reversible and trying but failing should be celebrated. Augmentation We believe the purpose of the team is to create a safe, high-trust environment to maximise individual performance. This touches all our work - including our behaviours, tools, communication, culture, support and motivation. We work to compound each other's efforts, and we're responsible to find the best in ourselves and others. We build discipline and routine, as the foundation for strong execution. Why work at econscia Â£40-60k pa with equity options + pension 28 dayâ€™s holiday Flexible hours: choose how, when and where you work No-fly holidays policy: days spent travelling to holiday without flying donâ€™t count toward your holiday allowance Deep work Wednesdays (no meetings - full focus) Modern central London co-working office space (Second Home), and remote working An environment where the best idea wins, and challenge is encouraged Personal monthly Fiverr budget - Delegate busy work and tasks you donâ€™t want to do Work to make a real impact on the planet Show more Show less

Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care
Description: Company Description Genomics England successfully led the world-leading 100,000 Genomes Project, which compared and analysed individualsâ€™ genetic codes to help diagnose, treat and prevent illness. We're now accelerating our impact, working with the NHS to further develop and embed genomic healthcare and research in Britain. Our next chapter involves working with patients, doctors, scientists, government and industry to improve genomic testing, and help researchers access the health data and technology they need to make new medical discoveries and create more effective, targeted medicines for everybody. Job Description you want to be at the cutting-edge intersection of science, healthcare and technology, and you are passionate about how you can improve patientsâ€™ wellbeing, Genomics England is the place to be. We are looking for genomic analysts to work on a range of exciting projects, including: New feature development and improvement for our clinical whole genome sequencing analysis pipelines which help patients with Rare Diseases and Cancer, Development and improvement of methods and tools for genomic analysis in diverse and underrepresented populations, Pioneering the use of long read sequencing in healthcare, using one of the largest collections of clinical long read sequencing in the world, Investigating the feasibility of whole genome sequencing in newborn screening for treatable conditions. Your Daily Tasks May Include You will work in an agile environment as part of multidisciplinary team, building state-of-the-art analytics into clinically-fit production quality solutions. developing and fine-tuning algorithms for variant prioritisation and classification to improve diagnostics and/or actionability, benchmarking and improving tools for processing and analysis of whole genome data (e.g. alignment, variant callers, quality control), and performing custom computational analyses. You'll work with other team members to ensure that solutions are implemented in a robust, scalable, fit for clinic, accredited, production-ready way. To do so, you will also be researching the scientific literature, identifying new approaches to genome analysis, as well as contributing to the publication and dissemination of our learnings in the form of scientific papers, white papers and conferences. You'll also be establishing general bioinformatics resources for day-to-day use by colleagues and members of our Research Environments. Skills And Experience For Success It's essential for this role that you have good knowledge of EITHER: cancer genomics, approaches to call somatic variation and emerging pan-genomic markers & clinical interpretation of cancer genomes. - OR - one or more areas of human germline DNA analysis, such as rare disease genomics, population genetics, family-based analysis, genetic association testing, risk score prediction, structural variation, pharmacogenomics, typing of complex genomic regions such as HLA/KIR. It is essential to that you have strong programming skills (Python, R). In Addition, You Will Have Some Of The Following a strong knowledge of statistics and/or statistical genetics and/or machine learning, experience of high throughput sequencing algorithms, experience with large data sets, data visualisation skills, the full cycle of analysing NGS data from sequencing QC to annotation and prioritisation of variants, excellent technical writing skills. Experience of collaboration with stakeholders, both internal and external, in order to develop, prototype and validate new features for genome analysis, as well as demonstrable research outputs (e.g. publications) will be additional strengths. If you match what we are looking for, or are close with a keen desire to develop, we'd love to hear from you. Qualifications a PhD involving one of the following: Rare Diseases, Cancer Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Systems Biology, Statistical Genetics or equivalent work experience, Ideally, undergraduate studies with a strong quantitative discipline component (such as physics, computer science, or maths). These skills could also have been developed, for example, through a PhD in computational biology, statistical genomics, or statistical genetics. Additional Information Benefits Being part of this journey is a reward in itself, however we're pleased to offer our colleagues a great benefits package including Originally conceived as a project, Genomics England has transformed to meet the long-term opportunities created by our scientific breakthroughs in understanding the Human Genome. competitive salary 30 days holiday generous pension scheme individual learning budgets for every colleague a raft of other benefits Talk to our Talent Team and find out how a career with Genomics England will benefit you. Show more Show less

Description: Location: Reading, United Kingdom In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. Together we offer fantastic opportunities for committed employees to learn and develop their career with us. At Thales UK, we research, develop, and supply technology and services that impact the lives of millions of people each day to make life better, and keep us safer. We innovate across five major industries; Aerospace, Defence, Ground Transportation, Security and Space. Your health and well-being matters to us and thatâ€™s why we offer you the flexibility to do whatâ€™s important to you; whether thatâ€™s part time hours, job sharing, home working, or the ability to flex your start and finish times. Where possible, we support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions. Data Scientist Are you a Technical expert who wants to contribute to innovation? Are you a leader who can develop collaborative and compelling solutions? If you are then this could be the job for you? Our Research, Technology and Innovation team are looking for a Data Scientist to join the team. You will be required to take a flexible and proactive approach founded on technical competence, problem solving, leadership, teamwork and the ability to create and communicate a vision. The role enables and contributes to innovation activities in support of all Thales UK business units. Whilst the role will undertake a wide variety of tasks, candidates with relevant experience of Data Science are strongly encouraged to apply. Responsibilities The successful candidate will technically lead the development of compelling, collaborative solutions and associated proposal material. As well as being responsible for leading the technical delivery of tasks, work packages and projects with a focus on delivery to time, budget and quality. You will be the lead expert in delivering the production of reports, presentations and scientific papers to demonstrate and promote new innovation internally and externally. Undertake a wide variety of tasks, including the application of machine learning algorithms, development of analytics solutions, research studies. Skills And Experience Ideally you will be qualified to masters level in a mathematical or relevant scientific, engineering or computing discipline with relevant skills and experience. Significant data science experience (minimum 2-3 years professional experience). Statistics related subjects at Undergraduate or Postgraduate level will be an advantage. Matlab/Python or equivalent knowledge is essential. Experience of standard MS Office tools is essential. As a Data Scientist you will have a broad knowledge of analytics tools and methodologies, be able to identify when/where to apply techniques and demonstrate solid scientific process in deriving insights. You will be experienced in data wrangling, feature engineering and visualisation. You will have a broad familiarity of modern software development practices. As a lead member of the team you will have experience of technically leading bids, customer engagement and project delivery. Evidence of technical report writing, presentation preparation and generation and presentation/communication skills for papers, seminars, conferences etc. is highly desirable. Required Systems Experience: Matlab, Python including Jupyter Notebooks. Dashboarding/graphing experience e.g. Plot.ly, Grafana, matplotlib Machine learning toolbox experience e.g. scikitlearn, pytorch, weka, tensorflow, matconvnet, caffe. The ideal candidate will have experience with big data frameworks: Hortonworks Data Platform, Apache Spark etc. Desirable Experience: web-application frameworks e.g.django, springboot, nodejs Database experience incl. modern NoSQL databases Familiarity with cloud platforms, microservices and containerisation In line with Thales' Baseline Security requirements, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of identity, eligibility to work in the UK and employment and/or education history for up to three years. Some vacancies may require full Security Clearance which can require further evidence to be provided. For further details of the evidence required to apply for Baseline and Security Clearance please refer to the Defence Business Services National Security Vetting (DBS NSV) Agency. At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now! Show more Show less

Description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. This person will have excellent communication skills, display a high service orientation and the ability to work with cross-functional teams. Ideally, they will have gained first experience at a management consultancy, internal strategy role or similar. Responsibilities Develop tools and models to analyze key performance metrics Aggregate data for analysis and interpretation for strategic decision making Conduct analysis of Partner risk performance to support daily operations and monthly/quarterly business reviews Support strategic initiatives including operational reviews to identify key actionable areas of improvement Collaborate on projects and share appropriate resources with internal stakeholders Act as subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in areas of risk reporting data Develop and deliver fact-based and decision-oriented presentations for senior executives and regional leadership Design and interpret key performance metrics to deliver insights & recommendations Target Skills / Experience 2-5 years work experience focused on quantitative analysis, strategy or consulting, using both data and logical reasoning on a regular basis Experience using databases for analysis - Tableau/Einstein Analytics is preferred Experience with the Salesforce.com product suite (Certifications preferred but not required) Enjoys problem-solving with strong analytical skills, an innovative and customer service mindset Highly skilled at multitasking, strong attention to detail and able to prioritize while working in a fast-paced environment Extremely reliable and conscientious with a drive to get things done; able to work autonomously Strong presentation skills, especially related to compelling data visualizations Excellent written and verbal communications skills in English, other languages welcomed but not required Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Company Industry: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services
Description: Description ClearScore is looking for a new Senior Data Analyst focused on Product Analytics. You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners and other teams within the business. ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact. You will be focused initially in the area of Product Analytics â€“ understanding how different segments of users interact (or donâ€™t interact) with our product and what strategies will make the product more useful and valuable to them. There is currently a team of three: a mid-level Analyst and two Data Scientists. Exciting challenges that make this different to a pure Product Analytics role include leveraging ML models to surface the best actions for users; which credit products might be right for them, how they might improve their credit score or how they might improve their use of credit products more generally. New journeys we are creating include â€œBuildâ€ which aims to help users enter the credit market safely and â€œProtectâ€ which helps them understand their exposure to fraud. Examples Of How You Might Drive Impact Creating insight into user behaviour using empirical data Working with the Data Scientists to get them working on the most impactful projects Developing new segmentations to drive better user insight Taking the analytic and â€œexperimentationâ€ led culture in the product team to the next level Creating the insights to enable our Product team to shape the overall product vision Driving a â€œdata firstâ€ mentality with the Product Managers to ensure that they are tracking the right data and interpreting it correctly About You You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive. You have significant experience ideally in product analysis; maybe you have worked for a tech company previously or possibly in Lending. You think about users, not just numbers, understanding the key drivers of churn, engagement and activation. You do not need to be a Data Scientist, but it would be great if you understand the best use cases for machine learning, potential drawbacks for using such models in our product, and are able to â€˜translateâ€™ Data Science approaches to business outcomes. You are a great manager â€“ the people who will be reporting to you are very bright and very talented. You will enjoy helping them grow and thrive. You enjoy helping non-analysts to put data at the heart of what they do â€“ through A/B testing, use of analytical tools such as Amplitude, or training others to carry out their own analysis. Aptitude and passion for statistics/mathematics: the majority of our analysts have good degrees in STEM subjects or Economics; however we are looking for aptitude rather than education. You must know SQL and will ideally know Python. Experience with tools such as Amplitude is a plus. An inquiring mind that seeks for the insight in the data. You can synthesise information into clear and logical presentations. You want to learn as much as possible. A desire to contribute to our culture. About Clearscore ClearScore is a workplace like no other. Weâ€™ve spent the past five years disrupting an entire industry and building a user base of millions. At the heart of this success is our culture, where we work hard, relish change and treat each other with respectâ€”helping everyone to reach their potential and deliver results that make a difference. Weâ€™re on a mission to positively impact the lives of our users. Our product puts their needs at the centre of our thinking. Through cutting-edge tech, insightful analytics and beautiful design we want to help our users build their financial confidence and make better financial decisions. We want our people to perform at their best, so we trust everyone to work in a way that suits themâ€”focusing on output, not time spent at a screen. We have an inclusive culture where everyone is encouraged to look after their own wellbeing whilst growing and developing their career. Benefits 25 paid holidays and a â€œduvet dayâ€ on your birthday Private health and dental cover GP office visits Life assurance scheme Up to 6% matched pension Brown bags with guest speakers Access to Perkbox Dog-friendly office Daily breakfast and free snacks Free sports and social clubs Generous training allowance Fast progression Leadership-led training Regular wellbeing events In-house psychotherapist Physical and mental health support through BUPA No clock-watching culture Generous maternity and paternity plans Culture and inclusion representatives #DNI Show more Show less

Company Industry: Automotive
Description: About TGB You may already follow Toyota (or TGB as we affectionately call ourselves) on social media or in the news and have heard about the great things that Toyota & Lexus continue to achieve globally; well, what we do here at TGB helps achieve those great things! Here at ou ECO HQ in Surrey, we support our retailer network as the Sales and Marketing functions for both Toyota and Lexus in the UK. We are a diverse team with a common goal; to do business the way customers love. A bit about Data and Insight :The purpose of the Data and Insight team is to To work with all Toyota & Lexus teams to accelerate change, transform and improve the customer experience through insight and testing. We focus on Listening to our Customers, interrogating their feedback and experience so that we can Amplify the Voice of the Customer across our organization. We are a department of 10 highly engaged and motivated people who support each other in a very friendly and positive environment. Role in a nutshell : This role is a contractor role, based at Toyota (GB) PLC, sourced via a Service Provider. The Business Insights Support Analyst is a key role within the Consumer One division of Toyota GB to support the presentation and delivery of identified insight in an engaging and visual manner through varying formats such as Power Bi, Excel, info-graphics and video formats. You will ensure a responsive and proactive engagement with stakeholders within TGB to provide support services and enhancements to our existing portfolio of Power Bi dashboards maintained within the Data and Insight team. Working alongside our Data Science and Engineering teams you will work collaboratively to generate Insight from our Customer Experience programmes, ad-hoc data sets and insight requests. The role will engage with a range of stakeholders from business departments, Field Team members and Retail Network partners. What youâ€™ll be doing PBi Dashboard Support : You will provide services to support the current range of Power Bi Dashboards that ensures a high level of accuracy, reliabilityand relevancy of the delivered insight to TGB and Lexus head office users, Field team members and Network Retailers. This will include: Bug Fixes Ongoing enhancements Monitoring of daily data refresh outcomes Management of product backlogs Updates and management of supporting assets (videos, user guides, Dashboard support documents) New PBi Development : Enable development of new PBi dashboards as per the D&I team priorities and projects. Working within the Visualisation team and with the support of Data engineering resources interact with key stakeholders across the business to support the visualisation of generated insight, including : Business analysis and requirements capture Design of underlying UX in line with established design principles and style guides Development of supporting data structures and calculations Development of Power Bi tabs, navigation and information architecture Development of supporting Dashboard guides / video assets Support the development of Best Practice in PBi Dashboard delivery. Work with other stakeholders across Systems, Toyota Financial Services to establish consistency and best approach to Data management and design UX design Analytics output Work proactively to support the Data and Insight team planning and schedule Develop strong understanding of commercial drivers that are in play within TGB and the Centre Network Weâ€™d love to hear from you if you have or are: At least 2 yearsâ€™ experience of practical working with Power Bi Highly proficient in MS Power Bi tool set Strong UX design skills to support engaging and easy to use solutions Experience of working in a project delivery team, business analysis and requirements capture Appreciation of systems architecture and Data Integration Understanding of cloud computing and data strategy Understanding of relational databases, data schemas and joining relationships across multiple data sources Have an awareness of security issues and compliance regarding PII, PCI and GDPR Experience with Data Flows, Entity Relationship Diagrams Be able to share the findings and output of generated insight in a clear, concise, engaging and appropriate story to Business stakeholders Contribute to organising and curating insights for future retrieval Unit testing, system testing and documentation Toyota loves diversity To innovate, we need diversity of thought so a diverse and inclusive workplace is hugely important to us. We wonâ€™t discriminate against any protected characteristics, will judge applications on merit and wonâ€™t make any assumptions. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Internet
Job Title: Senior Insights Analyst and Data Storyteller - LinkedIn Marketing Solutions
Description: Job Description SENIOR INSIGHTS ANALYST AND DATA STORYTELLER Do you want to build and deliver compelling data driven stories? As a Senior Insights Analyst at LinkedIn, you will explore one of the richest data sets in the world to discover insights that help our sales team serve our clients across the EMEA and Latin American regions. Acting as a strategic business partner, you will scope out ambiguous requirements and showcase the power of data by turning it into actionable recommendations that address the needs of our clients. Close partnership with your internal and external customers, coupled with the collaborative culture across our Insights team, will provide unlimited learning and growth opportunities. Responsibilities Leverage LinkedIn's unique data to build compelling narratives and drive insights which address our clients' business challenges Use SQL (Presto) to explore databases, extract necessary data and visualize findings in either in PowerPoint, Tableau or other data visualization software Act as a strategic business partner to sales leaders, senior level clients & partner to cross functional leads (Director+) Create and build insights that inspire clients and stakeholders Lead cross-functional projects or team initiatives Proactively identify processes that help in scaling key insight work for internal and external stakeholders Act as a mentor and coach for insights analysts and advocate for the insights team across the business Drive continuous education with partner teams to improve their ability to leverage insights & data that deliver customer valueâ€ Travel to meet with clients, colleagues and cross functional partners (approximately 10% of time) Basic Qualifications 5+ years' experience in a client facing role Experience in a role requiring data interrogation, analysis and visualisation Experience with SQL or a similar data querying language Preferred Qualifications Experience with Teradata, Hadoop (Hive/Pig) and/or Python Experience of managing time and prioritizing tasks independently Ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences Fluency in an additional language would be advantageous Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice Show more Show less

Company Industry: Internet and Information Technology and Services
Description: Data Scientist Full-time London At Commonplace we're looking for a Data Scientist to join our team. About us Commonplace connects people with the places they live, work or play to accelerate positive change. We do this because communities that host inclusive conversations also create trusted collaborations, which improve the quality of life and fabric of their neighbourhood. The Commonplace platform has hosted over 1200 community engagement projects for 150 â€˜built environmentâ€™ partners. Together, weâ€™ve reached over 3.5m people in the UK (and a few thousand abroad) and increased participation in the co-creation of better designed places, improved communities and societies. About the role Data is key to what Commonplace offers, but we have only scratched the surface of what is possible to do with it. We are looking for a data scientist to join a small and entrepreneurial data team to help make the most of our data. Typical responsibilities: Interact with major business stakeholders to handle data-related strategic questions and problems Find solutions to complex problems, discovering insights, correlations and key trends through the use of statistical and visualisation approaches Create tidy visualisations using interactive tools and work with the business to ensure those are correctly used and understood Interrogate data against our data warehouse using SQL to answer business questions and to better understand our users and customers Work with the Team to build a predictive model in Python to forecast behaviours from our users and customers Implement regular data quality controls with periodic checks and automations Become familiar with our data pipeline and be able to contribute to its evolution with the rest of the team Participate in research to understand how Commonplace data can be used in a wider context to create insights and thought leadership on citizen engagement in public consultations About you Skills & Knowledge Degree in engineering, statistics, computer science or related field At least a couple years of experience in a data-related role in a user-led digital business: building forecasts, predictive models and analysing performance Understanding of key machine learning models in Python Python programming skills for data processing, manipulation, modelling and visualisation (pandas and sklearn libraries) SQL skills to interrogate data against our data warehouse Business-oriented mindset, do not be shy to ask questions Optional extras: experience with Mixpanel (or Google Analytics), experience with Geographical Information Systems (GIS), Natural Language processing techniques (nltk NLP library) Behaviours Desire to learn and adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing startup environment Entrepreneurial, comfortable building incrementally and making tough prioritisation decisions, rather than having the perfect solution day one Keen interest in high growth sales and marketing operations A passion for working with a mixture of numerical and text-based data Collaborative and creative problem-solving approach Relentlessly curious about the integrity of our data and always looking to evolve and clarify our understanding of our users and customers, reducing ambiguity and driving growth Compensation and benefits A competitive salary, with a company bonus potential and equity component once youâ€™ve settled in Commission potential based on specific targets Flexible holiday arrangements - we donâ€™t limit how much you take 20 days fully paid company sick leave A tailored learning and development plan Our culture and policies offer flexibility to help you maintain a work / life balance that suits you Our Culture Our team is proud of our supportive and inclusive culture, and we are committed to making Commonplace welcoming to everyone who comes to work with us. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Core Values Collaborating to make better decisions, faster Accelerating growth in sales, customer value and community impact Acting with integrity to make fair decisions and be kind to each other Being brave in the way that we shape the future Apply for the job Do you want to join our team as our new Data Scientist? Then we'd love to hear about you! Show more Show less

Company Industry: Aviation & Aerospace and Defense & Space
Description: Location: Reading, United Kingdom In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible. Together we offer fantastic opportunities for committed employees to learn and develop their career with us. At Thales UK, we research, develop, and supply technology and services that impact the lives of millions of people each day to make life better, and keep us safer. We innovate across five major industries; Aerospace, Defence, Ground Transportation, Security and Space. Your health and well-being matters to us and thatâ€™s why we offer you the flexibility to do whatâ€™s important to you; whether thatâ€™s part time hours, job sharing, home working, or the ability to flex your start and finish times. Where possible, we support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions. Data Scientist Are you a Technical expert who wants to contribute to innovation? Are you a leader who can develop collaborative and compelling solutions? If you are then this could be the job for you? Our Research, Technology and Innovation team are looking for a Data Scientist to join the team. You will be required to take a flexible and proactive approach founded on technical competence, problem solving, leadership, teamwork and the ability to create and communicate a vision. The role enables and contributes to innovation activities in support of all Thales UK business units. Whilst the role will undertake a wide variety of tasks, candidates with relevant experience of Data Science are strongly encouraged to apply. Responsibilities The successful candidate will technically lead the development of compelling, collaborative solutions and associated proposal material. As well as being responsible for leading the technical delivery of tasks, work packages and projects with a focus on delivery to time, budget and quality. You will be the lead expert in delivering the production of reports, presentations and scientific papers to demonstrate and promote new innovation internally and externally. Undertake a wide variety of tasks, including the application of machine learning algorithms, development of analytics solutions, research studies. Skills And Experience Ideally you will be qualified to masters level in a mathematical or relevant scientific, engineering or computing discipline with relevant skills and experience. Significant data science experience (minimum 2-3 years professional experience). Statistics related subjects at Undergraduate or Postgraduate level will be an advantage. Matlab/Python or equivalent knowledge is essential. Experience of standard MS Office tools is essential. As a Data Scientist you will have a broad knowledge of analytics tools and methodologies, be able to identify when/where to apply techniques and demonstrate solid scientific process in deriving insights. You will be experienced in data wrangling, feature engineering and visualisation. You will have a broad familiarity of modern software development practices. As a lead member of the team you will have experience of technically leading bids, customer engagement and project delivery. Evidence of technical report writing, presentation preparation and generation and presentation/communication skills for papers, seminars, conferences etc. is highly desirable. Required Systems Experience: Matlab, Python including Jupyter Notebooks. Dashboarding/graphing experience e.g. Plot.ly, Grafana, matplotlib Machine learning toolbox experience e.g. scikitlearn, pytorch, weka, tensorflow, matconvnet, caffe. The ideal candidate will have experience with big data frameworks: Hortonworks Data Platform, Apache Spark etc. Desirable Experience: web-application frameworks e.g.django, springboot, nodejs Database experience incl. modern NoSQL databases Familiarity with cloud platforms, microservices and containerisation In line with Thales' Baseline Security requirements, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of identity, eligibility to work in the UK and employment and/or education history for up to three years. Some vacancies may require full Security Clearance which can require further evidence to be provided. For further details of the evidence required to apply for Baseline and Security Clearance please refer to the Defence Business Services National Security Vetting (DBS NSV) Agency. At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now! Show more Show less

Company Industry: Financial Services
Description: The Job as Commercial Data Analyst Cashflows is seeking a highly talented and motivated data and reporting analyst to join the Data Analytics function. You should have expertise in data analysis tools like SQL, Excel, Tableau and statistical suites like R/Python and be comfortable facilitating ideation and working from concept through to execution. This role will also build tools and support structures needed to analyse data, dive deep into data to determine root causes to issues, changes, and present findings to business partners to drive improvements. You will be required to work directly with the business and technology to gather requirements and deal with problems that require data to support the analysis and resolution. A 3rd party is used to deliver both tableau report building and data warehouse ETL jobs, you will be required to manage this relationship. You will be part of the Product Team at Cashflows, reporting to the Chief Product Officer. What youâ€™ll be doing Manipulating/mining data from database tables. Creating automated metrics using complex databases. Researching root causes of issues, to identify process breakdowns and provide insight on potential solutions. You will be comfortable doing the hands on as well as the strategic. Demonstrable experience in a fast paced, small or mid-sized business is a â€œmust haveâ€ You will have a proven track record of managing and delivering projects from start to finish You will be highly numerate and have the relevant degree of technical IT competence to liaise with operational IT team You will have worked with a variety of BI tools and have had exposure to working within or with a MI/BI department. You are happy to work as an individual contributor that delivers high quality, high volume outputs. Excellent commercial/financial analytical skills developed through experience. Excellent attention to detail, with strong planning and organisational skills Skills Degree level education - A great education impresses us, but relevant experience and a proven track record puts you ahead of the competition. A high level of mathematical ability Programming languages, such as SQL, Oracle and Python The ability to analyse, model and interpret data Problem-solving skills A methodical and logical approach The ability to plan work and meet deadlines. Management of 3rd party workload Work closely with key functions to gather data relevant requirements Experience of BI tool Tableau (desired not essential) Accuracy and attention to detail Interpersonal skills Teamworking skills Written and verbal communication skills The hours This is a full-time role, Monday â€“ Friday 40 hours per week. What you'll get Our benefits and perks include; Performance based bonus 25 days holiday per year, plus a day off on your birthday and if you're moving house Private Medical Insurance 4x salary life assurance Income protection 6% employer pension contributions Health Cash Plan cover Free parking at our Cambridge office Bike to Work Scheme And discounts with a range of retailers Flexible working, we believe that itâ€™s important for us to work flexibly and so we're very supportive of working from home and in the office. And finally, no promises but we have been known to throw a great staff party once or twice a year! Our selection process steps If you like the sound of this role, please click apply! If we think from your application we'll be a good fit for one another we'll get in touch for a call. We'll talk to you about the role, why we enjoy working here so much and find out more about you. From there, if we both think Itâ€™s a good match we'll proceed with arranging interviews, they'll either be over the phone, via Microsoft Teams or in person. We'll let you know as soon as we've made a decision on whether we'd like to proceed things further with you. If you have any questions, you're always welcome to reach out to our friendly HR team via recruitment@cashflows.com Show more Show less

Company Industry: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet
Job Title: Associate Data Analyst, Global Partner Risk Management
Description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Alliances & Channels Job Details The Alliances & Channels (A&C) Global Partner Risk Management is passionate about the Success of our Partners and our Customers at Salesforce. We are seeking a talented, curious, and experienced business/technical specialist to join our team. We provide risk management programs, assets, data and analytics to the global A&C organisation and its key stakeholders. Our goal is to proactively reduce partner implementation risks and deliver long-term Customer Success. This position provides the opportunity to make meaningful contributions to a wide range of risk management activities, focusing on data analysis and reporting. Deliverables range from robust analytical models, custom performance analysis, and scalable reporting infrastructure to presentation-ready content for senior Salesforce leadership. The successful candidate will have relentless curiosity and an innovator's mindset, is motivated by a desire for excellence and learning, and enjoys effective collaboration. They will demonstrate analytical and project management skills, and have the ability to simplify complex information. This person will have a strong aptitude for understanding the big picture and translating it into tactical action. Moreover, this individual will excel at problem-solving, cumulating insights from large quantities of data, and developing recommendations to address business issues. This person will have excellent communication skills, display a high service orientation and the ability to work with cross-functional teams. Ideally, they will have gained first experience at a management consultancy, internal strategy role or similar. Responsibilities Develop tools and models to analyze key performance metrics Aggregate data for analysis and interpretation for strategic decision making Conduct analysis of Partner risk performance to support daily operations and monthly/quarterly business reviews Support strategic initiatives including operational reviews to identify key actionable areas of improvement Collaborate on projects and share appropriate resources with internal stakeholders Act as subject matter expert for internal stakeholders in areas of risk reporting data Develop and deliver fact-based and decision-oriented presentations for senior executives and regional leadership Design and interpret key performance metrics to deliver insights & recommendations Target Skills / Experience 2-5 years work experience focused on quantitative analysis, strategy or consulting, using both data and logical reasoning on a regular basis Experience using databases for analysis - Tableau/Einstein Analytics is preferred Experience with the Salesforce.com product suite (Certifications preferred but not required) Enjoys problem-solving with strong analytical skills, an innovative and customer service mindset Highly skilled at multitasking, strong attention to detail and able to prioritize while working in a fast-paced environment Extremely reliable and conscientious with a drive to get things done; able to work autonomously Strong presentation skills, especially related to compelling data visualizations Excellent written and verbal communications skills in English, other languages welcomed but not required Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
