Description: Lucid is a research technology (ResTech) platform that provides programmatic access to first-party data. With respondents in more than 100 countries, Lucid enables anyone, in any industry, to survey online audiences and get the answers they need. These answers reveal the sentiments, motivations, and behaviors of target demographics â€“ data that can be used to build business strategies, measure the impact of digital advertising, publish research, and more. Founded in 2010, Lucid is headquartered in New Orleans, LA with offices throughout the US, Europe, and Asia. As a Product Data Scientist you will have the opportunity to collaborate with product and engineering teams to work on Survey Design and Measurements, Identity, Trust & Safety and more . This includes product analyses, validation and establishing statistical methodology standards and development. The right candidate has the ability to independently research, develop and maintain products that align Lucid capabilities with market claims. Responsibilites Supports research and discovery phase for new and existing products. The primary areas include but are not limited to trend analyses, outlier detection, generalization, harmonization, as well as working with different data sources. Analyze large and diverse datasets to extract impactful insights that can drive product strategy. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and test new and existing measurement products- develop statistical modeling and methodologies. End-to-end development and maintenance of Lucidâ€™s measurement products. Ongoing evaluation and validation of both internal and external products to ensure Lucidâ€™s success. Communicate insights and recommendations through visualizations and presentations that will resonate with a wide range of audiences. Qualifications Minimum 3+ years working experience in data science capacity. Minimum Master's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Quantitative Sciences, Data Science, Operations Research or other quantitative fields Ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large data sources Deep understanding of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (e.g. properties of distributions, hypothesis testing, parametric/non-parametric tests, survey design, sampling theory, experimental design, regression/predictive modeling and more) Strong Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees and etc) and their real-world advantages/ drawbacks. Must have working knowledge in the application of statistical and modeling techniques Proficient in Python (as statistical and ML package tools). Proficient in SQL and working with large-scale databases Comfortable in researching and learning new methods, tools, and techniques Nice to have Experience in media measurement and digital attribution Experience in online survey methodologies Experience employing causal inference methods Experience in Identity graphs and fraud detection methodologies Experience working with big data technologies (e. g. Spark) Lucid's Hiring Commitment We understand that many candidates may not be perfectly qualified for a job posting. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable â€“ and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is near the desired qualifications. We also know that diversity of background and thought can enhance problem-solving and encourage more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team. At Lucid we foster a collaborative and inspiring workplace. We pride ourselves in doing this by recruiting, hiring and retaining diverse, passionate, and forward-thinking talent. Lucid is committed to and encourages an inclusive environment and we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Show more Show less

Designed to maximise both productivity and downtime - fussball, ping pong and pool tables, alongside wellness treatments such as yoga, reflexology, acupuncture and massages, plus Publicisâ€™ Marcel Cafe with panoramic views across Londonâ€™s skyline - our office emphasises the individual, with spaces for sociable and collaborative working, alongside quieter areas for colleagues to focus. Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care
Description: About Us At Sensyne Health we combine technology and ethically sourced patient data to help people everywhere get better care. To do this, we have created a unique partnership with the NHS that delivers a return to our partner Trusts and unlocks the value of clinical data for research while safeguarding patient privacy. Alongside this, we develop clinically validated software applications that create clinician and patient benefit while providing highly curated data. We use our proprietary clinical AI technology to analyse ethically sourced, clinically curated, anonymised patient data to solve serious unmet medical needs across a wide range of therapeutic areas, enabling a new approach to clinical trial design, drug discovery, development and post-marketing surveillance. The Role Sensyne Health are looking for a talented, proactive, and resourceful Market Analyst to help us deliver on our mission to accelerate medical research and improve patient care. Reporting directly to our VP of Communications, but also working very closely with other members of the Senior Management Team, youâ€™ll have responsibility for making sure we understand how to deliver value to our customers and stay ahead of our competitors. As a central member of a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team passionate about reinventing the way new medicines are developed, you will bring your deep understanding of competitor, customer and market landscaping to rapidly escalate our competitive presence in multiple markets. Your work with experts in artificial intelligence, software engineering, informatics, biological sciences, drug discovery and Product will enable us to discover robust clinical insight that will ultimately make a difference to the lives of patients across a range of therapeutic areas. How you'll help Research, monitor and analyse life sciences, technology and healthcare industry sectors relevant to Sensyne, including associations, stakeholders, partners and competitors and make assessments on competitive landscape and market differentiation Overlay public domain information to build a more rounded picture of the overall market and competitor landscape Convert complex data and findings into actionable tables, graphs and written reports that will help to drive forward change and improvements in market intelligence Understand market size across our key industry verticals, defining the opportunity potential within each addressable market Ensure market intelligence and insight is embedded within our corporate finance, business development, sales and marketing efforts Act as the central source of knowledge for all market intelligence Requirements Market research and analysis/competitor landscaping expertise within a commercial organisation â€“ preferably with life sciences and healthcare industry experience, with a good working knowledge of the drug discovery and development. Start-up experience also preferred but not essential. Demonstrable expertise in data analysis and interpretation. Excellent knowledge of creating impactful reports An excellent track-record in primary and secondary research including qualitative and quantitative methods A great storyteller with the ability to bring research and insight â€œto lifeâ€ Highly proactive in identifying solutions to issues and predicting where opportunities for improving processes may arise in the future Exceptional relationship building skills to quickly understand the needs of all internal and external teams and collaborators Delivery-focused mindset, capable of scaling at pace, taking operational and practical ownership of projects Previous experience working with clinical data, with AI/ML or drug discovery within an academic or commercial setting is an asset Benefits Company share option scheme 5% employer matched salary sacrifice Pension scheme Life Assurance & Income protection A range of health, wealth and lifestyle benefit plans including BUPA, Gym and holiday trade options Electric Vehicles & Cycle to work schemes Proactive career development planning Show more Show less

Description: Company Description Weâ€™re Epsilon. Weâ€™ve quadrupled our European business in the last three years, been acquired by Publicis Groupe for US$4.4 billion, and signed many of the worldâ€™s most loved brands to our growing roster of European clients - some of which, youâ€™ll be working with. Weâ€™re disrupting both marketing and advertising technology industries, combining the two by harnessing our wealth of consumer insight and data to deliver personalised communications to more than 200 million individuals. Our entire business focusses on giving our clients the means to truthfully measure the value we create. In an industry thatâ€™s too-often associated with false promises and ambiguity, we pride ourselves on honesty and accountability. And weâ€™re seeking our next Business Systems Analyst to help us define our future as a centre of excellence for scalable technology within Publicis Groupe. Job Description A Technical Business Analyst at Epsilon is responsible for onboarding of clients 1st party data which is at the core of what makes us stand out in comparison to our competitors in the digital marketing space. Our role is to assess the clientâ€™s goals and strategies for their digital marketing campaigns and to onboard conversion-based customer data into our standardised database systems of which our network is driven. The TBA is a unique hybrid role within the Engineering department at Epsilon. Our team consists of TBAs and Developers in an agile methodology environment. The TBA manages and oversees the integration and automation of the clientâ€™s conversion data and is the trusted advisor and stakeholder representing our datawarehouse team. TBAs engage with clients to gather data requirements, analyse clientâ€™s original data using SQL or terminal commands to create business and mapping rules, work with developers to onboard the data and manage the deployment, and meet with internal stakeholders to review client data results. Post onboarding, the TBA provides ongoing internal cross-team support for data automation monitoring and client development data driven strategies. You'll be responsible for Interpreting customer needs and translate into understandable written requirements. Developing an understanding of client's original data. Analysing complex business problems and provide technical expertise for creating developer requirements. Serving as a liaison between developers and users, clients and companies, and management and IT on an as needed basis. Leading cross-functional linked teams to address business or systems issues. Providing details to stakeholders regarding agreed upon solutions and their impact. Building and maintaining relationships within the organisation and with external partners and understand the unique needs of each partnership. Have a working knowledge of SQL and an understanding of relational database design. Experience using Linux operational systems and simple command lines for interrogating data files. In addition to unlimited online learning, we regularly host world-leading industry experts, who give talks and workshops for our teams in our on-site learning and development centre. Colleagues are encouraged to partake in peer-to-peer learning, adding to an ever-growing training menu designed to cultivate continual development within the company. Our European headquarters, located in the iconic Television Centre in White City, is home to our focussed and friendly team of 200, backed by Epsilon-Conversantâ€™s global footprint of 8,000 colleagues, and Publicis Groupeâ€™s 80,000 strong global presence. Designed to maximise both productivity and downtime - fussball, ping pong and pool tables, alongside wellness treatments such as yoga, reflexology, acupuncture and massages, plus Publicisâ€™ Marcel Cafe with panoramic views across Londonâ€™s skyline - our office emphasises the individual, with spaces for sociable and collaborative working, alongside quieter areas for colleagues to focus. Weâ€™re friendly, small and approachable at heart, yet big in presence. Directly competing with the biggest names in advertising, weâ€™re evolving the industry through our technology and data, and weâ€™re seeking the brightest minds to support our future growth, driven by making their mark on the future of the industry. Description: Job Summary: Disney+ is The Walt Disney Companyâ€™s new Direct to Consumer video entertainment service. The service consists of long form and short form video built around five key content brands (Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and Star) with an appealing and easy to use interface accessed across multiple platforms (e.g. televisions, mobile devices, PCs). The Disney+ team is responsible for the day to day operation of Disney+ across Europe, Middle East and Africa, specifically focused on marketing, customer acquisition and retention, partnerships and synergy, content programming, research and analytics. We are looking for several senior data analysts to join our Disney+ Insights & Analytics team. The roles will support the business in gaining an in-depth understanding of Disney+ content performance across Star and the 5 brands, with a particular focus on original content, identify key areas of opportunity to complement the content portfolio, support experimentation capabilities across performance marketing, in-app and customer communication, and support the tracking of commercial performance. The roles will leverage top class analytical skills spanning from insights generation to statistical experimentation, excellent communication skills, and the ability to understand and support business needs. Key to the success of these roles will be the ability to provide relevant insights, generated from Disney+ data as well as leveraging the full breadth of customer research, market and business intelligence available within the business. Close collaboration with other analysts as well as business stakeholders will also be key. Company Industry: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care
Description: About Us At Sensyne Health we combine technology and ethically sourced patient data to help people everywhere get better care. To do this, we have created a unique partnership with the NHS that delivers a return to our partner Trusts and unlocks the value of clinical data for research while safeguarding patient privacy. Alongside this, we develop clinically validated software applications that create clinician and patient benefit while providing highly curated data. We use our proprietary clinical AI technology to analyse ethically sourced, clinically curated, anonymised patient data to solve serious unmet medical needs across a wide range of therapeutic areas, enabling a new approach to clinical trial design, drug discovery, development and post-marketing surveillance. The Role Sensyne Health are looking for a talented, proactive, and resourceful Market Analyst to help us deliver on our mission to accelerate medical research and improve patient care. Reporting directly to our VP of Communications, but also working very closely with other members of the Senior Management Team, youâ€™ll have responsibility for making sure we understand how to deliver value to our customers and stay ahead of our competitors. As a central member of a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team passionate about reinventing the way new medicines are developed, you will bring your deep understanding of competitor, customer and market landscaping to rapidly escalate our competitive presence in multiple markets. Your work with experts in artificial intelligence, software engineering, informatics, biological sciences, drug discovery and Product will enable us to discover robust clinical insight that will ultimately make a difference to the lives of patients across a range of therapeutic areas. How you'll help Research, monitor and analyse life sciences, technology and healthcare industry sectors relevant to Sensyne, including associations, stakeholders, partners and competitors and make assessments on competitive landscape and market differentiation Overlay public domain information to build a more rounded picture of the overall market and competitor landscape Convert complex data and findings into actionable tables, graphs and written reports that will help to drive forward change and improvements in market intelligence Understand market size across our key industry verticals, defining the opportunity potential within each addressable market Ensure market intelligence and insight is embedded within our corporate finance, business development, sales and marketing efforts Act as the central source of knowledge for all market intelligence Requirements Market research and analysis/competitor landscaping expertise within a commercial organisation â€“ preferably with life sciences and healthcare industry experience, with a good working knowledge of the drug discovery and development. Start-up experience also preferred but not essential. Demonstrable expertise in data analysis and interpretation. Excellent knowledge of creating impactful reports An excellent track-record in primary and secondary research including qualitative and quantitative methods A great storyteller with the ability to bring research and insight â€œto lifeâ€ Highly proactive in identifying solutions to issues and predicting where opportunities for improving processes may arise in the future Exceptional relationship building skills to quickly understand the needs of all internal and external teams and collaborators Delivery-focused mindset, capable of scaling at pace, taking operational and practical ownership of projects Previous experience working with clinical data, with AI/ML or drug discovery within an academic or commercial setting is an asset Benefits Company share option scheme 5% employer matched salary sacrifice Pension scheme Life Assurance & Income protection A range of health, wealth and lifestyle benefit plans including BUPA, Gym and holiday trade options Electric Vehicles & Cycle to work schemes Proactive career development planning Show more Show less

Description: Who We Are Since 2001 thinkmoney has been helping customers stay on top of their finances. Personal Qualities and Cultural Fit We work fast and to a high standard. The only way to constantly deliver in a time of great change is to ensure collaboration between people and departments. We look for people who are intellectually curious as to what is possible, mixed with the pragmatism to understand the operating environment and constraints, be they time, budget or capabilities. thinkmoney continues to be successful, so a growth mindset where you build technology solutions that work now, but that have future growth and business needs taken into account is essential. All delivered at a price point that ensures the maximum value for all expenditure. Role Description We are looking for a full stack data analyst to join a diverse and friendly team; taking data and engineering it into useful analysis and models that will inspire growth of our business. You will steer the development of customer analysis to provide insight into historical performance, future forecasts and opportunities for strategic improvements. You will Collaborate with stakeholders to iteratively deliver deep research into business problems. Design, prototype, deliver and maintain models in tools like R/Python/AWS Sagemaker, using data science toolkits like dplyr or ggplot2. Be comfortable learning a data transformation tool like Matillion or SSIS. Be comfortable working in an Agile Kanban workflow to safely code review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes. Collaborate with product teams on a regular basis to plan and prioritize requests, discuss requirements and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes. Use data science techniques to identify and take advantage of commercial opportunities, delivering more targeted acquisition, successful customer/portfolio management, and product performance. Use statistical methods and visualisation to measure and monitor the effectiveness of strategies, initiatives, the development of new products and risk management. Provide meaningful commentary to help decision-makers act on findings. Contribute to enhancements to the analytics and data science architecture. You have A degree and/or equivalent qualification/experience in a numerate subject (e.g. maths, statistics, data science, business intelligence). Comfortable with SQL, DAX, R or Python, and advanced Excel. Comfortable with visualisation development using tools like Cognos, SSRS, Power BI or Business Objects. Description: Weâ€™re Getir, the pioneers of super-fast delivery. Our story can be divided into three elements building an awesome people organisation that drives this epic machine, making 10-minute grocery delivery possible by figuring out all of its intricacies, and scaling that business by getting people to embrace us. Close your eyes and imagine sandwiches, shampoo, snacks, and paper towels delivered in an average of 10 minutes throughout the streets of London. Each product in each delivery creates a unique micro-experience. How we choose these micro-experiences, and how we adapt that to our business model, is an integral part of Getir. At Getir, it is not just our users, but also our employees and our team members, who have unique and challenging experiences that bring out the best of themselves. In that light, weâ€™re looking to hire some talented people to join us on this adventure. The future is here! Want to be a part of it? Join our team! Introduction Working in Supply Chain is one of those areas where, if all is going well, it should go unnoticed â€” like a well-oiled machine! Your mission (should you choose to accept it) will be to help our supply chain run as smoothly and profitably as possible, with data analysis as your superpower of choice. Fun is treated very seriously at Getir! Numerical and analytical skills with great attention to detail The ability to take ownership and responsibility, proactively seek out solutions and opportunities to improve Adaptability and flexibility in how you support the team and the needs of the business Superb organisation skills. Youâ€™re process driven, great at solving problems and you make decisions with confidence Speed and efficiency in all tasks to support the team (speed is our currency at Getir) Teamwork and strong communication skills. This includes mad zoom skills! Youâ€™re human and engaging both on screen and off screen (as it were). Benefits What Getir offers A competitive salary A once in a career opportunity to work with one of the fastest growing mobile-commerce businesses in Europe on our startup journey in London Staff discount Paid 20 days holidays plus public Bank Holidays The opportunity to have a real impact on the companyâ€™s growth and evolution An awesome team! Work with people who love what they do every day. Show more Show less

Company Industry: Staffing and Recruiting, Consumer Goods, and Retail
Description: Weâ€™re Getir, the pioneers of super-fast delivery. Our story can be divided into three elements building an awesome people organisation that drives this epic machine, making 10-minute grocery delivery possible by figuring out all of its intricacies, and scaling that business by getting people to embrace us. Close your eyes and imagine sandwiches, shampoo, snacks, and paper towels delivered in an average of 10 minutes throughout the streets of London. Each product in each delivery creates a unique micro-experience. How we choose these micro-experiences, and how we adapt that to our business model, is an integral part of Getir. At Getir, it is not just our users, but also our employees and our team members, who have unique and challenging experiences that bring out the best of themselves. In that light, weâ€™re looking to hire some talented people to join us on this adventure. The future is here! Want to be a part of it? Join our team! Introduction Working in Supply Chain is one of those areas where, if all is going well, it should go unnoticed â€” like a well-oiled machine! Your mission (should you choose to accept it) will be to help our supply chain run as smoothly and profitably as possible, with data analysis as your superpower of choice. We are looking for a Supply Chain Analyst to conduct data analysis to improve our supply chain operations. Your job will include all the 3PL KPI and supply chain performance monitoring. If this sounds like your cup of tea, read on! Key Roles And Responsibilities You will Track 3PL KPIs and report on supply chainâ€™s performance Collect and analyze supply chain data Create processes and methods to gather supply chain data Solve problems creatively. Don't think outside the box. Disregard the box entirely! (The box is in your mind). Analyze data to identify problematic areas and suggest improvements Plan and implement supply chain optimization projects (e.g. warehouse- slotting, route planning) Develop requirements and standards (e.g. warehouse processes and distribution) Oversee inventory procedures Evaluate the most cost-effective distribution schedules Help foster trusting relationships with 3PLs Recommend improvements to boost performance and reduce costs Coordinate with stakeholders to implement changes and improve processes Collaborate with the technical team to improve system effectiveness Requirements Ideally, youâ€™ll have Proven experience as a Supply Chain Analyst Experience in data mining, analysis and reporting Familiarity with supply chain processes (e.g.inventory planning, warehouse management) Advanced knowledge of excel and relational databases A good sense of humour. Fun is treated very seriously at Getir! Numerical and analytical skills with great attention to detail The ability to take ownership and responsibility, proactively seek out solutions and opportunities to improve Adaptability and flexibility in how you support the team and the needs of the business Superb organisation skills. Youâ€™re process driven, great at solving problems and you make decisions with confidence Speed and efficiency in all tasks to support the team (speed is our currency at Getir) Teamwork and strong communication skills. This includes mad zoom skills! Youâ€™re human and engaging both on screen and off screen (as it were). Benefits What Getir offers A competitive salary A once in a career opportunity to work with one of the fastest growing mobile-commerce businesses in Europe on our startup journey in London Staff discount Paid 20 days holidays plus public Bank Holidays The opportunity to have a real impact on the companyâ€™s growth and evolution An awesome team! Work with people who love what they do every day. Show more Show less

"The chance to join a growing company in a growing field does not come along very often and I have been on an amazing journey with Speechmatics. The opportunities to learn and grow come every day. We work on machine learning problems with a direct path to customer happiness and data is a huge part of achieving success in that. If data is your passion and you want to use it to fuel the next generation of machine learning breakthroughs, then Speechmatics could be the perfect place for you!" Tom Ash, Machine Learning Engineer Background Speechmatics leads the market as an any-context speech recognition engine for companies to rapidly build innovative applications at scale. The UK Government, Deloitte UK, Vonage, what3words and Adobe use Speechmatics in scenarios such as contact centers, CRM, consumer electronics, security, media and entertainment and software. Speechmatics processes millions of hours of transcription worldwide every month. As a recognized pioneer in machine learning voice engineering, Speechmatics enables companies to build applications that detect and transcribe voice in any context in real-time. Its neural networks consider acoustics, languages, dialects, multiple speakers, punctuation, capitalization, context and implicit meanings. In 2019, Speechmatics received the Queenâ€™s Award for Enterprise Innovation. â€‹ Speechmatics is a rapidly growing, global company with offices in Cambridge, UK, Denver, USA, Chennai, India and Brno, Czech Republic. With ambitious growth plans comes great opportunities that are exciting and progressive. Youâ€™ll be working with some of the smartest minds in the industry, working on cutting-edge projects and deploying the latest machine learning techniques to disrupt the market. Youâ€™ll provide customers with the best speech technology available, while immersed in a great team and company culture. Weâ€™re building a company that strives to be world-leading and weâ€™re looking for people who wholeheartedly believe they can be additive to our team, bring new ideas and join us on our journey. If thatâ€™s you, weâ€™d love to hear from you. Speechmatics is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, transgender status, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. The Opportunity Data is a core requirement for any machine learning company, and Speechmatics is no exception. To produce the high-quality speech recognition technology that we build across many languages requires not just data, but attention to detail. This provides clear understanding of the data we use in relation to the uses cases that it is there to support. There is constant learning and adjustment as the company grows, use cases diversify and customers expect continuous improvements. As part of this there is constant innovation, research and development occurring in Speechmatics and we now require a dedicated person responsible for managing, understanding and supporting the machine learning teams in delivering on these challenges at pace. Key Responsibilities Ensuring that we are building the best machine learning models by supporting the teams with the best data available. Supporting our customersâ€™ use cases, understanding our deficiencies and striving for excellence. Ensuring that recording of the data used is undertaken to support any compliance/regulatory needs. Owning the processes by which we gather, measure, understand and improve the data needed to deliver world beating accuracy. This could include: Building and supporting testing frameworks/tools to support testing of accuracy for speech recognition and related features. Obtaining Data for both testing and training different use cases, identifying, coordinating and building out network of 3rd-party vendors to support multiple languages as needed for labelling both speech and related features. Supporting the data sharing agreements with 3rd parties and the management of data transfers between customers and Speechmatics. Ensuring that recording of the data used is undertaken to support any compliance/regulatory needs. Understanding where we are deficient in data and working out where that data gap could be closed to widen support for things like accents/dialects/languages. The deficiency resolution could be cleaning/fixing issues with current data as well as identifying new sources for the data. Exploring where we are good and bad in terms of ASR quality - pro-actively gathering data from different acoustic setups and exploring how well we do against competitors. Supporting our understanding where our systems are strong and where they are weak. Prioritise the budget with support from the product roadmap to enable the best value to be achieved with respect to obtaining data. Help to define and implement strategies to improve models though continuous improvement data processes and data loop closure and preparing data for use in ML projects. Taking inventory, understanding, and organising existing data, including availability, usage, and obtaining additional metadata as needed. Role Requirements Essential Good communication skills supporting understanding of both technical and business considerations across multiple functions of the business. Ability to understand data labels and write scripts to support evaluation of quality and processing of the data, manipulate results. Ability to understand and analyse data in order to make data driven informed recommendations for improvements. Understanding how to evaluate and learn from large quantities of data and find the important aspects that need attention. Ability to script in Python and Bash to support the processing of data. Desirable Degree in Computer Science or related field. Knowledge and / or experience of automatic speech recognition and associated fields. Closing date for applications: 26th January 2021 Show more Show less

Company Industry: Real Estate
Description: About The Role This role is to put insight and analysis at the heart of Foxtons communications. This is a varied role suitable for a candidate who can effectively manage a range of projects, working closely with stakeholders both internally and externally. The role is to provide analytical insight into the drivers of business and market performance, and to provide reports and analysis to a variety of stakeholders in order for them to make strategic decisions. A key part of this role will be to produce property market analysis and supporting reports for external publications. The candidate will need to use the available data to monitor and identify key trends in the London property market, and to produce insight and analysis which can be used in market reports and publications. An ideal candidate will have experience with analysing and presenting the data in an interesting way, and being able to clearly summarise the data to a non-technical audience. This candidate will be responsible for creation and updating all the B2B pitch documents created by our Build to Rent and New Homes departments supporting the overall narrative with data. The pitch documents need to showcase Foxtons propriety data in an interesting and unique way, and will need to work with the content team to ensure the data is presented accurately and in a meaningful way. Our projects often involve managing multiple stakeholders and high degrees of complexity and uncertainty. Our work typically involves constructing purpose-built databases storing large client datasets for our analytical models, using data transformation tools, visualisation tools, programming and statistical tools (such as R and Python), to derive insight through data modelling and simulations, in a fast moving transaction environment. Ability to work with clients and model users, identify their particular use case requirements, design appropriate solutions to load data, perform complex calculations, derive corollaries and deliver interface tools to provide repeatable visual output. Strong oral and written communication skills. Ideally you'll also have some of the following Experience of working with visualisation tools including Tableau, Tibco Spotfire, Shiny, Power BI and QlikView. Experience in SQL Server, MS Excel and VBA. Experience of working in a professional services environment, including exposure to high profile transactions. Experience of financial reporting, and an understanding of basic corporate finance and accounting concepts. Experience of working in teams, managing the workload of junior team members What We Offer We offer a competitive remuneration package where youâ€™ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer Continuous learning Youâ€™ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you Weâ€™ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership Weâ€™ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture Youâ€™ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The Exceptional EY Experience. Itâ€™s Yours To Build. Apply now. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Company Industry: Marketing and Advertising

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Cultivate your specialism in measurement and optimisation, with the application of data science techniques to understanding media performance, forecasting and optimisation. The ability to manage large data sets utilising SQL, R and experience in cloud technology (ideally GCP / Big Query & AWS). Interest and experience in learning new languages or database frameworks (e.g. Athena, Python, R-Shiny, etc.). Good grasp of statistical, machine learning, and optimisation techniques and bringing value to clients. Minimum one year in a media agency, advertising company, or an internal analytics team. Familiar with Google suite of advertising tools, e.g. including CM and GA360. Enthusiastic about driving innovation, working in connected networks and have demonstrated evidence in this regard. Experience and interest in agile processes, e.g. Trello/Jira. Hungry for creating something new and making a mark. Our Network Omnicom Media Group is the media services division of Omnicom Group Inc., the leading global advertising, marketing and corporate communications company, providing services to over 5,000 clients in more than 100 countries. Omnicom Media Group includes the full service media networks OMD Worldwide, PHD Network and Hearts & Science, as well as several media specialist companies including search and social specialist Resolution, digital trading platform OMG Programmatic, Novus, Optimum Sports/Fuse, Outdoor Media Group, Content Collective, and direct response agency Pathway. Company Industry: Health, Wellness and Fitness
Description: About Zava: Since our inception in 2011, weâ€™ve been on a mission to provide our patients with healthcare that is dependable, affordable, and a fraction of todayâ€™s cost. To date, weâ€™ve provided over 5 million consultations across the UK, Germany, France, and Ireland. We began our mission with an asynchronous approach to healthcare. Patients fill out a short medical questionnaire for review by our in-house doctors and once approved the appropriate medication is sent directly to their door. Our approach has been successful in removing the time and effort needed to visit a GP in person and in treating a high volume of patients within a relatively short space of time. Our pharmacy is busier than ever but since our $32m investment in 2019, we have been adding to our offering to become a more holistic healthcare provider. Now, we offer live one-to-one video consultations in Germany through our iOS and Android apps, have white-label partnerships in the UK, and are constantly looking at ways to do more for our patients. We have ambitious growth plans at Zava, after a second successful round of investment and following the completion of two exciting acquisitions in Germany, and we are now in the early phases of developing partnerships with statutory healthcare providers, as well as health insurers so that we can offer our services with reduced costs to our patients. We aim to be Europeâ€™s biggest digital healthcare provider by 2025. About the role: The Senior Data Analyst at Zava will ultimately be responsible for understanding, and helping others to understand, how to optimise our product for our users and the business. Theyâ€™ll create tools and dashboards that break down the key drivers of product performance in interpretable and actionable ways. They will help define our KPIs and end-to-end customer flows, and drive performance against them, by surfacing insights, supporting tactical decisions and influencing the product strategy with a compelling evidence-based narrative thatâ€™s engaging to both technical and non-technical people alike. What can you expect from working with us? Knowledge Sharing - Weâ€™re learning all the time (mostly from each other) because we donâ€™t work in silos. We talk, teach and ask questions - sharing knowledge so that we can all develop new skills. Wide range and variety of data - From sensitive patient data to marketing and web analytics, you can expect to work with a wide range of complex data. Make an impact - Leading a collaborative problem-solving process to define meaningful, relevant and easily understood KPIs around product performance, you will see the impact of your insights and the overall value to the business. Trust and autonomy - Youâ€™ll have the freedom to manage your own schedule and will be trusted to run projects from end-to-end. A lot of analysis will be performed in SQL but youâ€™ll also be given the flexibility to use other data tools such as Python and R - whatever you prefer using. We also welcome our employees to introduce new tools, experiences and ways of working. Company wide benefits - As well as a competitive salary, youâ€™ll be offered an annual Â£500 training budget, a team social budget, Simply Health cash plan & wellbeing, a bonus scheme as well flexible & remote working opportunities (to be discussed with your manager). Youâ€™ll also be offered the cycle-to-work scheme, a season ticket loan, and an office with a bike rack, showers, free fruit, coffee when applicable! Day-to-day the work will encompass: Leading a collaborative problem-solving process to define meaningful, relevant and easily understood KPIs around product performance Building end-to-end product dashboards that bring these metrics to life Collaborating with other team members to better understand user behaviour through experimentation and testing. Provide support on A/B and multivariate testing and other best-practice analytical techniques during the feature development process Identifying tracking requirements to enable accurate reporting / measurement. Work with our developers to get these implemented Helping to develop and maintain our business intelligence tool (Looker) by adding new metrics in line with emerging areas of business interest and product development Analysing changes in product usage and performance to generate insights and communicate these to stakeholders Inspiring others to love and use data through effective storytelling Presenting insights and opportunities in a clear manner such that product design is based on objective evidence wherever possible For this role you need to: Strong SQL skills and experience working with data warehouses (preferably in AWS) Confidence in managing senior (C-suite) stakeholders from across the business Attention to detail - being able to identify anomalies in the data and spot trends before anyone else Proven experience working with web tracking tools (Segment/GA) It would also be advantageous to have experience: Experience with Looker Experience with marketing tools (AdWords, GTM etc) Mentoring analysts (whether in a formal or informal capacity) Your line manager will be: Data Science Lead/Head Of Data & Insight Your application journey will be: Introductory call with Talent Team (15 mins) Screening call with hiring manager (30 mins) Technical exercise (1 hour) Panel interview (1 hour) consisting of: A Product Manager A Marketing Manager Member of the People Team Core working hours Our core business hours are 9am - 6pm, although flexible working arrangements are available upon agreement with your line manager. We want you to promote the use of BI tools and concepts across the organisation, look after the day to day maintenance of data warehouse and reporting system and translate reporting requirements into well-documented specifications for BI reports and applications. You will design and implement reporting applications including BI dashboards, reporting cubes and static reports. You will design and create data cubes and multi-dimensional structures to support reporting requirements and convert identified existing reporting applications to a standardised infrastructure using standard SQL and MS BI products. You will be providing estimates for project scheduling, be responsible for the documentation of BI architecture, ensuring system changes are managed and signed off following the teams change management process, and assess new and relevant technologies. Ultimately, your work will help us achieve some key targets. The most rewarding part of the job is knowing that you are joining a business that helps people and families manage their own homes, to build brighter futures and thrive. We want you to be somebody who: Is an IT professional with a proven track record of BI analysis and strong technical knowledge Has BI analysis experience and strong knowledge of database and reporting technologies Can bring experience in report development using tools such as PowerBI (essential), Tableau, IBM Cognos, Oracle Hyperion and SAP BusinessObjects Has some experience in using the Microsoft BI stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS) and the design and implementation of ETL processes Experience in the design and implementation of ETL processes Experience in developing Business Intelligence solutions (reports, dashboards, scorecards) using recognised industry tools. DevOps Methodology desirable Datalake desirable CI/CD deployment pipelines and version control desirable Is a strategic thinker and able to make decisions based on sound judgement Is adaptable and willing to learn new skills A genuine interest in the housing sector and a current understanding of external influences (desirable) Believes in our DNA and will be a great ambassador for Bromford. Depending on your location, this role can be based at our Wolverhampton, Tewkesbury or Chipping Sodbury office. Consideration will be given to anyone with experience working in roles such as BI developer, BI Analyst data analyst, business analyst and/or business data analyst, amongst others. A place to be you! Being able to express yourself at work helps you connect with people and gives you the freedom to perform better at your job. We believe diversity helps drive success, so we want to build a culture where all our differences are celebrated. Everybody should feel that they belong and are able to bring their true, authentic selves to work. We want an organisation that reflects the communities and the people that we serve and if we can achieve this, we know that we will create an environment where everyone is included and can thrive. Closing date for applications is 24th June with interviews taking place week commencing 28th June. Show more Show less

Description: The opportunity Do you have an analytical mind-set? Within Decision Analytics and Modelling we have established a rapidly growing analytics offering and are currently looking for exceptional individuals with experience in advanced analytics, data science and machine learning technologies to join the team. Our work typically involves constructing purpose-built databases storing large client datasets for our analytical models, using data transformation tools, visualisation tools, programming and statistical tools (such as R and Python), to derive insight through data modelling and simulations, in a fast moving transaction environment. Ability to work with clients and model users, identify their particular use case requirements, design appropriate solutions to load data, perform complex calculations, derive corollaries and deliver interface tools to provide repeatable visual output. Strong oral and written communication skills. Experience in SQL Server, MS Excel and VBA. Experience of working in a professional services environment, including exposure to high profile transactions. Experience of financial reporting, and an understanding of basic corporate finance and accounting concepts. Experience of working in teams, managing the workload of junior team members What We Offer We offer a competitive remuneration package where youâ€™ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer Continuous learning Youâ€™ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you Weâ€™ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership Weâ€™ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture Youâ€™ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The Exceptional EY Experience. Itâ€™s Yours To Build. Apply now. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Interest and experience in learning new languages or database frameworks (e.g. Athena, Python, R-Shiny, etc.). Good grasp of statistical, machine learning, and optimisation techniques and bringing value to clients. Minimum one year in a media agency, advertising company, or an internal analytics team. Familiar with Google suite of advertising tools, e.g. including CM and GA360. Enthusiastic about driving innovation, working in connected networks and have demonstrated evidence in this regard. Experience and interest in agile processes, e.g. Trello/Jira. Hungry for creating something new and making a mark. Our Network Omnicom Media Group is the media services division of Omnicom Group Inc., the leading global advertising, marketing and corporate communications company, providing services to over 5,000 clients in more than 100 countries. Omnicom Media Group includes the full service media networks OMD Worldwide, PHD Network and Hearts & Science, as well as several media specialist companies including search and social specialist Resolution, digital trading platform OMG Programmatic, Novus, Optimum Sports/Fuse, Outdoor Media Group, Content Collective, and direct response agency Pathway. We offer unparalleled representation in the marketplace, as well as a depth of capabilities and experience to drive leadership and innovation in every media type. The company may make changes to your duties from time to time to meet the changing needs of our business. Description: About Zava: Since our inception in 2011, weâ€™ve been on a mission to provide our patients with healthcare that is dependable, affordable, and a fraction of todayâ€™s cost. To date, weâ€™ve provided over 5 million consultations across the UK, Germany, France, and Ireland. We began our mission with an asynchronous approach to healthcare. Patients fill out a short medical questionnaire for review by our in-house doctors and once approved the appropriate medication is sent directly to their door. Our approach has been successful in removing the time and effort needed to visit a GP in person and in treating a high volume of patients within a relatively short space of time. Our pharmacy is busier than ever but since our $32m investment in 2019, we have been adding to our offering to become a more holistic healthcare provider. We aim to be Europeâ€™s biggest digital healthcare provider by 2025. About the role: The Senior Data Analyst at Zava will ultimately be responsible for understanding, and helping others to understand, how to optimise our product for our users and the business. Theyâ€™ll create tools and dashboards that break down the key drivers of product performance in interpretable and actionable ways. They will help define our KPIs and end-to-end customer flows, and drive performance against them, by surfacing insights, supporting tactical decisions and influencing the product strategy with a compelling evidence-based narrative thatâ€™s engaging to both technical and non-technical people alike. What can you expect from working with us? Knowledge Sharing - Weâ€™re learning all the time (mostly from each other) because we donâ€™t work in silos. We talk, teach and ask questions - sharing knowledge so that we can all develop new skills. Make an impact - Leading a collaborative problem-solving process to define meaningful, relevant and easily understood KPIs around product performance, you will see the impact of your insights and the overall value to the business. Trust and autonomy - Youâ€™ll have the freedom to manage your own schedule and will be trusted to run projects from end-to-end. A lot of analysis will be performed in SQL but youâ€™ll also be given the flexibility to use other data tools such as Python and R - whatever you prefer using. We also welcome our employees to introduce new tools, experiences and ways of working. Company wide benefits - As well as a competitive salary, youâ€™ll be offered an annual Â£500 training budget, a team social budget, Simply Health cash plan & wellbeing, a bonus scheme as well flexible & remote working opportunities (to be discussed with your manager). Day-to-day the work will encompass: Leading a collaborative problem-solving process to define meaningful, relevant and easily understood KPIs around product performance Building end-to-end product dashboards that bring these metrics to life Collaborating with other team members to better understand user behaviour through experimentation and testing. Work with our developers to get these implemented Helping to develop and maintain our business intelligence tool (Looker) by adding new metrics in line with emerging areas of business interest and product development Analysing changes in product usage and performance to generate insights and communicate these to stakeholders Inspiring others to love and use data through effective storytelling Presenting insights and opportunities in a clear manner such that product design is based on objective evidence wherever possible For this role you need to: Strong SQL skills and experience working with data warehouses (preferably in AWS) Confidence in managing senior (C-suite) stakeholders from across the business Attention to detail - being able to identify anomalies in the data and spot trends before anyone else Proven experience working with web tracking tools (Segment/GA) It would also be advantageous to have experience: Experience with Looker Experience with marketing tools (AdWords, GTM etc) Mentoring analysts (whether in a formal or informal capacity) Your line manager will be: Data Science Lead/Head Of Data & Insight Your application journey will be: Introductory call with Talent Team (15 mins) Screening call with hiring manager (30 mins) Technical exercise (1 hour) Panel interview (1 hour) consisting of: A Product Manager A Marketing Manager Member of the People Team Core working hours Our core business hours are 9am - 6pm, although flexible working arrangements are available upon agreement with your line manager. Company Industry: Health, Wellness and Fitness, Internet, and Information Technology and Services
Description: Doctify is a high-growth HealthTech company revolutionising the global healthcare market. Having expanded into 4 markets with an ambitious growth plan over the coming year. Doctify has developed a first-of-its-kind healthcare-specific patient feedback and review product allowing healthcare professionals to drive improvements in patient care on a daily basis. Our SaaS product allows healthcare providers to collect and digitize patient feedback and publish it through multiple channels (both externally and internally). Underpinning it is a SaaS platform that provides insights and analytics into the care they provide. It means for the first time patients can read real-time verified feedback for a hospital, clinic, or doctor for a specific condition or procedure. The company was founded by two orthopaedic surgeons in 2015 with the goal of providing more trust and transparency in healthcare. Alongside your role, the intern development programme (www.siemens.co.uk/interns) will teach softer skills such as communication, teamwork, commercial awareness, digitilisation and innovation. We also offer plenty of opportunity to develop your career whilst offering a competitive salary and an excellent benefits package. Weâ€™re looking for passionate teammates with the aptitude and attitude to succeed in the world of Data Analytics and IT. Apply now and join Europeâ€™s leading engineering and technology company. The total rewards' package for this role includes a salary of Â£18,525 per annum. We know that not everyoneâ€™s lifestyle is the same, so we operate a flexible benefits scheme where you can tailor your benefits package to suit your individual needs. If we all thought the same, we would never think of anything new. Thatâ€™s why we recruit great minds from all walks of life. Siemens recognise that building a diverse workforce is essential to the success of our business. We strongly encourage applications from a diverse talent pool and welcome the opportunity to discuss flexibility requirements and workplace adjustments with all applicants to encourage agile working, flexibility and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Company Industry: Health, Wellness and Fitness, Internet, and Information Technology and Services
Description: Doctify is a high-growth HealthTech company revolutionising the global healthcare market. Having expanded into 4 markets with an ambitious growth plan over the coming year. Doctify has developed a first-of-its-kind healthcare-specific patient feedback and review product allowing healthcare professionals to drive improvements in patient care on a daily basis. Our SaaS product allows healthcare providers to collect and digitize patient feedback and publish it through multiple channels (both externally and internally). Underpinning it is a SaaS platform that provides insights and analytics into the care they provide. It means for the first time patients can read real-time verified feedback for a hospital, clinic, or doctor for a specific condition or procedure. The company was founded by two orthopaedic surgeons in 2015 with the goal of providing more trust and transparency in healthcare. It quickly grew from an idea to a revenue-generating business in less than a year and continues to thrive. Backed by industry-leading European funds Amadeus capital, Keen ventures as well as backers such Sir John Hegarty (the founder of Saatchi and Saatchi) and Tom Teichmann (backer of Lastminute.com, Not on the highstreet, Made.com, Simba Sleep). Since then we have added over 25,000 doctors, hospitals, and clinics across 4 international markets, doubled our team across 6 countries and have won numerous awards along the way in recognition of our commitment to bringing greater levels of trust and transparency to the doctor-patient relationship. Most recently recognised as the 2021 Vitality Supplier of the Year. Reports to: CFO Department: Finance Job Description: As a Business Analyst, this internship offers a unique chance to work directly with the CFO in the creation of business insight and analysis. Your work will. enable the company to use its financial data to create better outcomes, tying insight to actions and creating an efficient business machine able to cope with the challenges of scaling. Key Responsibilities will include: Work will include the creation of a company wide unit economics and KPIs dashboard that can be automatically updated regularly to help key departments track progress. The role will also include research work in building up market insight for our overseas markets, such as Germany and the UAE, helping us understand segments to target, pricing and sales strategy. Finally, you will be in place to support the CFO and finance function during a period of intense growth, with work ranging from quality assurance, costs analysis, and some accounting such as revenue reconciliation. This will be a chance to learn about commercial finance in practice at a fast growth company. Essential Skills: - Strong grip of excel, including modelling, creating charts and succinct reporting - Understanding the basics of accounting - Cash, P&L and Balance Sheet - Highly proficient with use of numbers - Good communication skills - making the analysis clear and usable for the business - Can do attitude, happy to get involved in a wide range of projects. What we offer Hybrid remote/office working model. Remote-first summer season. Private health plan. Continuing personal development. Weekly yoga/meditation/sports sessions. Friday evening drinks. Access to a range of offers & discounts from retailers like Sainsburyâ€™s, Morrisons, Currys, Debenhams & many more. Team outings and sports activities (squash, darts, football, and more). Discounted Gym membership to over 3,000 participating gyms, pools, studios. Workplace Wellness support line and resource centre (family care, stress, debt concerns, work/life balance, bereavement, money management, and more). 2021 Vitality 'Supplier of the Year' award winner. We are not currently working with agencies or recruiters. Here at Doctify - we value diversity, fairness and promote inclusion within our organisation, beyond the policies and procedures. Inclusivity is weaved into our culture and the behaviours of our team. Show more Show less

It not only impacts data science but also the brand of Yelp in the public sphere. Description: Salary: Â£15,000-Â£19,000 dependent on qualifications The duration of the apprenticeship will be 22 months. Level 4 course, within our Emmisions team, Evidence & Policy Ricardo Energy & Environment is a leading sustainability consultancy combining energy, climate change, environmental and chemical risk expertise with strong IT and economics capability. Operating across the world, we work in partnership with our customers to help transform the way they work, empowering business leaders with award winning consultancy advice. With unrivalled sector insight and a reputation for producing innovative solutions, we offer a stimulating and rewarding environment in which to work. The Environmental Evidence and Policy team of over 250 consultants, scientists and engineers develop and apply state-of-the-art tools and techniques to deliver effective solutions to difficult air quality and greenhouse gas problems. Our team includes knowledge leaders on air quality measurement, inventory development, modelling, exposure assessment, chemical modelling, public health impacts, information management and data visualisation. Our clients benefit from the full range of air quality and greenhouse gas services that result in solutions and strategies tailored to addressing challenges at local, city and national scales. We deliver hundreds of projects every year, to public and private sector clients in the UK and overseas, including flagship programmes such as the UK's national air quality measurement network (AURN), the National Atmospheric Emissions Inventory (NAEI) and the annual national scale air quality modelling assessment on behalf of UK Government. We now have an opportunity for an apprentice data analyst to support a range of exciting and innovative projects within our Modelling and Inventories team. Your responsibilities will include research and data analysis that underpins our consultancy work, including delivery of the UK's National Atmospheric Emissions Inventory. The duration of the apprenticeship will be 22 months. You will manage your time across several projects and business areas, although the focus of this role is to support work in our Emissions Inventories and Projections work. This will include contributing in all phases - from supporting the preparation of proposals to win new contracts, through researching and analysing information and data, to contributing to reports that are delivered to clients. Please note the Road Map document attached to this advert, detailing the progression of this opportunity. Formal training will be provided by Learning Curve Group and supplemented by on-the job training. This will include: Excel, Access and MySQL skills Access and extract data from a range of sources Algorithms/hypothesis and preparing suitable statistical data models over a range of datasets Data processing including automation of process. Data visualisation and formatting skills Estimation of uncertainties Teamwork Presentation and communication skills Technical and report writing Planning and organisational skills Fundamentals of finance for business Introduction to coding in R and/or Python or other programming systems Principles of quality assurance and quality control (QA/QC) Data integration tools and techniques Quality issues for data analysis Testing requirements and testing data models including automatic testing. 1 day per week of 'off the job' training, delivered by Learning Curve Group. In return for your commitment, drive and enthusiasm, we offer an attractive remuneration and benefits package and the opportunity to make a difference in a challenging and rewarding field. Ricardo Energy & Environment is an equal opportunities employer. This is an exciting and rewarding place to work, with the opportunity to make a difference. What sets us apart is our People. You will work with an exceptional team of talented, dedicated and supportive individuals. You will have a fantastic opportunity to develop your career with us through our broad range of projects, mentoring opportunities and a personalised approach to your learning and development. Our People are important to us and we take pride in our wellbeing programmes and policies that support individuals including flexible working, carers policy, mental health first aiders and readily available support through our extensive Employee Assistance programme. Description: Doctify is a high-growth HealthTech company revolutionising the global healthcare market. Having expanded into 4 markets with an ambitious growth plan over the coming year. Doctify has developed a first-of-its-kind healthcare-specific patient feedback and review product allowing healthcare professionals to drive improvements in patient care on a daily basis. Our SaaS product allows healthcare providers to collect and digitize patient feedback and publish it through multiple channels (both externally and internally). Underpinning it is a SaaS platform that provides insights and analytics into the care they provide. It means for the first time patients can read real-time verified feedback for a hospital, clinic, or doctor for a specific condition or procedure. The company was founded by two orthopaedic surgeons in 2015 with the goal of providing more trust and transparency in healthcare. It quickly grew from an idea to a revenue-generating business in less than a year and continues to thrive. Backed by industry-leading European funds Amadeus capital, Keen ventures as well as backers such Sir John Hegarty (the founder of Saatchi and Saatchi) and Tom Teichmann (backer of Lastminute.com, Not on the highstreet, Made.com, Simba Sleep). Since then we have added over 25,000 doctors, hospitals, and clinics across 4 international markets, doubled our team across 6 countries and have won numerous awards along the way in recognition of our commitment to bringing greater levels of trust and transparency to the doctor-patient relationship. Most recently recognised as the 2021 Vitality Supplier of the Year. Reports to: CFO Department: Finance Job Description: As a Business Analyst, this internship offers a unique chance to work directly with the CFO in the creation of business insight and analysis. Your work will. enable the company to use its financial data to create better outcomes, tying insight to actions and creating an efficient business machine able to cope with the challenges of scaling. Key Responsibilities will include: Work will include the creation of a company wide unit economics and KPIs dashboard that can be automatically updated regularly to help key departments track progress. The role will also include research work in building up market insight for our overseas markets, such as Germany and the UAE, helping us understand segments to target, pricing and sales strategy. Finally, you will be in place to support the CFO and finance function during a period of intense growth, with work ranging from quality assurance, costs analysis, and some accounting such as revenue reconciliation. This will be a chance to learn about commercial finance in practice at a fast growth company. Essential Skills: - Strong grip of excel, including modelling, creating charts and succinct reporting - Understanding the basics of accounting - Cash, P&L and Balance Sheet - Highly proficient with use of numbers - Good communication skills - making the analysis clear and usable for the business - Can do attitude, happy to get involved in a wide range of projects. What we offer Hybrid remote/office working model. Remote-first summer season. Private health plan. Continuing personal development. Weekly yoga/meditation/sports sessions. Friday evening drinks. Access to a range of offers & discounts from retailers like Sainsburyâ€™s, Morrisons, Currys, Debenhams & many more. Team outings and sports activities (squash, darts, football, and more). Discounted Gym membership to over 3,000 participating gyms, pools, studios. Workplace Wellness support line and resource centre (family care, stress, debt concerns, work/life balance, bereavement, money management, and more). 2021 Vitality 'Supplier of the Year' award winner. Company Industry: Environmental Services and Renewables & Environment
Description: Salary: Â£15,000-Â£19,000 dependent on qualifications The duration of the apprenticeship will be 22 months. Level 4 course, within our Emmisions team, Evidence & Policy Ricardo Energy & Environment is a leading sustainability consultancy combining energy, climate change, environmental and chemical risk expertise with strong IT and economics capability. Operating across the world, we work in partnership with our customers to help transform the way they work, empowering business leaders with award winning consultancy advice. With unrivalled sector insight and a reputation for producing innovative solutions, we offer a stimulating and rewarding environment in which to work. The Environmental Evidence and Policy team of over 250 consultants, scientists and engineers develop and apply state-of-the-art tools and techniques to deliver effective solutions to difficult air quality and greenhouse gas problems. Our team includes knowledge leaders on air quality measurement, inventory development, modelling, exposure assessment, chemical modelling, public health impacts, information management and data visualisation. Our clients benefit from the full range of air quality and greenhouse gas services that result in solutions and strategies tailored to addressing challenges at local, city and national scales. We deliver hundreds of projects every year, to public and private sector clients in the UK and overseas, including flagship programmes such as the UK's national air quality measurement network (AURN), the National Atmospheric Emissions Inventory (NAEI) and the annual national scale air quality modelling assessment on behalf of UK Government. We now have an opportunity for an apprentice data analyst to support a range of exciting and innovative projects within our Modelling and Inventories team. Your responsibilities will include research and data analysis that underpins our consultancy work, including delivery of the UK's National Atmospheric Emissions Inventory. The duration of the apprenticeship will be 22 months. You will manage your time across several projects and business areas, although the focus of this role is to support work in our Emissions Inventories and Projections work. This will include contributing in all phases - from supporting the preparation of proposals to win new contracts, through researching and analysing information and data, to contributing to reports that are delivered to clients. Please note the Road Map document attached to this advert, detailing the progression of this opportunity. Formal training will be provided by Learning Curve Group and supplemented by on-the job training. Description: About Gelato Gelato has built the world's largest and most global networks for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards, We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs and the global shift towards local and more sustainable production. We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We already have more than 100 production partners in 30 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people and potential consumers in a smarter, faster, and greener way. In many ways, we at Gelato are rethinking how digital fabrication of customized products can be done on-demand. Just imagine what will happen when we add 3D printing capabilities to this global service. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. Again, thanks to the products being produced locally we produce what you need when you need it, and where you need it. In other words, we reduce waste and carbon emissions. Together we can increase global GDP by effectively supporting - local on-demand production. What You Will Be Doing Routing lies at the heart of our Gelato platform. This is the function that decides in the moment which of our rapidly growing network of print houses and logistics partners is best placed to receive a customer order, produce and ship the finished product to the final destination. Our algorithm balances speed, quality, cost and environmental impact (amongst other factors) to find the smartest route for each of our millions of orders. The algorithm finds not only great results for our customers, but also controls volume and stock at our production partners to ensure they are operating at peak efficiency. As Data Scientist Routing, you will work with business, engineering, and tech functions where you will have opportunities to develop and evaluate machine learning models using large datasets to drive automation and efficiency in our order management process. You will have the opportunity to solve existing business problems and collaborate with teams to deliver future innovation in this industry. You will help answer fundamental questions of correlation between inputs and outputs and driving the most efficient routing strategy. You will lead the thinking for writing deterministic checks, collect defects identified from Machine Learning and deterministic rules and pass for remediation. You will be responsible to translate the requirements of this program into technical requests for the tech team. Who You Are This is a key role within the Gelato team, and we are seeking a skilled Data Scientist who can help us both shape strategy and to execute against a bold and aggressive roadmap to support Gelatoâ€™s rapidly scaling business operations. While being a self-starter, hands-on, and comfortable with ambiguity, you work are a strong team player. You are committed to excel with energy and endurance, and you understand that helping to build a company is hard but satisfying work. You have a passion, and the stamina for building great services and technology, superior communication skills, high integrity, and great attention to detail. Basic Qualifications Bachelorâ€™s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field from a top tier University 5+ years of relevant experience with data modelling, applying analytics, machine learning. Skilled with programming languages Experience in data visualization and BI tools Highly analytical, with a bias for objective measurement, facts and reasoning Great at telling a story through factual data Self-starter, hands on and comfortable with ambiguity Strong inter-personal skills including written and oral skills. Able to effectively communicate with all levels Preferred Qualifications Masters degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field Expertise / Extensive knowledge in specialized areas such as time series analysis, reinforcement learning Advanced skills with Python and SQL Experience in supply chain or related functions Track record of tangible business impact based on ML implementation What Itâ€™s Like To Work At Gelato Building a company is hard work. We expect a lot from each other. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application. Requirements All candidates must have the legal right to work in the UK and will be expected to provide documentation to support this status. Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor visa or relocation at this time. Show more Show less
