Company Industry: Civil Engineering
Description: About The Role At WSP, thereâ€™s nothing we love more than pushing boundaries. Harnessing innovation and sharing insights across our diverse, international team to create a tomorrowâ€™s world that's cleaner, greener and safer. Join us and youâ€™ll be part of an organisation that takes pride in its people and purpose: creating long-lasting solutions to meet the needs of generations to come. Think bigger scale. Think higher profile. Think groundbreaking. Join WSP, and youâ€™ll be at the heart of a team of international experts all dedicated to growing and sharing their expertise, and working on projects that transform society for all of us. WSP is the UK's largest supplier of Land Referencing services and is looking for an individual wanting to start a career in the Digital Solutions team to work on our software systems and client projects. We work on the countries largest infrastructure projects with clients in a variety of sectors such as Road, Rail, Energy and Water. The role sits within the digital team which consists of support and data analysts, data consultants, software developers and technical solution consultants. Together the team focus on the use of and development of the systems used to support client deliverables. This role will work closely with other team members and our land consultants to ensure the data that is collected is of the highest quality and provide advice on how to improve the quality of our data. This will involve analysing data to suggest approaches for data cleansing, creating custom extracts of data to a specific requirement or building detailed reports for senior stakeholders within the business and our clients. Using your experience you will be responsible for the quality of data on a variety of our projects by highlighting trends and isolating issues. Proactively implementing approaches to improve quality, such as combining 3rd party datasets and guiding projects on the steps they should take to resolve any data issues. The role will involve using practical skills such as SQL to produce complex highly efficient database queries, views, and stored procedures as well as others, including Power BI and Python, to publish dynamic client reports and automate repetative tasks. WSP is looking for self-motivated individuals with strong verbal and written communication skills as the role requires building relationships with non-technical users and being able to translate their requirements into deliverables. A Typical Week Would Include Take responsibility for data quality across a variety of projects, reviewing and comparing them to ensure we are on track for delivery. Regularly reviewing data quality and defining approaches to combat common issues and system improvements. Presenting data to stakeholders within the business Work with the software development team to understand the data structures of our system to ensure reports can be produced efficiently and accurately. Communicating with non-technical users in a clear and concise fashion to provide advice about how to obtain the correct data from our systems. Promote the use of our systems with clients and internal users, becoming a subject matter expert Querying relational databases using SQL and creating reports using Power BI & SSRS Identify trends, provide insights and make recommendations on different aspects of the data Provide technical documentation to ensure the system can be effectively maintained We'd Love To Hear From You If You Have Good knowledge of SQL querying including creation of stored procedures, views and functions. A degree in a computer science or related subject Experience with scoping client requests to create dynamic reports / dashboards within MS Power BI Experience of working in a client facing role and confidence in presenting technical solutions to non-technical users Demonstrate a proactive approach to learning new skills to keep pace with technology Strong analytical skills with ability to present and communicate data, trends, insights and make recommendations to all stakeholders Strong SQL Server skills when designing and querying databases with large datasets Experience with creating reports and dashboards using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) Youâ€™ll Stand Out If You Have The Following Experience in the design, implementation and testing of ETL packages using SSIS Understanding of data warehouse methodologies and concepts Experience of using languages such as Python or R Experience with cloud Platforms such as Azure Experience in developing with Microsoft technologies such as .Net, Asp.Net (Webforms\Mvc\Core) using C# What if we can? What if we can have work-life balance? What if we can be rewarded in ways that support our individual needs? What if we can be accepted for who we are? Here at WSP â€“ we can! WSP recognizes that work is only one part of our lives and making time for the other things in our life is important â€“ be that our families, our friends or ourselves. So, if working from home, working part-time or having flexible start and finish time will help with this let us know as part of your application. As well as rewarding you with competitive pay, WSP offers standard benefits including 25 days annual leave, pension schemes, life assurance, personal accident cover and paid professional subscriptions, and some not so standard benefits as part of our flexible benefits scheme â€“ so if you would like to hop on a new bike (cycle to work scheme) or thrill the family with your Lego building skills (Discount at Legoland Windsor) â€“ WSP can help! Be you, be happy - we strive to have a friendly and inclusive culture which respects and maximizes the contribution individuals can bring to WSP. We recognise the benefits that people with varying backgrounds and experiences can bring. VIBE (our LGBTQ+ Employee Resource Group) and our Gender Balance Group work with the business to help ensure we continue to promote the right environment to enable LGBT+ and female employees to reach their full potential, and to ensure we continue to promote equality, inclusivity and diversity for everyone. Here at WSP we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender confirmation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy or maternity/paternity. We will interview all disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria. In addition we support our people to achieve their personal health and well-being goals through our Thrive programme. About Us WSP is one of the world's leading engineering professional services firms providing technical consultancy to the built and natural environment. We believe that for societies to thrive, we must all hold ourselves accountable for tomorrow. For us, that means creating innovative solutions to the challenges the future will bring to the communities and environments where we live and work across the UK. We are locally dedicated and propelled by international brainpower. We are technical experts and strategic advisors, including engineers, technicians, scientists, architects, planners, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, programme and construction management professionals. Our experts design lasting solutions in the property & buildings, transportation & infrastructure, environment, industry, resources (including mining, and oil & gas) and power & energy sectors as well as project delivery and strategic consulting services. And safety and sustainability are embedded in everything that we do. Check out www.wsp.com for more info about the great work we do. Company Industry: Information Technology and Services
Description: Methods is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join our team on a permanent basis. This role will include some work on client sites and frequent visits to our main office in London or Bristol. For this role we are looking for mid-level Data Analyst to join our team. Please note due to current COVID restrictions this role will be remote working until restrictions have been lifted. Methods Since our establishment in 1990, Methods has partnered with a range of central government departments and agencies to transform the way the public sector operates in the UK. Our mission is to improve and safeguard public-facing services. We apply digital thinking to ensure the future of our public services is centred around our citizens. Our human touch sets us apart from other consultancies, system integrators and software houses - we have a customer-centric value system whereby we focus on delivering what is right for our clients. We passionately support our clients in the success of their projects while working collaboratively to share skillsets and solve complex problems. At Methods we have fun while working hard; we are not afraid of making mistakes and learning from them. Requirements The Data Analyst will be expected to work as part of a multi-disciplinary delivery team. The workload will be a blend of client assignments and internal development projects. They will be heavily involved throughout the analysis lifecycle, from designing the workflow through to implementation. The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical skills with an eye for detail and take pride in their work. They will ensure the quality of their own work and also that of others. We are looking for an individual that can work independently and take initiative to develop innovative solutions while working seamlessly within the wider team, delivering work to a high standard and meeting deadlines. The candidate will be expected to actively share knowledge and mentor more junior members of the team. Although they will have a portfolio of responsibilities specific to their area of expertise and grade, they will be expected to develop a set of skills, competencies, and knowledge to operate effectively within their role. The Data Analyst will: Produce data visualisations and provide clear interpretation to clients and other members of the team. Apply an analytical mindset to ensure complex information from a range of sources is appropriately analysed and interpreted. Build analytical pipelines using cloud technologies such as Azure Data Factory. Produce high-quality, efficient code for both data preparation and analysis. Formulate business problems into hypotheses for analysis, utilising innovative techniques to address these. Promote and apply data analytics to improve project delivery and assist other members of the team. Share knowledge with other members of the team. Confidently present complex analytical results in a clear and simple manner to key stakeholders, clients, and other team members. Contribute to the development of the company knowledge base and provide feedback on new knowledge artefacts. Provide effective face-to-face, online, telephone, and written communications with all levels of management and clients. Ideal Candidates will demonstrate: Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or similar field, with at least three further years of experience in data analysis, visualisation, and modelling. Track record of high quality, impactful data analytics. Analytical and problem-solving mindset, ensuring complex information from a range of sources is appropriately analysed and interpreted. Advanced knowledge of data management and pre-processing. Advanced knowledge and experience of using SQL within analytical pipelines. Ability to develop visual reports, dashboards and KPI scorecards using Power BI desktop including experience of using DAX. Ability to properly understand business requirements and develop data models accordingly. Knowledge and experience in prototyping, designing, and requirement analysis. Ability to draw insight from various data sources to solve business problems. Experience with version control and the use of best practices in a collaborative environment. Understanding of data governance principles, including security, privacy, and risk control. Strong organisational and time management skills. Ability to communicate results, techniques, and general issues to a technical and lay audience in a clear manner. Desirable Skills Working knowledge of the development of analytical pipelines using Microsoft Azure services. Experience with NoSQL, and graph databases. Experience with coding languages such as Python and R. Experience with machine learning and applied statistical techniques Experience with stakeholder engagement, technical clients, and people management. Experience of working within, or on behalf of, public sector organisations. Benefits Methods is passionate about its people; we want our colleagues to develop the things they are good at and enjoy. By joining us you can expect Autonomy to develop and grow your skills and experience Be part of exciting project work that is making a difference in society Strong, inspiring and thought-provoking leadership A supportive and collaborative environment As well as this, we offer: Development access to LinkedIn Learning, a management development programme and training Wellness 24/7 Confidential employee assistance programme Social - office parties, pizza Friday and commitment to charitable causes Time off 25 days a year Pension Salary Exchange Scheme with 4% employer contribution and 5% employee contribution Discretionary Company Bonus based on company and individual performance Life Assurance of 4 times base salary Private Medical Insurance which is non-contributory (spouse and dependants included) Worldwide Travel Insurance which is non-contributory (spouse and dependants included) Show more Show less

We are committed to promoting equal opportunities for growth and development regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability, or socio-economic background. About Mindweaver At Mindweaver it is our mission to bring diversity and antiracism to the world of emerging technology. At Mindweaver we are about empowerment, through opportunity, through technology, and through maximising our potential. We are particularly interested in hearing from more people of Black heritage, women, non-binary and LGBT folks; and those who are differently-abled. We would love to welcome you on board! Description: About The Role At WSP, thereâ€™s nothing we love more than pushing boundaries. Harnessing innovation and sharing insights across our diverse, international team to create a tomorrowâ€™s world that's cleaner, greener and safer. Join us and youâ€™ll be part of an organisation that takes pride in its people and purpose: creating long-lasting solutions to meet the needs of generations to come. Think bigger scale. Think higher profile. Think groundbreaking. Join WSP, and youâ€™ll be at the heart of a team of international experts all dedicated to growing and sharing their expertise, and working on projects that transform society for all of us. WSP is the UK's largest supplier of Land Referencing services and is looking for an individual wanting to start a career in the Digital Solutions team to work on our software systems and client projects. We work on the countries largest infrastructure projects with clients in a variety of sectors such as Road, Rail, Energy and Water. The role sits within the digital team which consists of support and data analysts, data consultants, software developers and technical solution consultants. Together the team focus on the use of and development of the systems used to support client deliverables. This role will work closely with other team members and our land consultants to ensure the data that is collected is of the highest quality and provide advice on how to improve the quality of our data. This will involve analysing data to suggest approaches for data cleansing, creating custom extracts of data to a specific requirement or building detailed reports for senior stakeholders within the business and our clients. Using your experience you will be responsible for the quality of data on a variety of our projects by highlighting trends and isolating issues. Proactively implementing approaches to improve quality, such as combining 3rd party datasets and guiding projects on the steps they should take to resolve any data issues. The role will involve using practical skills such as SQL to produce complex highly efficient database queries, views, and stored procedures as well as others, including Power BI and Python, to publish dynamic client reports and automate repetative tasks. WSP is looking for self-motivated individuals with strong verbal and written communication skills as the role requires building relationships with non-technical users and being able to translate their requirements into deliverables. A Typical Week Would Include Take responsibility for data quality across a variety of projects, reviewing and comparing them to ensure we are on track for delivery. Regularly reviewing data quality and defining approaches to combat common issues and system improvements. Presenting data to stakeholders within the business Work with the software development team to understand the data structures of our system to ensure reports can be produced efficiently and accurately. Communicating with non-technical users in a clear and concise fashion to provide advice about how to obtain the correct data from our systems. Promote the use of our systems with clients and internal users, becoming a subject matter expert Querying relational databases using SQL and creating reports using Power BI & SSRS Identify trends, provide insights and make recommendations on different aspects of the data Provide technical documentation to ensure the system can be effectively maintained We'd Love To Hear From You If You Have Good knowledge of SQL querying including creation of stored procedures, views and functions. A degree in a computer science or related subject Experience with scoping client requests to create dynamic reports / dashboards within MS Power BI Experience of working in a client facing role and confidence in presenting technical solutions to non-technical users Demonstrate a proactive approach to learning new skills to keep pace with technology Strong analytical skills with ability to present and communicate data, trends, insights and make recommendations to all stakeholders Strong SQL Server skills when designing and querying databases with large datasets Experience with creating reports and dashboards using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) Youâ€™ll Stand Out If You Have The Following Experience in the design, implementation and testing of ETL packages using SSIS Understanding of data warehouse methodologies and concepts Experience of using languages such as Python or R Experience with cloud Platforms such as Azure Experience in developing with Microsoft technologies such as .Net, Asp.Net (Webforms\Mvc\Core) using C# What if we can? What if we can have work-life balance? What if we can be rewarded in ways that support our individual needs? What if we can be accepted for who we are? Here at WSP â€“ we can! WSP recognizes that work is only one part of our lives and making time for the other things in our life is important â€“ be that our families, our friends or ourselves. So, if working from home, working part-time or having flexible start and finish time will help with this let us know as part of your application. As well as rewarding you with competitive pay, WSP offers standard benefits including 25 days annual leave, pension schemes, life assurance, personal accident cover and paid professional subscriptions, and some not so standard benefits as part of our flexible benefits scheme â€“ so if you would like to hop on a new bike (cycle to work scheme) or thrill the family with your Lego building skills (Discount at Legoland Windsor) â€“ WSP can help! Be you, be happy - we strive to have a friendly and inclusive culture which respects and maximizes the contribution individuals can bring to WSP. We recognise the benefits that people with varying backgrounds and experiences can bring. VIBE (our LGBTQ+ Employee Resource Group) and our Gender Balance Group work with the business to help ensure we continue to promote the right environment to enable LGBT+ and female employees to reach their full potential, and to ensure we continue to promote equality, inclusivity and diversity for everyone. Here at WSP we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender confirmation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy or maternity/paternity. We will interview all disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria. In addition we support our people to achieve their personal health and well-being goals through our Thrive programme. About Us WSP is one of the world's leading engineering professional services firms providing technical consultancy to the built and natural environment. We believe that for societies to thrive, we must all hold ourselves accountable for tomorrow. For us, that means creating innovative solutions to the challenges the future will bring to the communities and environments where we live and work across the UK. We are locally dedicated and propelled by international brainpower. We are technical experts and strategic advisors, including engineers, technicians, scientists, architects, planners, surveyors and environmental specialists, as well as other design, programme and construction management professionals. Our experts design lasting solutions in the property & buildings, transportation & infrastructure, environment, industry, resources (including mining, and oil & gas) and power & energy sectors as well as project delivery and strategic consulting services. And safety and sustainability are embedded in everything that we do. Check out www.wsp.com for more info about the great work we do. Company Industry: Information Technology and Services
Description: Methods is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join our team on a permanent basis. This role will include some work on client sites and frequent visits to our main office in London or Bristol. For this role we are looking for mid-level Data Analyst to join our team. Please note due to current COVID restrictions this role will be remote working until restrictions have been lifted. Methods Since our establishment in 1990, Methods has partnered with a range of central government departments and agencies to transform the way the public sector operates in the UK. Our mission is to improve and safeguard public-facing services. We apply digital thinking to ensure the future of our public services is centred around our citizens. Our human touch sets us apart from other consultancies, system integrators and software houses - we have a customer-centric value system whereby we focus on delivering what is right for our clients. We passionately support our clients in the success of their projects while working collaboratively to share skillsets and solve complex problems. At Methods we have fun while working hard; we are not afraid of making mistakes and learning from them. Requirements The Data Analyst will be expected to work as part of a multi-disciplinary delivery team. The workload will be a blend of client assignments and internal development projects. They will be heavily involved throughout the analysis lifecycle, from designing the workflow through to implementation. The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical skills with an eye for detail and take pride in their work. They will ensure the quality of their own work and also that of others. We are looking for an individual that can work independently and take initiative to develop innovative solutions while working seamlessly within the wider team, delivering work to a high standard and meeting deadlines. The candidate will be expected to actively share knowledge and mentor more junior members of the team. Although they will have a portfolio of responsibilities specific to their area of expertise and grade, they will be expected to develop a set of skills, competencies, and knowledge to operate effectively within their role. The Data Analyst will: Produce data visualisations and provide clear interpretation to clients and other members of the team. Apply an analytical mindset to ensure complex information from a range of sources is appropriately analysed and interpreted. Build analytical pipelines using cloud technologies such as Azure Data Factory. Produce high-quality, efficient code for both data preparation and analysis. Formulate business problems into hypotheses for analysis, utilising innovative techniques to address these. Promote and apply data analytics to improve project delivery and assist other members of the team. Share knowledge with other members of the team. Confidently present complex analytical results in a clear and simple manner to key stakeholders, clients, and other team members. Contribute to the development of the company knowledge base and provide feedback on new knowledge artefacts. Provide effective face-to-face, online, telephone, and written communications with all levels of management and clients. Ideal Candidates will demonstrate: Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or similar field, with at least three further years of experience in data analysis, visualisation, and modelling. Track record of high quality, impactful data analytics. Analytical and problem-solving mindset, ensuring complex information from a range of sources is appropriately analysed and interpreted. Advanced knowledge of data management and pre-processing. Advanced knowledge and experience of using SQL within analytical pipelines. Ability to develop visual reports, dashboards and KPI scorecards using Power BI desktop including experience of using DAX. Ability to properly understand business requirements and develop data models accordingly. Knowledge and experience in prototyping, designing, and requirement analysis. Ability to draw insight from various data sources to solve business problems. Experience with version control and the use of best practices in a collaborative environment. Understanding of data governance principles, including security, privacy, and risk control. Strong organisational and time management skills. Ability to communicate results, techniques, and general issues to a technical and lay audience in a clear manner. Desirable Skills Working knowledge of the development of analytical pipelines using Microsoft Azure services. Experience with NoSQL, and graph databases. Experience with coding languages such as Python and R. Experience with machine learning and applied statistical techniques Experience with stakeholder engagement, technical clients, and people management. Experience of working within, or on behalf of, public sector organisations. Benefits Methods is passionate about its people; we want our colleagues to develop the things they are good at and enjoy. By joining us you can expect Autonomy to develop and grow your skills and experience Be part of exciting project work that is making a difference in society Strong, inspiring and thought-provoking leadership A supportive and collaborative environment As well as this, we offer: Development access to LinkedIn Learning, a management development programme and training Wellness 24/7 Confidential employee assistance programme Social - office parties, pizza Friday and commitment to charitable causes Time off 25 days a year Pension Salary Exchange Scheme with 4% employer contribution and 5% employee contribution Discretionary Company Bonus based on company and individual performance Life Assurance of 4 times base salary Private Medical Insurance which is non-contributory (spouse and dependants included) Worldwide Travel Insurance which is non-contributory (spouse and dependants included) Show more Show less

In our financial services business, weâ€™ve built market-leading positions in a number of specialist investment sectors, including smaller companies, renewable energy, healthcare and property finance. We employ more than 750 people and manage more than Â£10 billion on behalf of more than 50,000 retail and institutional investors. At Octopus weâ€™re transforming the industries we operate in and improving the lives of millions of people. Weâ€™re a group of entrepreneurially-minded businesses, each built on the belief that people and the planet deserve better. Our group includes Octopus Energy, Octopus Real Estate, Octopus Investments, Octopus Ventures, Octopus Renewables, Octopus Wealth, Octopus Giving and Seccl. Life at Octopus is never dull. Weâ€™re an ambitious, people-first business that wants to make the world a better place. Because of this, we value energy, curiosity, resilience, and integrity. Weâ€™re different from most other companies you may have worked for. And weâ€™re always on the look-out for smart, talented people who share our values. Job Description Our systems and data are at the heart of everything that we do within the People team at Octopus. If you love solving problems with creative ideas, distilling complex information to mass audiences, whilst seeking out trends to improve life at Octopus then this is the role for you. You will be owner and superuser of all HR systems, responsible for ensuring data integrity and in charge of the implementation of a workforce analytics function within Octopus. This is an especially exciting time for us as we are about to go live with a complete HR System transformation with this role having a huge part to play in this project. Systems Ownership of the regular updates calendar for SaaS solutions in HR and ensure that the People Team are aware of and prepared for any down time etc. Be the superuser for all systems, responding to any system queries. Be first point of contact for IT. Project Management of the implementation any new systems. Manage on-going performance and development of HR systems. Work with wider People Team to identify system and functionality improvements. Work closely with vendors to deliver improvements and updates within a support environment. Focus on streamlining the end to end processes for employees and minimising / removing any manual hand-offs or interventions SME for People Technology within Octopus - network with counterparts in similar organisations. Identify and troubleshoot system problems through regular monitoring. Develop guidance documentation and provide training where required. Own change management and comms for any People Technology deployments and enhancements within the business Data Take a continual improvement approach to providing analytics to the People Team and wider business. SME for all People Analytics. Optimizing and implementing data processes and systems. Maintain HR data tools, reporting, and dashboards. Produce and deliver standard and customized HR reports. Respond to HR data requests on an ad hoc basis by gathering, analysing, and reporting relevant data from various sources. Description: Job Description DATA ANALYST Role overview: We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology Services team in either Belfast, Birmingham, Glasgow or Leeds.
